This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate.
The quest-giver is called Mirianne. Mirianne is a concerned wife.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to tell Mirianne whether you found information about Roe or not.
The player should first find information about Roe to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: the southern roads.
The following characters are related to this quest: Roe (Mirianne's husband).
The following locations are related to this quest: Amn (a country).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Roe went on a business trip to Amn.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"My husband had to make a sudden business trip to Amn and I'm so worried for him.
"Mirianne," he always said, "Mirianne, who knows the road better than old Roe?" But the highways just aren't as safe as they once were and there hasn't been a messenger from Amn here in months.
Could you keep your eyes open along the southern roads and let me know if you find anything?"
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate.
The quest-giver is called Nemphre. Nemphre is a flirty woman, who is located at Baldur's Gate.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to steal Arkion's amulet and bring it to Nemphre.
The player should first find Arkion's amulet to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Baldur's Gate, a large city.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: Scroll of Vampiric Touch.
The following characters are related to this quest: Arkion (a male necromancer, located at Baldur's Gate).
The following items are related to this quest: Arkion's amulet.
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Arkion was Nemphre's lover.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Mmm, be a sweet one. Could you do a favor for Nemphre?
An old lover of mine has followed me here to the city and has been threatening me with some very dark magic. His name is Arkion and, if you could just get a certain amulet of his to me, perhaps there are a few things I could do for you? Such as giving you a Scroll of Vampiric Touch, mmn?"
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate.
The quest-giver is called Lady Hannah. Lady Hannah is a noblewoman who is seething because of Ragefast, who is located at the town.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to investigate Ragefast and his nymph.
The player should first find Ragefast, a mage to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Ragefast's house, in the northwest part of the town.
The following characters are related to this quest: Ragefast (a powerful mage, located at Ragefast's house), nymph, a female fairy, located at Ragefast's house.
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Ragefast enslaved the nymph. Ragefast locked the nymph inside Ragefast's house.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"You may call me Lady Hannah. Ragefast! Oh, he makes me seethe! He's a mage on a power trip and what does he do?
He acquires his own personal nymph and enslaves her in his quarters! Seek him out and look into this matter immediately! His house is in the northwest part of town.
I wish you luck and all the passion of my fury in your task."
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate.
The quest-giver is called Berrun Ghastkill. Berrun Ghastkill is mayor of Nashkel, who is located at Nashkel.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to find out what caused miners to go missing and ore to become tainted.
The player should first descend into the mines to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: the mines, southeast of Nashkel.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: 900 gold pieces.
The following locations are related to this quest: Nashkel (a small town).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. There is an iron shortage.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I am Berrun Ghastkill, mayor of Nashkel.
I need someone to descend into the mines southeast of town and find what has caused our miners to go missing and our ore to become tainted. It won't solve everything, but it's the first step to easing the effects of the iron shortage.
The town can give you a reward of 900 gold pieces. We are a small community and that is all we can afford.
Please, go now and do what you can."
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate.
The quest-giver is called Ardrouine. Ardrouine is a distressed mother.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to save Ardrouine's little son from worgs.
The player should first go to the abandoned lighthouse to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: abandoned lighthouse to the northwest.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: 60 coins.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Please help me, I am just poor Ardrouine!
I don't know where else to turn. My little boy was playing in that abandoned lighthouse to the northwest when a pack of worgs surrounded it. Please just turn them back, and I can coax him down. There's not much time!
I can pay you 60 coins: this money is all my husband brought back from market this past week. My son's life is worth this and so much more."
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate.
The quest-giver is called Noralee. Noralee is a female warrior.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to bring Noralee's gauntlets to her.
The player should first find Noralee's gauntlets inside a shipping crate to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: between here and the harbor.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I'm Noralee.
I just had some new armor shipped in from a far-away city and I'm afraid I must have dropped the gauntlets into one of the shipping crates somewhere between here and the harbor.
Please, if you can find them before somebody else picks them up, I would be most grateful."

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate.
The quest-giver is called Joia. Joia is a woman who lost a precious item, who is located at Friendly Arms Inn.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to return Joia's Flamedance Ring to her.
The player should first find the hobgoblins who stole Joia's Flamedance Ring to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: north of the Friendly Arms Inn.
The following items are related to this quest: Flamedance Ring (a striking ring).
The following locations are related to this quest: Friendly Arms Inn (an inn).
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Hey there, you're new here, aren't you? Could I, Joia, trouble you a moment?
I need someone to go club some heads for me. I was ambushed by a band o' hobgoblins within sight of this inn's walls. Robbed me blind, they did, and I want to return the favor.
I don't care about most of my things, but I want to get my ring back. My father gave it to me, you understand? The creatures were just north of the inn. Bring my ring back here when you get it. You'll know it when you see it. It's a Flamedance Ring, and very striking."

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate.
The quest-giver is called Edwin. Edwin is a pompous wizard.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to kill Dynaheir.
The player should first find Dynaheir to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: west of Nashkel, near the gnoll stronghold.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: one year of Edwin's services as a wizard.
The following characters are related to this quest: Dynaheir (a treacherous female witch).
The following locations are related to this quest: Nashkel (a town).
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I am Edwin, a wizard, and I require you! (Yes, they will do nicely.)
I would have you kill a witch, the witch Dynaheir. She is treacherous, but with your participation I foresee no difficulty. Last I heard of her, she was traveling to the west of Nashkel, close to the gnoll stronghold located there. Will you assist?
The prize I offer would surely be beyond measure in your meager understanding. Your payment shall be one year of my services as a wizard. I am sure you agree that my guidance will be far more valuable than any monetary sum."

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate.
The quest-giver is called Drienne. Drienne is a young girl.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to bring Pixie to Drienne.
The player should first find Pixie to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: near the waterfall.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: a scroll.
The following characters are related to this quest: Pixie (Drienne's pet cat).
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I'm just a little girl Drienne.
Mommy says if you ever need to know something important, you should ask an adult. Pixie, my cat, she was playing close to the waterfall and slipped... I hope she's all right.
You can have this scroll Daddy gave me, if you find Pixie. I can't read the words yet anyways."

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate.
The quest-giver is called Hurgan Stoneblade. Hurgan Stoneblade is a man residing in Citadel Adbar.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to bring the "Soultaker" to Hurgan Stoneblade.
The player should first find the "Soultaker" to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Durlag's Tower, a trapped tower.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: an enchanted hammer.
The following characters are related to this quest: Durlag (a legendary hero who went mad after his family was killed), Hurgan Stoneblade's grandpa, Durlag's friend.
The following items are related to this quest: "Soultaker" (a dagger that belonged to Hurgan Stoneblade's grandpa).
The following locations are related to this quest: Citadel Adbar (a fortress).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Hurgan Stoneblade's grandpa was killed by a demon. Durlag intended to send "Soultaker" to Hurgan Stoneblade's mother. Durlag did not send "Soultaker": his family was replaced with doppelgangers and he was driven mad after killing the doppelgangers.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I am Hurgan Stoneblade, presently residing in Citadel Adbar. Have I got the adventure that'll make ye yearn for glory!
Ye have heard of Durlag's Tower, mayhaps? Me granda' was a good friend of Durlag's. Me granda' was slain by an evil demon but Durlag survived. Durlag kept "Soultaker" that had been me granda's. He was going to send it to me mother, but he was betrayed. A sad tale, that.
After Durlag built the tower his family was replaced by doppelgangers. Durlag killed them all but was driven mad by the act. He entrapped his tower heavily and forgot about me granda's dagger.
If ye be interested, I wish to hire ye to retrieve me granda's dagger, "Soultaker," me birthright.
An enchanted hammer I can offer ye for yer services."
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate.
The quest-giver is Joseph's worried wife.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to investigate Joseph's fate for his wife.
The player should first find Joseph to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: the mines.
The following characters are related to this quest: Joseph (a male miner, located at the mines).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Joseph wears a greenstone wedding ring on his left hand. Joseph went missing in the mines. Men have disappeared in the mines before.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"My husband is missing in the mines. All I know about the mines are that men keep on disappearing in their hellish depths.
My husband is one of the miners, but he hasn't been home for weeks. His name is Joseph, and he wears his wedding ring on his left hand. It's a greenstone ring.
Please, find him and tell me how he is doing!"

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate.
The quest-giver is called Delainy. Delainy is a historian, who is located at the village.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to bring the cloak to Delainy.
The player should first fetch the cloak to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: beyond the village walls.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: Delainy's gratitude.
The following items are related to this quest: the cloak.
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The cloak is an important symbol of old times. The cloak draped the village center. The recent storm moved the cloak beyond the village walls. There are beasts outside the village walls.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"My name is Delainy, and I am pleasured to meet ye. I seek the return of an item, more an icon.
No doubt you felt the storm that passed just by and by? Village-home did as well, and the cloak that draped the village center was cast to the wind. I think it is beyond the wall, and will not risk the beasts to get it. Will you?
I can offer little besides my gratitude. The cloak is a keepsake, a symbol of old times."

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate.
The quest-giver is called Ludrug. Ludrug is a gnoll.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to win the duel against Ludrug.
The player should first choose your champion to fight against Ludrug to complete their objective.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: gnolls let the player pass.
The following items are related to this quest: 50 gold.
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player has trespassed gnolls' territory with the player's party. The gnolls' demand 50 gold from the player, but the player doesn't have any money.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Stop! You have trespassed on our territory. You shall not be allowed to leave until you have paid tribute. We demand 50 gold in tribute!
No money? That is too bad for you. We let you go only if you win fight. Your best champion versus our best champion. Our best champion is Ludrug. Ludrug is me. Are you ready for fight? No matter, we fight now!
If you lose, you must die! If you win, we must let you pass! Tread carefully, we will be watching you."

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate.
The quest-giver is called Ramazith. Ramazith is a friendly wizard.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to free Ragefast's nymph and bring her to Ramazith.
The player should first enter Ragefast's house to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Ragefast's house.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: an enchanted item.
The following characters are related to this quest: Ragefast (a male wizard, located at Ragefast's house), Ragefast's nymph, a female nymph, one of the most beautiful and useful creatures in Faerûn, located at Ragefast's house.
The following locations are related to this quest: Faerûn (a continent).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Ragefast imprisoned Ragefast's nymph in Ragefast's house.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Greetings to you and yours, my friend. I'm Ramazith.
Might I have your ear a moment? My proposition is thus: I would have you enter into the home of a colleague of mine and effect the release of a creature he has imprisoned there. Ragefast be his name, and he has in his possession one of the most beautiful and useful creatures in all of Faerûn. It's a nymph he captured some time ago, and I know not what laughable plans he has for her, but I am sure she be more... productive in my care.
I not so rich as to be able to offer huge gold, but as competent wizard I do have the odd magical item of worth. Perhaps an enchanted item will serve your needs, no?"

The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: 250 gold pieces.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"The name's Arkion.
I've got a dirty deed fer ya. How 'bout you go down into the sewers and bring me up a body. Now, I don't ask questions 'bout how you come 'bout them and I don't want any questions 'bout what I use 'em fer. Bring 'em to me when ya find 'em.
There'll be 250 gold pieces to relieve the stink of it all."

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate.
The quest-giver is called Areana. Areana is a mysterious noblewoman.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to assassinate Cyrdemac.
The player should first find Cyrdemac to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Elfsong Tavern, a rough tavern.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: 2,000 gold.
The following characters are related to this quest: Cyrdemac (a man who blackmails Areana, located at Elfsong Tavern).
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Perhaps... perhaps you are the type of people who can help me. I am in need of someone to... perform a service for me. I need someone... removed. This scoundrel is no innocent! He threatens to ruin my life with... with the spreading of... accusations. He threatens to ruin my reputation and standing unless I pay him an exorbitant sum almost weekly! I beg of thee... you must help me. His name is Cyrdemac and he frequents the Elfsong Tavern. I have not been there myself, but I hear it is quite a rough place. You could do the deed in the main bar itself and likely none would call the guards. I know not if he will have friends with him though. Thank you for this.
Upon your return I shall pay you 2,000 gold. A small price to have this embarrassment removed."

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate.
The quest-giver is called Dryad of the Cloud Peaks. Dryad of the Cloud Peaks is a distressed dryad.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to save Dryad of the Cloud Peaks' ancient oak from dying.
The player should first stop a pair of people from attacking Dryad of the Cloud Peaks' ancient oak to complete their objective.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: a potion.
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Dryad of the Cloud Peaks dies if her ancient oak dies.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Please, kind spirits, a wondrous ancient oak is in peril. It is the tree to which I am bonded! If it dies, I, Dryad of the Cloud Peaks, die.
It is about to be attacked by two who would defile the majesty of nature. They have avoided my charms and must be stopped before irreparable harm is done. Would you heed my plea?
There is a potion that might help you on your journeys."

The player should first find something belonging to Nester to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: upriver, along the east bank, north of the bitch priestess.

This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I'm Quinn. There's some ankhegs causin' chaos upriver, alon' the east bank, just north o' that bitch priestess.
They took down my pal, Nester, and dang near hauled me under too. 'At's why I'm so glum now. Nester's mama's gonna want somepin' of 'is to bury, but I'm still gettin' too many nightmares and all to go back there."

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate.
The quest-giver is called G'axir the Seer. G'axir the Seer is a seer.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to bring a sphene gem to G'axir the Seer.
The player should first find a sphene gem to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: the lair of the basilisk.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Your future... is hemmed in darkness.
Your lives... are in the balance.
Act wisely, act judiciously... and bring me the sphene gem, should you find it...
You... are a light entering darkness.
You... are a seeker of truths.
You... are more than you realize.
The Seer has spoken it because the Seer knows the fear you harbor, the fear you shall yet become.
In the lair of the basilisk, you will find a sphene gem... You would do well to bring it to the Seer."

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate.
The quest-giver is called Tremain Belde'ar. Tremain Belde'ar is Lord Priest of Tymora.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to bring Casson's body to Tremain Belde'ar.
The player should first retrieve Casson's body to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Water Queen's House, a temple.
The following characters are related to this quest: Casson (the dead son of Tremain Belde'ar, located at Water Queen's House), Tymora (the goddess of luck).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Casson was killed for trespassing the Water Queen's House. Tremain Belde'ar wants to resurrect Casson.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Greetings to you. I am Lord Priest Tremain Belde'ar, a humble servant of Our Smiling Lady Tymora.
My request of you is an odd and very dangerous one. I will not hold you to it if you deem it too extreme. I would have you enter the Water Queen's House and retrieve my son's, Casson's, body. Casson sought to indulge his restless nature by sneaking about the place, and a high price was paid.
You must bring Casson's body to me, that I may restore his life to him."

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate.
The quest-giver is called Tiber. Tiber is a young, scared man.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to investigate what happened to Chelak.
The player should first find Chelak to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: spider colony, in Cloakwood.
The following characters are related to this quest: Chelak (Tiber's brother, located at Cloakwood).
The following items are related to this quest: "Spider's Bane" (a sword that was created to kill spiders).
The following locations are related to this quest: Cloakwood (a forest).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Chelak found "Spider's Bane". Chelak went to Cloakwood to clear the spider colony with "Spider's Bane".
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"He-hello, travelers. I'm Tiber. Could... could I take up some of your time? I would be very grateful if you would just listen to... if you would just help me!
It's my brother, you see. He and I went into the Cloakwood to clear the woods of the spider colony that infests it. I know it sounds foolish... but my brother had found the sword "Spider's Bane"! The sword was created to kill spiders... and we thought we could become famous... the heroes of Cloakwood, and all that. But my brother hasn't returned yet... and it's been more than a week.
Please, could you go into the woods and find him for me? His name's Chelak. My mother would be so shattered if Chelak were to be dead."

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate.
The quest-giver is called Landrin. Landrin is a woman.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to deal with the spider infestation in Landrin's cellar.
The player should first kill spiders, and fetch Landrin's husband's boots and Landrin's bottle of wine to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Landrin's house in Beregost, west of the Jovial Juggler Inn.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: 120 gold pieces for fetching Landrin's husband's old boots, something extra for bodies of spiders and Landrin's bottle of wine.
The following items are related to this quest: Landrin's husband's boots, Landrin's bottle of wine.
The following locations are related to this quest: Beregost (a town), Jovial Juggler Inn (an inn in Beregost).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Landrin gives the player antidote potions against poison.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Hey, I'm Landrin.
I've got an infestation of poisonous spiders in my cellar in Beregost. You'll know the house when you see it: just to the west of the Jovial Juggler Inn.
Here, take these potions with you. They're antidotes against the poison.
Keep whatever you don't use and I'll give you an extra 120 gold pieces if you bring back my husband's old boots that he keeps down there. If you bring back one of their bodies and my ol' bottle of wine as well, I might toss in a little something extra too."

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate.
The quest-giver is called Brevlik. Brevlik is a discreet man.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to steal a telescope without hurting anyone, just like Danilo Thann of Waterdeep.
The player should first find the telescope to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Hall of Wonders, a museum.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: 500 gold.
The following characters are related to this quest: Danilo Thann of Waterdeep (a famous thief).
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"HELLO! SHHH! Shh... ah... um... I mean, hello.
Might I have but a moment of your, ah, time? I should like to procure your talents for a, ah, unique service, though it's not like you would have to do anything socially untoward. Okay, it's stealing, but it's only the one item: A wondrously curious little toy from distant land. What did they call it? Oh, yes, a "telescope," of all things. It's a misleading name for such an interestingly crafted artifact. "Golden Extra-Farseer" would have suited its craftsmanship so much better. The tele-thingy is on display at the Hall of Wonders, and were it in the possession of anyone else it might be purchasable. It's roguery on par with Danilo Thann of Waterdeep, and I don't want anybody hurt.
I'll pay you well: 500 gold for one night's work. It's better than you could hope for in a year on the docks!"
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate.
The quest-giver is called Mad Arcand the Stinking. Mad Arcand the Stinking is a happy and insane wizard.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to bring Mad Arcand the Stinking's ring to him.
The player should first find Mad Arcand the Stinking's ring to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: pirate ship by the ocean.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: a bottle that can burn the player.
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Mad Arcand the Stinking's ring is cursed.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I like you, yes I do (wertle, wertle, wertle, wooo...) and I know of a way to make you like me too (wertle, wertle, wertle-wooooo...).
Down by the ocean, down by the sea, there's a pirate ship waiting for you and for me. Bring me what's in it, but don't ever wear it, or sure enough, soon enough, you'll wertle too... A beautiful ring! Where to get it? (Most likely quite near where exactly I put it...) Wertle, oh wertle, oh dear wertle-wooo... wertle, oh wertle, oh woo...
Oh, I know what you're thinking of Mad Arcand the Stinking who takes what you give him and gives not in return. So there is this bottle, but please don't topple or (wertle, poor wertle), you'll surely get burned."

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate.
The quest-giver is called Cordyr. Cordyr is a fisherman from down south, where the Cloud Peaks tumble into the sea.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to kill the sirines that sank Cordyr's fishing boat.
The player should first find the sirines to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: down south, where the Cloud Peaks tumble into the sea.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: a haste scroll.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Pleasure to meet you. The name's Cordyr.
I'm from down south, where the Cloud Peaks tumble into the sea. A pair of sirines has been trying to move into the area. They sank my fishing boat and put me right out of work. *sigh* If they weren't so dang beautiful, it would be a lot easier to convince people of how much of a nuisance they can be. Can you kill them for me? It's a dirty deed but it's the cost of civilization, isn't it?
You can have a haste scroll as payment."

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate.
The quest-giver is called Ordulinian. Ordulinian is a priest, who is located at Baldur's Gate.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to steal Arkion's Bloodstone Amulet and Nemphre's Onyx Ring, and bring them to Ordulinian.
The player should first find Arkion's Bloodstone Amulet and Nemphre's Onyx Ring to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Baldur's Gate, a large city.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: Cloak of Non-Detection (a useful cloak).
The following characters are related to this quest: Arkion (a male necromancer, located at Baldur's Gate), Nemphre (a female necromancer, located at Baldur's Gate).
The following items are related to this quest: Bloodstone Amulet (an amulet), Onyx Ring (a ring).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Arkion and Nemphre used to be lovers. Arkion wants Nemphre's Onyx Ring. Nemphre wants Arkion's Bloodstone Amulet.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Ah, fair adventurers, I'm Ordulinian.
The roads of this fair city are lined with fools, are they not? Two of the greatest are Arkion and Nemphre, necromancers grown bitter over lost love. Alas, but they use petty trinkets as their excuse for enmity. Nemphre covets Arkion's Bloodstone Amulet and Arkion dreams of her Onyx Ring. Steal those trinkets and bring them to me and perhaps those two fools can at last find peace.
For your troubles I will give you a Cloak of Non-Detection. It may be of some use to you in the future."
<|endoftext|>

The player should first kill a white wolf to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Cloudpeak ice fields, a bit to the south from here.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: good money.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I am but a humble merchant. Interested in a little business on the side, friend?
I've a man who swears by his grandmother he glimpsed a white wolf up in the Cloudpeak ice fields. It was but a short ways south, and she be easy pickings for a smart sword.
I'd pay you good money for its pelt, so it's a guaranteed sale if you go.
Keep it in mind on your travels."

The player should first kill Zordral to complete their objective.
The following characters are related to this quest: Bentha (a female witch, located at Bentha's tent).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player walked on Zordral while he tried to kill Bentha. Zordral believes that Bentha is evil. Zordral thinks that the player is a threat to him and tries to kill the player too.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"You there, stay back! If any of you come any closer, I'll kill her. I'm serious. Don't make me do it. All I have to do is say the last word of my spell and she'll die.
She's a witch. She'll use her magics to poison the children of this town. She'll butcher the livestock and she'll seduce the young men, make them her puppets. She must be killed!
Are you mocking me?! No one mocks the great Zordral. You will pay for your insolence!"

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate.
The quest-giver is called Alatos Thuibuld. Alatos Thuibuld is the leader of the Thieves' Guild, who is located at Baldur's Gate.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to steal spellbook, statuette, and artifact fragment, and bring them to Alatos Thuibuld.
The player should first go to Oberan's Estate to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Oberan's Estate, a house inhabited by Shandalar's daughters.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: a lot of gold, a magical weapon or two if the player performs well.
The following characters are related to this quest: Shandalar (a local male wizard, located at Baldur's Gate), Grand Duchess Liia Jannath (a powerful female noble, located at Baldur's Gate).
The following items are related to this quest: spellbook, statuette, and artifact fragment.
The following groups are related to this quest: Thieves' Guild (a guild of thieves), Halruaans (a race of people).
The following locations are related to this quest: Baldur's Gate (a city-state).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Shandalar lives inside a Halruaan skyship. Shandalar knows how to produce Halruaan skyships: Shandalar plans to sell the knowledge of building Halruaan skyships to Grand Duchess Liia Jannath. Halruaans do not want others to obtain their skyships. Spellbook, statuette, and artifact fragment are the ingredients needed to keep the skyships aloft: Shandalar's daughters have them.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I am Alatos Thuibuld, though I thank you not to mention that too often.
A local wizard by the name of Shandalar makes his home in a moored Halruaan skyship. It would appear that he has the knowledge to reproduce these flying marvels and is currently organizing the sale of the recipe to Grand Duchess Liia Jannath. He has drawn up a set of rituals and has procured an artifact fragment and an ancient statuette vital to the spell that keeps the ships aloft. These he has divided amongst his daughters until the deal is to proceed. I have been contacted by a representative of the Halruaans, and they have no wish to see scores of flying ships manufactured in every port. You are to infiltrate the place of exchange that is known as Oberan's Estate, steal the ingredients, and return here with them. Simple enough.
You would be well paid. Enough gold to give you a backache and, if I am well pleased, mayhaps a magical weapon or two. Perhaps a little more, perhaps a little less. It entirely depends upon your performance."
<|endoftext|>

This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
""Sweet waters of the forest
flow through each den and glade
nourishing the unicorns
who lie graceful in the shade..."

I'm Rinnie, a bard and balladeer.
I have been working on a ballad about the Unicorn Run in the High Forest. I'd like to use a more reliable source than simply hearsay and folklore, though. If you ever find an authoritative history of the run in your travels, I'd love to get my hands on it.

The following items are related to this quest: 500 gold.
The following locations are related to this quest: Durlag's Tower (a tourist attraction).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Delsvirftanyon sells things for the tourists in the Durlag's Tower, but bandits on the road keep people away. Delsvirftanyon has ward tokens of all shapes and sizes.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I'm Delsvirftanyon, a merchant by trade.
I sell the small and shinies for the tourists in the Durlag's Tower but there are none now there! Bandits on the roads keep the people off and away so I'm stuck with all this stock I am. Ward tokens I have of all shapes and size. Some I found by elven ruin and some I made myself I made. Maybe some good or maybe all bad but don't they all look pretty? I tell you what I will. I'll sell you everything I have you buy for low low price of 500 gold is all. Then I go home where they appreciate a bauble shine.
Buy or no and walk the walk?"

We've not much money, but I'll gladly give you a... magical weapon from my grandfather's adventuring days. It's a meager amount for your trouble, but it would be a great service to us.
Will you help a group of poor fishermen? She hides out near a small shack to the north. Watch yer back and act quickly; she's tricky."

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate.
The quest-giver is called Scar. Scar is second-in-command of the Flaming Fist, who is located at the Flaming Fist barracks.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to discover what's been happening with the disappearing citizens, and come see Scar.
The player should first patrol and find an entrance to the sewers to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: the east of the city.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: 300 gold in advance, 1,000 gold bonus.
The following groups are related to this quest: Flaming Fist (a mercenary organization promoting order and law).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Scar knows the player. Every night people have been disappearing from the streets of the city. Possible tracks of a many-legged centipede-like monster have been found.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"It is I, Scar, second-in-command of the Flaming Fist. I have another job you might be interested in. You'll be well paid for your services.
The problem is this: Every night people have been disappearing from the streets of the city. My men have been scouring the city trying to find the culprit, but so far to no avail. People have begun to get scared, and very few are willing to leave their homes at night. Something has to be done, and quickly. Would you be willing to take the job? I'd pay you 300 gold in advance with a 1,000 gold bonus if you discover what's been happening with the disappearing citizens.
Your job is really simple. All I want you to do is patrol the east of the city and find an entrance to the sewers. Perhaps you'll get lucky and find out what's been happening. If you do find out what's been happening, come to see me at the Flaming Fist barracks. Our only clue so far has led us to the sewers, so if you want to explore them first, it would probably be a good idea. Also, we've found tracks of some many-legged creature, perhaps a centipede-like monster."
<|endoftext|>

The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to investigate Irlentree and Zorl Miyar, and report back to Aldeth Sashenstar.
The player should first go with Aldeth Sashenstar, let him introduce you as his old friend and quarter you in the guest chambers to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Merchants' League Estate, the headquarters of the Merchants' League.
The following characters are related to this quest: Irlentree, Zorl Miyar (Aldeth Sashenstar's business partners, located at the Merchants' League Estate).
The following groups are related to this quest: Merchants' League (a business company).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player saved Aldeth Sashenstar on his hunting trip. Aldeth Sashenstar thinks that Irlentree and Zorl Miyar have become different people when he was gone: they spend their and Aldeth Sashenstar's company's resources on frivolous and stupid ideas.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"It is so pleasant to see your face once again. Don't you recognize me? It is I, Aldeth Sashenstar. I am so glad to have met you, especially at a time like this. I need to speak with you privately.
I'm sorry for all of this hiding and skulking, but there are dire events afoot. You know that I am one of the principal shareholders of the Merchants' League. Well, I share ownership of the company with two others: Irlentree and Zorl Miyar, two very distinguished gentlemen. When I returned from my hunting trip — thanks to you, I might add — I found that my two partners had undergone some profound changes, nothing physical or overt, but something far more sinister.
It's as if my partners had become wholly different people while I was gone. They almost take an active interest in squandering our company's resources on frivolous and stupid ideas. If they continue on this course, the company will be in shambles in but a few weeks. I know you have already helped me once, but I ask for your assistance again. I have no other recourse.
Come into the Merchants' League Estate with me. I will explain that you are an old friend of mine and will quarter you in the guest chambers. From there, please investigate my partners, perhaps using magic or any of the other skills you possess. Learn as much as you can during your visit and then report back to me after you're done. It should only take a couple of days."
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate.
The quest-giver is called Lena. Lena is Sam's unkempt female friend.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to save Sam from dying.
The player should first take Sam to Gellana Mirrorshade to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Temple of Wisdom, a temple.
The following characters are related to this quest: Sam (a badly injured man, located at with Lena), Gellana Mirrorshade (a priestess who can help Sam, located at the Temple of Wisdom).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Lena and Sam have been wandering in the wilderness.  Sam will join the player.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Please wait a moment, kind traveler! You've got to help me!
My name is Lena. You must forgive me for my appearance, but I've been wandering the wilderness for more than a week now.
My friend is badly hurt, and he might die if he doesn't get assistance soon. His name is Sam. If you were to take him to Gellana Mirrorshade at the Temple of Wisdom, she'd help him.
Please, can you do this?"

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate.
The quest-giver is called Gerde. Gerde is a ranger.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to kill exactly 4 ankhegs.
The player should first find 4 ankhegs to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: fifty yards to the east.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: 75 gold pieces.
The player will encounter the following enemies during this quest: 4 ankhegs.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I'm Gerde, a ranger.
You've come here to fight ankhegs? Well, listen up: it's mating season, so it's primarily females coming up to the surface, looking to put on a little extra weight. They're hungry, they're aggressive, and there are a lot of them. Now, the point of this exercise is not to exterminate them, but to keep their population to a manageable level. Remember, they aerate the soil and thereby improve crop yields by as much as 15%. Food is going to be scarce enough in the next few years, so keep that in mind when you're out there. No more than four ankhegs per party. After that it's catch and release, all right? Most of the activity starts about fifty yards to the east.
Now move out, everyone. You'll get 75 gold pieces, if you stick to the quota."

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate.
The quest-giver is called Mendas of Waterdeep. Mendas of Waterdeep is a strange scholar.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to travel to Balduran's Island to find Balduran's logbook for Mendas of Waterdeep.
The player should first obtain the sea charts from the sea captain to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Merchants' League Counting House, northeast section of Baldur's Gate, northeast from Elfsong Tavern.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: treasure.
The following characters are related to this quest: Balduran (a legendary hero), sea captain, located at Merchants' League Counting House.
The following items are related to this quest: Balduran's logbook (logbook), sea charts.
The following groups are related to this quest: Merchants' League (a merchants' guild).
The following locations are related to this quest: Balduran's Island, a small island, Baldur's Gate (a large city), Elfsong Tavern (a tavern).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The Merchants' League found Balduran's shipwreck on Balduran's Island. Mendas of Waterdeep wants to get Balduran's logbook before the merchants destroy it while they search for treasure. The Merchants' League keeps the sea charts locked up. Mendas of Waterdeep will give the player some gold to obtain the sea charts.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I am Mendas of Waterdeep, quester of small truth in this land. I am in need of favor from you. Can you help a gentle fellow in search for knowledge?
The Merchants' League sailors found Balduran's shipwreck on a small island. I wish to recover the ship's logbook. I will solve mystery of Balduran's final voyage. Merchants' League will destroy my artifacts to get treasure. This must not happen! If you help me, I get things precious to me, you get treasure, merchant men get nothing. You will help, yes?
These men that find island, they keep the sea charts locked up. In Baldur's Gate, there is building in northeast section of city called Merchants' League Counting House. To find it, just go northeast from Elfsong Tavern. The sea charts, they are in there. Most likely, captain of ship will have them. I don't know such things as chart retrieval, but you are hero, and it is no problem for heroes.
There might be small danger, so I give you some gold for the charts."

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate.
The quest-giver is called Hull. Hull is a guardsman manning the gates.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to fetch Hull's sword.
The player should first find Hull's sword in his chest to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: on the right side of the barracks.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: 20 gold pieces.
The following characters are related to this quest: Dreppin (a male farmer), Nessa (Dreppin's cow).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Hull knows the player. There is an antidote in Hull's chest: Dreppin needs an antidote for Nessa.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Hey, kid, it's me, Hull.
I woke late this morning and left my sword in the barracks before going on duty. If you want to get it for me, it's in the chest at the foot of my bed on the right side of the barracks. Quick now, before the Gatewarden catches me without it.
You'll also find an antidote there. I think Dreppin needs one for old Nessa.
You'll get 20 gold pieces for saving my skin from the Chief."

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate.
The quest-giver is called Eldoth. Eldoth is a traveling bard.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to capture Skie with Eldoth.
The player should first help Skie escape from her father to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Baldur's Gate, a big city.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: hoards of blackmail cash from Entar Silvershield.
The following characters are related to this quest: Skie (Eldoth's female lover, located at Baldur's Gate), Entar Silvershield (one of the dukes of Baldur's Gate, and Skie's father, located at Baldur's Gate).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Eldoth and the player can blackmail money from Entar Silvershield after capturing Skie. Eldoth will join the player's party.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I'm Eldoth, a traveling bard. Pleased to make your acquaintance. You look like the type to be on the outlook for ways to improve the quality of your life.
Well, I have a proposal that could help you in that endeavor. You see, there's a girl, my lover in fact, who desires to escape her father and live on her own. Her father is Entar Silvershield, one of the dukes of Baldur's Gate. This, of course, makes her desires more difficult than that of the average city girl.
However, with your assistance, we could help her escape the tyrannical clutches of Entar. Here's the punchline: Since Entar's going to be hunting us anyway, we can blackmail him for hoards of cash and not worry about our captive escaping. After all, we're doing it all for the sake of Skie.
Now, we needn't go about this right away. In fact, I'll help you with whatever you're doing until you decide to head up to Baldur's Gate. Just think of it as one favor deserving another."

Have you heard? There's a rogue ogre with a belt fetish to the south of the Friendly Arm Inn. I had to bargain my new girdle of piercing for my life out there. Wasn't even interested in an autographed copy of my book. Hey, if you can get that belt back to me, I'd be mighty grateful.
You'll get 95 gold pieces for your trouble, and a new history book I've just completed."

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate.
The quest-giver is called Lothander. Lothander is Marek's partner in crime.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to get an antidote before you die of Marek's poison.
The player should first talk to Haspur who can possibly reverse Lothander's geas to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: the market square.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: an antidote.
The following characters are related to this quest: Marek (an evil man), Haspur (a male divider, located at the marker square).
The following groups are related to this quest: Iron Throne (a shady merchant organization).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Marek has poisoned the player: the player has 10 days to live. Lothander wants to help the player get an antidote to the poison. Lothander was forced to work for the Iron Throne with a geas.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I am Lothander.
I do not wish you harm. My partner, Marek, has poisoned you. While you slept, he slipped a slow-acting magical poison into your food. You have about ten days to live. Common priest spells won't help you. Only one thing can, and that's the antidote. I can help you find it, if you help me first.
My problem is this: I don't work for the Iron Throne because I wish to but rather because I have been forced. I have been enspelled with a geas. If I do not obey everything that Marek orders of me the spell will take effect and I shall waste away. I need a way to rid myself of the spell. I know of a diviner at the market square who may have the answers I seek, but I don't have the money to pay him. Will you help me?"

There are some important facts concerning this quest. Ike Cascadion Vendar is leading a tour to Durlag's Tower. The tour to Durlag's Tower costs 60 gold.

"Step right up folks and HEAR the tale of dread placed before thee. Join with me as I, adventurer extraordinaire Ike Cascadion Vendar, lead yet another group of brave souls through the very SEAT of danger in the realms. To Durlag's Tower we shall go, and witness the perils that have taken the lives of hundreds of courageous men and women.
SEE the horror of the treacherous traps! FEEL the presence of the long languishing dead! MARVEL at the wondrous wealth buried below! NOT for the weak of spirit as I will NOT be held accountable for any heart failure during OR after our expedition! Step up, step up! One at a TIME!
A special package deal of 60 gold for you, not that you would need a discount."

The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: 30 gold per dead bandit, a share of booty, if there's no one left alive to claim it.

It seems that one of the caravans under my protection never arrived at Baldur's Gate, and I need to know what happened. I've been having a lot of problems with bandit activity lately, but they've always only taken the cargo and let the caravan go afterward.
I'll pay each of you 30 gold per dead bandit, plus a share of any booty, if there's no one left alive to claim it."

Forgive me. My name is Magreb. Rilsa and I have watched over this area for years, and we never had any trouble with goblins before. Since they killed her, I've been half out of my mind with grief.

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate.
The quest-giver is called Degrodel. Degrodel is a pompous wizard.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to bring the Helm of Balduran to Degrodel.
The player should first unpetrify the mercenaries to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: the art collector's estate, west of the fairgrounds, in the center of Baldur's Gate.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: 5,000 gold.
The following characters are related to this quest: Ramazith (a male wizard), art collector, a man.
The following items are related to this quest: Helm of Balduran (the helmet of a legendary hero).
The following groups are related to this quest: mercenaries, a group of evil men.
The following locations are related to this quest: Baldur's Gate (a major city).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Mercenaries were petrified while trying to break into the home of Ramazith: Ramazith sold the mercenaries to an art collector. Degrodel gives the player six scrolls of stone to flesh to unpetrify the mercenaries. One of the mercenaries has the Helm of Balduran.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"First of all, my name is Degrodel. I have been on the lookout for skilled adventurers. My task is very simple.
Some years ago, an evil band of mercenaries were all petrified while trying to break into the home of Ramazith. For those of you with a limited vocabulary, petrified means "turned to stone." Anyhow, one of those adventurers had in his possession an item of power: the Helm of Balduran. Ramazith didn't know this at the time and so, after turning them all to stone, he simply sold their bodies to an art collector living in the heart of Baldur's Gate.
What I would like you to do is find these statues, turn them back to flesh, and take the item. I will give you these six scrolls of stone to flesh. Use them on the statues when you find them.
The estate can be found just west of the fairgrounds in the center of town. Good luck, and don't entertain any thoughts about betraying me. It could be very hazardous to your health.
You will be paid 5,000 gold for this service. This is a kingly sum, so I won't barter with you about the amount."

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate.
The quest-giver is called Scar. Scar is second-in-command of the Flaming Fist, who is located at the Flaming Fist compound.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to investigate the Seven Suns, and report back to Scar.
The player should first break into the Seven Suns compound to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: the Seven Suns compound.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: 2,000 gold.
The following characters are related to this quest: Jhasso (the head of the Seven Suns, and an old friend of Scar, located at the Seven Suns compound).
The following groups are related to this quest: Seven Suns (an important trading coster in Baldur's Gate), Flaming Fist (a mercenary organization promoting order and law), Grand Dukes (a group of nobles who rule over Baldur's Gate).
The following locations are related to this quest: Baldur's Gate (a city).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The leadership of the Seven Suns have acted strangely lately by selling off valuable assets and neglecting many profitable trading ventures. Scar talked with Jhasso, but Jhasso rudely rebuffed Scar. Use stealth while investigating the Seven Suns compound.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"First off, let me introduce myself. I'm Scar, second-in-command of the Flaming Fist.
I need you to begin an investigation of the Seven Suns trading coster. The Seven Suns leadership has been acting strangely of late. They've been selling off valuable assets and neglecting many of their more profitable trading ventures. Considering the importance that the trading coster holds over the economy of the city, the Grand Dukes are noticeably upset. I've gone to talk to the coster's head, Jhasso. He rudely rebuffed me, telling me to mind my own business. I've known Jhasso for many years, and this isn't his usual behavior. I can't start up an official investigation, as there is no real reason for doing so. That's why I need you.
I want you to break into the Seven Suns compound and find out what's wrong. Use stealth in your investigations; I don't want this operation to cause too much fuss. The most important person to watch for is Jhasso.
Once you've found out as much as possible, report back to me at the Flaming Fist compound.
I'll pay you 2,000 gold for this favor."
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate.
The quest-giver is called Melicamp of Beregost. Melicamp of Beregost is a mage adept in the mystical arts.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to turn Melicamp of Beregost back into a human from a chicken.
The player should first talk to Thalantyr to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: High Hedge, a tower directly to the west of Beregost.
The following characters are related to this quest: Thalantyr (a powerful mage, and Melicamp of Beregost's master, located at High Hedge).
The following locations are related to this quest: Beregost (a town).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Melicamp of Beregost was turned into a chicken by a spell gone wrong. Melicamp of Beregost will nest in the player's pack.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Buc-becaw! HELLLLP-becaw! I am "no ordinary talking chicken," and I am in need of your *cluck* help. I am Melicamp of Beregost, a *cluck* mage adept in the mystical arts.
A... misread... incantation seems to be *cluck* the source of my troubling form. 'Tis been over a month since I *cluck* uttered a polymorph spell, and I simply cannot return to my normal *cluck* form!
There is a tower directly to the west of *cluck* Beregost, about which can be found the mage Thalantyr. I am his apprentice, and I am certain he will *cluck* aid me. I'll just nestle in your pack until we get there."
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate.
The quest-giver is called Therella. Therella is a worried mother.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to find out what happened to Dalton.
The player should first find Dalton to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Durlag's Tower, a dangerous tower owned by Durlag.
The following characters are related to this quest: Dalton (Therella's son who wants to be a hero, located at Durlag's Tower), Galken (a male con-artist), Durlag (a mad male dwarf).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Dalton went on an adventure to Durlag's Tower. Dalton and his fellow adventurers bought a ward token from Galken. Dalton did not return from Durlag's Tower.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Greetings, adventurer. I have, or perhaps I should say had, a son named Dalton. He fell in with a crew of adventurers from Waterdeep. Dalton was always obsessed with the idea of being a hero.
Alas, he has neither the brains nor the ability. Such is a mother's lot in life, however, to watch her children perform acts of idiocy despite her warnings or concerns.
He and his thick-skulled cohorts took it upon themselves to plumb the depths of Durlag's Tower. They bought a ward token from that shyster, Galken, and made ready to leave. Though I begged and cried, Dalton still insisted on going. The band never returned. I fear that they were destroyed by the mad dwarf's machinations. That is the tale, sad but true.
Please find my son if he still lives."

Prism's fate is of less importance."

The following characters are related to this quest: Dynaheir (a woman, located at the gnoll stronghold), Boo (Minsc's pet hamster, located at with Minsc).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Minsc, Boo, and Dynaheir traveled far to explore this land. Gnolls have captured Dynaheir. Minsc and Boo will join the player.

"Greetings, we are Minsc and Boo. Boo is my faithful hamster companion, and more than he seems.
We have traveled far to explore this land, but now my charge Dynaheir has been taken from us. 'Twas gnolls, and once we have tracked them I will beat sense into their heads until they release her.
Accompany us, and bards will sing the deeds of Minsc and Boo... and friends.
Onward to the gnoll stronghold in the west!"

The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: nothing.
The following characters are related to this quest: Nathan (Brun's son).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Nathan and his friends disappeared some days ago.

I'm farmer Brun. It's strange happenings at my farm, and I've not the strength I once had. I've nothing to offer, and even if I did I doubt such as you would have need of it. My son Nathan and his friends went looking for our missing cattle, then they just up and disappeared! Been gone for days now and, with all the bandits around, who knows what's happened. I don't know where they were heading, but I saw some sort o' tracks to the west.
Please find Nathan. I can't afford to keep the farm without my son."

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate.
The quest-giver is called Coran. Coran is a suave thief and archer.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to bring the wyvern's head to the mayor of Beregost.
The player should first find the wyvern's nest with Coran and kill the wyvern to complete their objective.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: 2,000 gold.
The following characters are related to this quest: the mayor of Beregost, located at Beregost.
The player will encounter the following enemies during this quest: wyvern (a dragon-like creature with a barbed tail).
The following locations are related to this quest: Beregost (a city).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player met Coran in this wood. The mayor of Beregost hired Coran to hunt down a dragon with a barbed tail: Coran knows that dragons do not have barbed tails.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"It's refreshing to find other people in this wood. I am Coran, thief and archer!
I've been alone in the wilderness for far too long. I wouldn't mind returning to the big city, but I have yet to collect my bounty. I'd share the reward with the lot of you if you would help hasten the hunt.
The deal is this: I've been hired out by the mayor of Beregost to hunt down a great winged dragon that's been plaguing the caravan routes. He's offered 2,000 gold for its head. Now before you get cold feet, let me allay your fears. The only descriptions of the beast have always mentioned its deadly barbed tail. From what I know about dragons they don't have barbs on their tails — that's something unique to wyverns. So all we have to do is find this wyvern's nest and kill it. Our only worries are if it has friends over for dinner!
We shouldn't tarry any longer; let's collect the head of this soon-to-be-sorry wyvern."
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate II.
The quest-giver is called Madulf. Madulf is the peaceful leader of ogres, who used to be a leader in the army of Sythillis.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to tell the villagers of Imnesvale that Madulf can protect them from orcs in mountains.
The player should first go to Imnesvale to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Imnesvale, a human village.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: a magical shield.
The following locations are related to this quest: Sythillis (a great southern empire).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Madulf and his fellow ogres want to be left alone. Madulf wants peace with humans.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Me Madulf... lead fellows from great army of Sythillis in the south. No want to kill races no more. Lead fellows in desertion. We just wants be left alone.
Always Madulf and fellows be chased and hated 'cause me an ogre! We just wants to be left alone. We come here one moon ago, tries to settle for a while, yes?
We needs you bring word to human village... humans run when Madulf goes, so me needs youse to do it for me. Youse bring word, yes?
Madulf no want death... Madulf no want fight. Just want peace. You tell villagers, maybe, that Madulf and fellows will protect village... protect from orcs in mountains, yes?
We have shield to give you... is magic, from Sythillis's army... we no use. Maybe you like."

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate II.
The quest-giver is called Mironda. Mironda is a dwarven wild mage.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to bring a cask of Halfling's Help to Mironda.
The player should first get the cask from Old Vyatri to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Trademeet, a town.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: Mironda will pay the player well.
The following characters are related to this quest: Old Vyatri (a male innkeeper, located at Trademeet).
The following items are related to this quest: Halfling's Help (beer from Luiren).
The following locations are related to this quest: Luiren (a country).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Mironda is not good with names.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Name's Mironda. Pleased to see yer face and make its acquaintance. I'm no good with names; if ye can remember mine, ye've already beaten me. I forgot yers by the end of the first syllable.
Maybe it's the wild mage in me comin' out, but I can't stand not tastin' something new once in a while. Most dwarves will drink the same mountain swill from crib to dust-crib, but I'm always hankering for the latest brew. Old Vyatri in Trademeet was just getting a shipment from Luiren I'd dearly love to sample. If ye happen to run by his place in yer travels, get a cask of it for me and I'll pay ye well!
Can't wait to taste it. Halfling's Help, it's called — I hope it works on dwarves, too"

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate II.
The quest-giver is called Khellor Ahmson. Khellor Ahmson is a guard.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to bring the evidence of Officer Roenall's corrupt actions to Corgeig Axehand.
The player should first 1) investigate Barg, 2) find Officer Roenall's personal records to complete their objective. These tasks can be completed in the following locations: 1) the docks, 2) Officer Roenall's home, northwest of the main government building in the Government District.
The following characters are related to this quest: Officer Roenall (a corrupt male guard), Corgeig Axehand (Officer Roenall's commander, located at the Government District main building), Barg (a suspicious man, located at the docks).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Khellor Ahmson saw Officer Roenall using his authority against the player in a corrupt manner. Any complaints about Officer Roenall must first go through him: guards cannot do anything about Officer Roenall. Officer Roenall's personal records may reveal his fondness for gems.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I am Khellor Ahmson, a mere guard.
I saw what happened, and I share your helplessness. Any complaints about Officer Roenall must first go THROUGH him, so you can imagine how many get through.
This did not come from me, for if my indiscretion against Roenall were to get out, I should be thrown from the military. There is one way you can get to him.
Roenall is quite corrupt and more than willing to exercise his power. You are not monitored as we, so you can do something that I or another guard cannot.
Look to the docks and a man named Barg. Examine him and what he does, and you are sure to see what I mean. You might also wish to pry into Roenall's personal records. They may reveal something of his fondness for gems. I did not tell you this... and I certainly did not say his records are in his home northwest of the main government building in the Government District.
Think on what I've said, and bring anything you learn to Corgeig Axehand in the Government District main building. He is Roenall's commander."

The following groups are related to this quest: Shadow Thief, Shadow Thieves (a guild of thieves).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player has done assignments to Bodhi before. Palern Flynn betrayed the Shadow Thieves: the Shadow Thieves have been questioning Palern Flynn ruthlessly for some days. Palern Flynn will be killed once the Shadow Thieves are through.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I will give you your next assignment.
The Shadow Thieves have other enemies besides me. Recently, they uncovered a traitor, and have been questioning him quite ruthlessly for some days now.
You will rescue him. He will be killed once they are through, so go quickly. They have him at the Shadow Thief guild house on the second floor. You know the building, I think? The man's name is Palern Flynn. Remember, if he dies, you fail.

In exchange for the many benefits you will enjoy as a favored of Lathander, you will have a few tasks to perform while here. They are humble, but very important.
You are to lend your wisdom to the wounded and afflicted, those that are suffering from a misdirection of the heart. Guide them in the light of the Morninglord's glory.
We shall introduce you slowly to the work. I shall send you someone that needs the guidance of Lathander, and then we shall evaluate how you have done."

If you were to venture below, you could prove your worth by retrieving this artifact for him. Do this, and I will allow you into our ranks and the One's divine presence.
I have a key I can give you... This will allow you entrance to the inner chambers through a door a short distance back the way you came, at the sewer passages."

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate II.
The quest-giver is called Bolumir. Bolumir is a wandering priest of Tempus.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to deal with Bolumir.
The player should first decide whether to accept Bolumir's offer or not to complete their objective.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: Bolumir's services as a priest if the player accepts Bolumir's offer.
The following characters are related to this quest: Tempus (the god of battles).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player is a noble: Bolumir would like to be the chaplain of the player's keep. Bolumir does not promise to stay long at the player's keep.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"My name be Bolumir, priest of Tempus, the god of battles!
Hahr... it has been some time since I have rested my feet in any place, to tell the truth. I've been wandering for many a year now. The traveling does wear on me, to tell the truth. I've come to ask if you've a chapel that a priest of Tempus might set himself up in... bring the good Word to the folk of the area.
What do you say, eh? If my manner does not strike you as offensive, I would be glad to be chaplain of your wee keep here. I can help your people here much while I stay. But I do not promise to stay for long. Either you accept me or you don't, my liege... that is your choice, and I'll not begrudge it you."

I was captured in my home, on Plane of Air, by some wizard. He bound me to this flask that I might guard his things. You must find my original flask and bring it back to me. Once it is within my grasp, I can break the enchantment and be freed."

The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to find out what Marlowe needs help with.
The player should first talk to Marlowe to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Marlowe's home, a simple, safe dwelling atop the east cliff.
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Marlowe assumes that the player is one of the strangers that all the locals have been talking about, an adventurer from the north. Marlowe and his daughter shall surely perish without the player's help.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Excuse me, I... I do not mean to be rude... but you *are* one of the strangers that all the locals have been talking about, aren't you? An adventurer from the north? Yes, yes, of course you are. Anyone can see that you are an extraordinary person. Please forgive me.
I would not bother you, stranger, but I am in terrible peril! I need your aid! I beg you for a boon or I and my daughter both shall surely perish! I... cannot speak more of this here. Please come to my home on top of the cliff, I beg you! We can speak freely there!
My home is atop the east cliff, adventurer. It is a simple dwelling but... safe, for the moment. My name is Marlowe... please meet me there and I shall explain everything, I swear."

The player should first find Jierdan Firkraag to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: the ruins in the northeast.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: the player's honor will be restored.

The player will travel unmolested, because Garren Windspear pleaded the player's virtue at the Radiant Heart.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"My daughter is gone! I left my home in your care! I... I... no, no, I know it was not you... I know who my enemies are. Damn that Jierdan Firkraag! What is his grief with me?! I don't know where you will find him. His hooligans prevent searching. I don't know... Perhaps the ruins in the northeast? I don't know...
Please rescue my child, no matter the risk. You will travel unmolested, for my pleas of your virtue were heard at the Radiant Heart. They demand justice for the slain knights, so that is your task now. Do this, and your honor shall be restored."

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate II.
The quest-giver is called William Reirrac. William Reirrac is a member of the Most Noble Order of the Radiant Heart.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to restore order to the lands of Metrich by solving a land dispute.
The player should first speak with Metrich to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: a neutral meeting place, a tavern in the Umar Hills, in the village of Imnesvale.
The following characters are related to this quest: Metrich (a local male baron, located at a neutral meeting place).
The following groups are related to this quest: Most Noble Order of the Radiant Heart (an order of holy knights).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player is a knight of the Most Noble Order of the Radiant Heart. Metrich wants some squatters removed from his lands: the squatters used violence against Metrich's men.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Knight, we have been commissioned by a local barony. Such service to political figures is good for the Order, and you will serve quite well in the task.
It is necessary for us to be accessible in local concerns lest we seem above the people. In this case, a baron has petitioned us to solve a land dispute. Baron Metrich wishes some squatters removed and has cited violence against his men as reason for it. Go to his lands, restore order, and bring favor to us.
The baron waits in a neutral meeting place. He is in a tavern in the Umar Hills, in the village of Imnesvale. Go now."
