This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate II.
The quest-giver is called Bodhi. Bodhi is a courteous woman.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to weaken the "resources" of the Shadow Thieves.
The player should first steal the shipment of supplies belonging to the Shadow Thieves to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: the docks.
The following groups are related to this quest: Shadow Thieves (a guild of thieves).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Bodhi wants to break a monopoly in this town. The shipment of supplies arrives by boat: if the player does not get the shipment of supplies in the next few days, the player will fail.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I am Bodhi, and I greet you warmly.
There is a monopoly in this town, and I intend to break it. I will ask you to weaken the "resources" of the Shadow Thieves. I wish a campaign of disruption, and you will begin it. There is a shipment of supplies arriving by boat. You are to... confiscate it.
I suggest you move against that ship coming in. They won't be at the docks for long, and if you do not get the cargo in the next few days, you will fail.
Farewell and good fortune."

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate II.
The quest-giver is called Teos. Teos is a Cowled Wizard, who is located at outside the sphere-like building.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to accept Teos' special deal.
The player should first do tasks for the Cowled Wizards to complete their objective.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: the ownership of the awkwardly placed sphere-like building.
The following groups are related to this quest: Cowled Wizards (an organization of wizards who regulate magic usage).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player recently assumed the ownership of the sphere-like building: by all rights, the Cowled Wizards should have the sphere. The Cowled Wizards let the player operate as a wizard in the sphere if the player agrees to do tasks for them.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I am Teos, a Cowled Wizard, and I have been assigned to offer you... a special deal.
You just recently took this sphere, and by all rights we should have it, but my superiors said to offer an alternative. It would seem we have need of you.
That said, they would like to offer an exchange. You may operate in this awkwardly placed sphere if you agree to certain duties for the Cowled Wizards.
It is simple: You may have this place and act freely as a wizard. In exchange, you do the odd task for us, acting when we can't because of political or other reasons."

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate II.
The quest-giver is called Higgold. Higgold is the player's director producing the play.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to investigate the strange things that have occurred during the production of the play.
The player should first talk to the person who has offered to help with the curse to complete their objective.
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player is the patron of the playhouse. Higgold and others are making progress in rehearsals, but strange things have been happening. Actors believe there is a curse assailing them.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"You... would not believe what has been occurring. We are finally making progress in rehearsals, and now... other things are happening... We've had props inexplicably fall from tables! A cistern broke and ruined an entire backdrop! An actress slipped yesterday and almost broke her foot! There's been other strange things, too... noises during the night, creakings and moanings. One of the stagers almost died falling out of the rafters!
All the actors are frightened; they believe the curse is assailing us, and I... am beginning to believe it too. Oh, what a fool I was to disregard it!
You are the patron of the playhouse... I need you to talk to someone who has offered to help."

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate II.
The quest-giver is called Vittario. Vittario is a poor teacher.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to protect Vittario from Dennis while Vittario collects Dennis' debt.
The player should first follow Vittario to Dennis to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: the second floor in Delosar's Inn.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: almost nothing.
The following characters are related to this quest: Dennis (a big man with big friends, located at Delosar's Inn).
The following locations are related to this quest: Delosar's Inn (an inn).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Dennis refuses to pay his debts to Vittario. Dennis promised to pay Vittario's bar tab in exchange for some lessons on the gong.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I, Vittario, be in some need of assistance, me pal. There be a fellow within Delosar's Inn there... Dennis. He owes me a good deal of coin, an' refuses to pay!
He promised to pay off me bar tab, he did, in exchange for some lessons on the gong. Well, I teached him, I did... an' now he refuses to pay me tab!
Ehhh, well I be kicked out of Delosar's for not having my tab paid. Dennis be a big fellow... with big friends. I need some muscle behind me if I'm t' go within.
Come... follow me inside o' Delosar's, and let's have a little talk wi' Dennis, aye? I do believe he is on the second floor.
I be a poor, poor man, me pal... I have almost nothing to offer ye. I beg ye to help a destitute teacher find some justice!"

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate II.
The quest-giver is called Dawnbringer Sain. Dawnbringer Sain is a priest of Lathander.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to convince Sir Sarles to sculpt a statue for the temple of Lathander.
The player should first find Sir Sarles to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Jysstev estate, in Athkatla, southeast section of the Government District.
The following characters are related to this quest: Lathander (the good god of dawn), Sir Sarles (a gifted male sculptor, located at Jysstev estate).
The following locations are related to this quest: Athkatla (a city).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Dawnbringer Sain is supposed to acquire art for the temple of Lathander.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Greetings, I am known as Dawnbringer Sain, a priest of Lathander.
I am charged with the acquisition of art for the temple. The beauty of the dawn must be captured in every nook and cranny of Lathander's home.
Athkatla is blessed with the presence of perhaps the greatest sculptor of our age. The artist is known as Sir Sarles, and he is making an all too brief visit. We would be foolish not to seize upon the opportunity to have him work for us.
I would ask you to convince Sir Sarles that it would be best for him to work for us. Go to him now.
Sir Sarles is staying at the Jysstev estate. It is in the southeast section of the Government District.
Remember, you speak for Lathander in this matter."

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate II.
The quest-giver is called Ginia. Ginia is a woman, who is located at Brynnlaw.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to talk to Calahan near the docks about taking Ginia and Ason.
The player should first kill Chremy to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: near the inn in Brynnlaw.
The following characters are related to this quest: Calahan (a male smuggler, located at near the docks in Brynnlaw), Ason (Ginia's brother, located at Brynnlaw), Chremy (Desharik's lieutenant, located at near the inn in Brynnlaw), Desharik (a pirate king, located at Brynnlaw).
The following locations are related to this quest: Brynnlaw (a pirate town on an island).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Ginia grew up in Brynnlaw, which used to be a pleasant town. Pirates lead by Desharik invaded Brynnlaw. Pirates drove people from their homes: Ginia's father tried to take their home back from the pirates but was executed. Desharik gave Ginia and Ason to Chremy for their father's actions. Calahan could take Ginia and Ason away from Brynnlaw, but Ginia and Ason can't pay him.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I should begin with my name... Ginia. I grew up here in Brynnlaw.
Things have not always been like this. Brynnlaw was once a pleasant town, though my memories may be influenced by happier times in my own life.
Then the pirates arrived, led by the despot Desharik. Desharik had lost a war with another pirate king. Forced to this island, his ships invaded the town. They took our homes. Desharik killed our mayor and dumped his body into the sea. We were forced out into the streets.
My father could take no more injustice. He tried to get back into our house and was executed for breaking the law of the pirates. Once they've stolen something, the owner has no claim on it.
Desharik said that we would have to pay for our father's "crime." He gave us to Chremy, his lieutenant, as a reward for service. He put me to work as a courtesan for the drunken pirates. It's horrible, traveler! He says that he'll kill my brother Ason if I don't do it.
There is no escape for Ason and me. There is a smuggler who will take us, but we cannot afford to pay him. There is nowhere to run on this island.
Chremy can be found near the inn. The smuggler's name is Calahan. I hope that Calahan will take us with him when you kill Chremy. He will be near the docks. Please be careful!"

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate II.
The quest-giver is called William Reirrac. William Reirrac is of the Most Noble Order of the Radiant Heart.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to retrieve the Holy Avenger from Firkraag.
The player should first slay Firkraag in his lair to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Windspear Hills, hills.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: Holy Avenger (a holy sword).
The player will encounter the following enemies during this quest: Firkraag (a red dragon).
The following groups are related to this quest: Most Noble Order of the Radiant Heart (an order of holy knights).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player is a knight of the Most Noble Order of the Radiant Heart. This is the player's final task.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Greetings. It is William Reirrac of the Most Noble Order of the Radiant Heart and I believe it is time for you to perform one final task, if you are willing.
There is an item, a holy artifact, that lies within the hands of a great evil. Firkraag, the great red dragon, looms over the Windspear Hills. His reign must end, and from his lair you must retrieve the most holy of blades, the Holy Avenger. This tool of good has been in his possession for too long. Knight, I call upon you to slay the dragon and make a statement for right and justice.
The blade will be rescued, but so shall the lands that he rules. This is a great risk, but it must be dealt with sometime. Go, and may the forces of good be your salvation.
Accomplish this, and I can think of no one more worthy of wielding the Holy Avenger. In your hands, such a blade will strike deep to evil's heart."

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate II.
The quest-giver is called Lieutenant Aegisfield. Lieutenant Aegisfield is a worried guard.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to bring information about the murders to Lieutenant Aegisfield.
The player should first find information about the murders to complete their objective.
There are some important facts concerning this quest. There are guards on the streets: there's been a string of killings. The murderer has been killing paupers, sometimes in the alley where they sleep. The murderer flays his victims alive.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I'm Lieutenant Aegisfield. I'm warning everyone so as to get the word out that there are guards on the streets. We've had a... a string of killings, and I don't want any more happening.
Bandits I can understand; they are easy enough to figure out. What's happening here is... it's murder, but not like I've ever seen. There's a disgustingly sick person out there, and I simply don't have the manpower to protect everyone. He's been killing paupers, sometimes in the alley where they sleep. They have nothing to take. He kills them and that is all. Not only is it pointless, but he does it in as painful a way as possible. It's... it's sick. He flays them... alive. There has been blood all over the area.
I must go about my rounds. If you find any information about the murders, be sure to let me know. Don't go looking for trouble though."

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate II.

The following locations are related to this quest: Athkatla (a city).

The matter is most sensitive... I have been given little knowledge of it. Tolgerias, the one whom I speak for, is eager to meet with you and discuss these matters.

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate II.
The quest-giver is called Lord Skarmaen. Lord Skarmaen is a nobleman who hates Lilith, one of the Alibakkars, who is located at Trademeet.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to bring the Mantle of Waukeen to Lord Skarmaen.
The player should first find the Mantle of Waukeen to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: the tomb of the founder of Trademeet in the graveyard.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: 1,000 gold.
The following characters are related to this quest: Lilith (a noblewoman, one of the Lurraxols, located at Trademeet).
The following items are related to this quest: Mantle of Waukeen (a large circlet).
The following groups are related to this quest: Lurraxols (a noble family), Alibakkars (a noble family).
The following locations are related to this quest: Trademeet (a town).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Both Lilith and Lord Skarmaen asked to see the player before. The Alibakkars and the Lurraxols have been feuding for generations. The Lurraxols think that their family founded Trademeet. Lord Skarmaen wants the Mantle of Waukeen to prove that his family founded Trademeet. Lord Skarmaen will give the player the key to the tomb.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Hello once again!
It is pleasing to see that you did not respond to the call of that harlot, Lilith Lurraxol. The woman is too deluded to see the truth, as I said. A commoner that has risen above her station. Our two houses have been feuding for generations. The Lurraxols seem to be possessed of the notion that their family founded this town... what an absurd thought!
Why they would even presume to suppose such a thing, I have no idea. It is sad, however, that the Alibakkars have never had the evidence to prove our claim to them... though it galls me that we would need it. All that has recently changed. An old tome belonging to my family states that there is proof — that proof can be found right here in Trademeet. In the graveyard is a tomb that has been long abandoned... but which also houses the founder of the town. My ancestor. With him lies a large circlet called the Mantle of Waukeen.
Possessing that circlet would be all the proof I need, so I wish to acquire it. I would do so myself, but there happens to be a good reason the tomb is abandoned. It is... haunted, so they say. The exact nature of its danger I do not know... but you are a hero who surely could face its perils and return safely with the mantle, yes? In return, I shall pay you 1,000 gold. I shall give you the key, then, which will allow you into the tomb... the key itself having been in my family for some time as well. More proof, yes? Go, then, and return with the mantle."
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate II.
The quest-giver is called Lady Lilith. Lady Lilith is a noblewoman who hates Skarmaen, a member of the Lurraxol family, who is located at Trademeet.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to bring the Mantle of Waukeen to Lady Lilith.
The player should first find the Mantle of Waukeen to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: the tomb of the founder of Trademeet in the Trademeet graveyard.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: 1,000 gold.
The following characters are related to this quest: Skarmaen (a nobleman from the Alibakkar family, located at Trademeet).
The following items are related to this quest: Mantle of Waukeen (an old gold circlet).
The following groups are related to this quest: Lurraxols (a noble family), Alibakkars (a noble family).
The following locations are related to this quest: Trademeet (a town).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player is the hero of Trademeet. The player spoke to Skarmaen before. The Alibakkars and the Lurraxols have been feuding for generations. The Alibakkars refuse to acknowledge the fact that the Lurraxols are the only true noble family in Trademeet, having founded it. Lady Lilith wants the Mantle of Waukeen to prove that her family founded Trademeet. Lady Lilith will give the player the key to the tomb.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Ah! It is the hero of Trademeet, come to see me at last. I trust that all is well? That pig, Skarmaen Alibakkar, did not speak too harshly about me, I trust? No matter. He is a stubborn, deluded fool. Our families have been at odds for generations, you see. The Alibakkars refuse to acknowledge the fact that we are the only true noble family in Trademeet, having founded it. Why they would think themselves higher than they are is beyond my ken. What is unfortunate, however, is that my family has never had actual, physical proof of the truth of our claim.
That has changed, however. A tome has recently been uncovered... an old tome belonging to my family... that states there is proof right here in Trademeet under our noses. In the graveyard, here in town, lies the crypt of the founder... my ancestor. With him lies the Mantle of Waukeen. A pretty name for an old gold circlet. That circlet, however, would prove my claim once and for all and shut those Alibakkars up. I would get it myself, but the tomb is haunted, you see. Here is the key to the tomb... the fact that we possess it is yet more proof of our legitimacy. Use it to enter and obtain the mantle, and then return to me when you are done.
You are a hero who might enter that tomb and retrieve the circlet for me, if you are willing. In return, I will pay you 1,000 gold. What do you say, my hero?"
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate II.
The quest-giver is called Ama. Ama is a woman, and Shadowmaster of Eastern Esmeltaran.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to help Ama kill Sir Greshal.
The player should first meet Ama after dark to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Waukeen's Promenade, a marketplace.
The following characters are related to this quest: Sir Greshal (a male government official), Shadowmaster (a guildmaster of the Shadow Thieves).
The following groups are related to this quest: Shadow Thieves (a guild of thieves).
The following locations are related to this quest: Eastern Esmeltaran (a far-away land).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player is a Shadowmaster of the Shadow Thieves. Sir Greshal has been trying to muscle into a relationship with the Shadow Thieves. Sir Greshal wishes to be introduced to a Shadow Thieves' contact here in the city: that contact will be the player. Ama will dispense a runner to get Sir Greshal after the player meets her.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"My name is Ama, and I am Shadowmaster of Eastern Esmeltaran.
I would like you to participate in a little rendezvous and help in the removal of a pest. There is a government official, Sir Greshal, causing us no end of trouble with his tariffs and spot checks on caravans. This fool thinks he can stifle the thieving trade of an entire city. He has been trying to muscle into a relationship with the Shadow Thieves, and while we could pay, it is better that we send a message to any of his cohorts. I have come here with a promise of granting his wishes, but I only want to lure him away from his palisade defenses. This is where you come in.
Sir Greshal wishes to be introduced to a contact here in the city, and that contact will be you. The meeting is already set up, and when he arrives, we will take him by surprise. You are known somewhat in this place, if not as a guildmaster. He will believe you are a legitimate contact. He seems willing to believe anything, so long as it is theatrical.
It will be any evening that is best for you. I will await you in Waukeen's Promenade after dark and then dispense a runner to get Sir Greshal. The suddenness will seem dramatic to him."
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate II.
The quest-giver is called Coran. Coran is the player's old friend, and a strong warrior, who is located at Forest of Tethir.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to save Safana from wolfweres.
The player should first kill wolfweres to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: an encampment east of here.
The following characters are related to this quest: Safana (a woman, and Coran's lover).
The following groups are related to this quest: wolfweres (wolves that can turn into humanoids).
The following locations are related to this quest: Forest of Tethir (a forest).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Coran and Safana were traveling Forest of Tethir: Safana was kidnapped by wolfweres. Coran managed to escape from wolfweres. Coran will go with the player: Coran will help the player save Safana.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Hail, good friend! I am most pleased to see you here! Your timing could not be better, as I, Coran, am in most dire need!
I was traveling Forest of Tethir with my beloved Safana... and now she is kidnapped! It is dreadful! Two days ago, we were beset by giant wolves... wolfweres, I fear. They tried to take us both, but I was able to escape. Safana, however, was not so fortunate. I tracked them to an encampment east of here, but even a great warrior such as myself cannot beat them alone.
We must save her and strike a blow against the foul werebeasts! Together, we shall be unstoppable!"

I was sent to find someone who could h-help my village, Imnesvale. Terrible things are happening there, and nobody knows what to do! Everyone says they seen strange b-beasts out in the hills. Everyone's so frightened! There's even t-t-talk that Umar herself has returned!
When you get to Imnesvale, talk to Minister Lloyd! He can tell you everything else!"

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate II.
The quest-giver is called Higgold. Higgold is enthusiastic director of theatricals, musicals, and other entertainments, from Calimport.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to provide the investment to stage the play, and make important decisions about the play.
The player should first wait for a message from Higgold to complete their objective.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: the majority of the profits from the playhouse.
The following locations are related to this quest: Calimport (a city).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player and Higgold are in front of the player's playhouse. Higgold will look for actors and a play to put in production for a week: six weeks after that the playhouse will start producing coin. Higgold will send the player a message when he's ready to go.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Greetings, greetings, greetings! I am Higgold, director of fine theatricals, musicals, and other entertainments. Most recently from Calimport, where I needn't return quickly due to the sensitivity of one particular huzzah...
..but we needn't get into that. Now, let's see... yes, mm-hm... yes, this looks like a fine playhouse. I know a few actors that aren't working, but it'll take some time to find them, as well as a worthy play to put into production. A week for that, I think. About six weeks after that for rehearsing and then this playhouse of yours should start making decent coin, so long as all goes well.
Your part, my good friend, is to provide the investment to stage the play as well as make important decisions. You'll also reap the majority of the profits. I'll start looking for actors and a play right away. It shouldn't take more than half a week, and I'll send word as soon as I'm ready to go."
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate II.
The quest-giver is called Vithal. Vithal is a mage and adventurer.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to help Vithal breach the walls between dimensions.
The player should first recover Vithal's book of rituals to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: a svirfneblin village to the north.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: items for the player and Vithal.
The following items are related to this quest: Vithal's book of rituals.
The following groups are related to this quest: svirfneblin (deep gnomes).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player released Vithal from imprisonment. Vithal lost his book of rituals. Vithal needs the book of rituals to breach the walls between dimensions.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Ahh! Thank you for releasing me. I'm Vithal, an adventuring mage. If you could aid me a bit, I would be forever grateful. There will be items enough for us both.
This spot is "thin," and careful spells may breach the walls between dimensions. On the other side, one might find some valuable magic, if one knows where to look. I cannot cast the actual dimension-breaching spells without the procedures outlined in my book of rituals. I imagine it was taken after I was imprisoned. There were svirfneblin observing my conflict: Perhaps they took it. I cannot blame them. I am sure I appeared quite permanently lost.
I believe there is a svirfneblin village to the north. They may have taken my gear there. If you go, tell them they may keep everything but the book."
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate II.
The quest-giver is called Dennis. Dennis is a warrior.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to find Dennis' family gong.
The player should first find Roger to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: the sewers below the city.
The following characters are related to this quest: Roger (a fence, located at the sewers below the city).
The following items are related to this quest: Dennis' family gong (a gong that belonged to Dennis' mother).
The following locations are related to this quest: Riatavin (a city).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Dennis is the leader of a mercenary band from Riatavin. Roger might have bought Dennis' family gong.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I be Dennis... the leader of mercenary fellows out o' Riatavin.
Me gong was stolen. The gong belonged to my mother... it was her dowry and worth a great deal of coin. A damnable lout stole it before my gong lessons were even finished!
The lout sold it to a fence by the name of Roger not too long ago, I do think. He lives in the sewers below th' city, although I knows not exactly where. He might still have it.
Please find me family gong!"

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate II.
The quest-giver is called Dawnlord Arenthis. Dawnlord Arenthis is a member of the church of Lathander.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to do something to help Risa.
The player should first find a guardian for Risa to complete their objective.
The following characters are related to this quest: Risa (a shy, sad, young girl, and Dawnlord Arenthis' charge, located at next to Dawnlord Arenthis), Lathander (the good god of dawn).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Risa does not talk much since the death of her parents.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I am Dawnlord Arenthis of the church of Lathander... excuse my young charge. Risa doesn't talk much since the recent death of her parents.
There is very little that can be done for her as well... other than to put her into an orphanage, I suppose. She is so shy and sad, though, I am sure it will do her no good.
If only there were someone who would care for her. Might you know of someone who would make a suitable guardian?"

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate II.
The quest-giver is called Lazarus Librarus. Lazarus Librarus is a wizard merchant with magical wares, and a newcomer in this town, who is located at Lazarus Librarus' store.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to return Lazarus Librarus' spellbook to him.
The player should first talk to Hectan to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Tankard Tree, the local pub.
The following characters are related to this quest: Hectan (a known thief, located at Tankard Tree).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Lazarus Librarus' does not have anything for the player to purchase. Lazarus Librarus' spellbook was stolen: he cannot fashion scrolls without his spellbook. Lazarus Librarus suspected Hectan, but he was at the local pub from dusk until dawn the night of the theft.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Lazarus Librarus at your service. I would normally invite you to look at my magical wares, but alas, my shelves are completely bare. I have not even a single parchment left for you to purchase.
My spellbook has been stolen! Without it, I cannot fashion the powerful scrolls which normally fill my shop. Please, mighty traveler... I beg of you to help a humble wizard! At first, I suspected Hectan... he is well known about town for his sticky fingers. But after questioning many witnesses, it is clear that Hectan was at the local pub from dusk until dawn the night of the theft. I still suspect that no-good thief Hectan was involved — I can clearly see the guilt in his face! But there is no proof. Without my spellbook, I am virtually powerless to pursue this myself, and as a newcomer to this town, I have no one to turn to for help.
I regret that there is little else I can tell you. Hectan can usually be found in the Tankard Tree if you wish to question him.
I urge you godspeed."
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate II.
The quest-giver is called Jarlaxle. Jarlaxle is the merry leader of the Bregan D'aerthe.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to give the gems that contain the souls of Jarlaxle's men to Jarlaxle.
The player should first find the gems that contain the souls of Jarlaxle's men to complete their objective.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: a bit of gold.
The player will encounter the following enemies during this quest: lich (an undead wizard).
The following groups are related to this quest: Bregan D'aerthe (a band of mercenaries).
The following locations are related to this quest: pocket plane (headquarters of the Bregan D'aerthe).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player entered the pocket plane via a rope. A lich has the gems that contain the souls of Jarlaxle's men. Killing or not killing the lich is up to the player. Killing the lich allows the player to loot the tower. Once the player has the gems that contain the souls of Jarlaxle's men, the player will be brought back to the headquarters with a rope by Jarlaxle.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I am Jarlaxle, leader of the Bregan D'aerthe, at your service.
This is a pocket plane, headquarters of the Bregan D'aerthe, my mercenary band. I hoped the rope would bring you here, and I see that it has. Welcome!
There is a lich who has numerous gems that contain the souls of my men, and I want them back. Whether you kill the lich or not is up to you. Killing him would allow you to loot the tower, I suppose, but however you get those gems is of no concern to me.
Once you gather up the gems, I will use the rope to pull you back into the headquarters here. Easy enough, yes?
You shall receive a bit of gold, my friend, for your trouble."

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate II.
The quest-giver is called Renfeld. Renfeld is a man who has been poisoned.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to save Renfeld from dying of poison.
The player should first take Renfeld to Rylock to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: large orange building, in the southwest part of the Docks District.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: nothing aside from Renfeld's gratitude.
The following characters are related to this quest: Rylock (a man, located at the entrance to the large orange building).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Renfeld has friends nearby in a large orange building. Rylock is guarding the entrance to the large orange building.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"My... my name is Renfeld...
*groan*
I have been poisoned...
I beg you to take me to... friends...
they have a building not far away from here... please, I beg you! It is a large building...
a large orange building in the southwest part of the Docks District.
There will be a man guarding the door... his name is Rylock. Please, take me to him...
I... I have nothing to offer you... aside from my gratitude and those of my friends.
Please... I do not have much time..."

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate II.
The quest-giver is called Raissa. Raissa is a terrified woman.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to cure Raissa.
The player should first talk to the temple superior about a restoration spell to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Waukeenar Temple, a temple.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: Raissa's gratitude.
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player killed the skin dancers that attacked Raissa. The skin dancers turned Raissa into a skin dancer: they peeled her skin from her bones and one of them put Raissa's skin on like a coat. Raissa took her skin back. A spell of restoration can cure Raissa.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Y-you... you killed those monsters? It was so... horrible! They turned me, Raissa, into one of them: a skin dancer. Peeled my skin from m-my bones and... and now I've put it back! They turned me into one of them. He took my skin like it was some kind of coat and put it on. He told me that now I was a skin dancer too.
I... I cannot go anywhere like this! I can feel that magic, that evil, growing inside of me! Please, my noble savior... help me! Wh-when he was... taking my skin, the skin walker said the only way to stop the process was a spell of restoration. B-but he laughed, saying I would never receive it.
If... if you could find that spell, could you not cast it upon me? Maybe... maybe the temple superior at the Waukeenar Temple would have something!
I have no coin. I know such magic is very expensive... but if you could find it in your heart to save me, I would be eternally grateful!"

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate II.
The quest-giver is the spirit of the grove.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to aid the spirit of Marek of Halruaa in saving Loren.
The player should first save Loren from Marek of Halruaa's old enemies to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Trademeet, a town.
The following characters are related to this quest: Marek of Halruaa (a famous male druid of old), Loren (a young boy, and a descendant of Marek of Halruaa, located at Trademeet).
The following locations are related to this quest: grove.
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player has met the spirit of the grove before. The player is a child of nature: a druid. Marek of Halruaa established a protectorate of nature in these woods. Marek of Halruaa's old enemies have returned to haunt his descendants: Loren's parents were killed by an evil that haunts him.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"It is I, the spirit of the grove, child.
Child of nature, you are again needed. Balance is threatened, and Chaos is at the periphery. Will you serve the grove?
The grove is young in terms of nature and ancient in the years of man. Centuries ago, Marek of Halruaa established a protectorate of nature in these woods. Now, as Marek knew would someday happen, his descendants have returned and old enemies marshal their forces. A child called Loren has recently arrived in Trademeet. This child is the inheritor of Marek's spirit, but does not yet have the knowledge to use his power. Surely he shall be slain by the forces of chaos if you do not rescue him. Even now he is alone and in danger, his parents slain by an evil that haunts him. You must find the child Loren in Trademeet and fight Marek's old enemies to save the child's life.
The spirit that once was Marek has gone forth to aid the child... but the spirit is not the power that the man once was and cannot hope to hold out for long. Aid him lest all be lost."
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate II.
The quest-giver is called Quallo. Quallo is a madman, who is located at sewers.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to follow the One's path, and return to Quallo.
The player should first find the clues from the One to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: where the topside filth drains.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: the blade.
The following characters are related to this quest: One (a mysterious being).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Quallo is standing next to a creature that he calls a friend. The blade is hidden.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I'm Quallo, and this thing here is my friend.
You have come for the blade, I suppose. It is as we have always expected, my friend. (He glances to the creature beside him.) Too long in this pit, too long.
The gleam in your eye! It belies your greed, your passion. I've found this blade, child! It is hidden most insidiously. A cruel jest has been played upon us all. My friend here knows this!
The One has left clues for you. Have you not found the clues? Where the topside filth drains, there are the clues. Return to me ere you follow the One's path, for there is much that you must learn."

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate II.
The quest-giver is called Danno. Danno is a distressed man who knows the player.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to save Pala from poisoning.
The player should first meet Danno in Trademeet to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Trademeet, a town.
The following characters are related to this quest: Wallace (a peddler), Pala (the player's sister, and Danno's crush, located at with the player's mother), Mazzy (the player).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Danno bought a love potion from Wallace at the market square: Danno gave Pala the love potion. Pala drank the love potion and collapsed.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Oh, Mazzy! Thank the gods that I've found you! I've hurt Pala!
You have to save her! I didn't mean to do it. I bought a love potion from Wallace the peddler at the market square. I just wanted her to love me. She only had a sip of it, and she collapsed.
She is with your mother, Mazzy. How was I to know it was poison? Oh, please hurry! I will meet you in Trademeet."

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate II.
The quest-giver is called Jaheira. Jaheira is the player's angry, yet weary companion, who is located at Athkatla.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to break Jaheira's curse.
The player should first 1) seek out Ployer, 2) ask about the mages in strange colors who were with Ployer, 3) ask about Belgrade from Bernard to complete their objective. These tasks can be completed in the following locations: 1) poor section of Athkatla, 2) the government building in Athkatla, 3) Copper Coronet(an inn in Athkatla).
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: Jaheira's curse will be removed.
The following characters are related to this quest: Ployer (a fat male slaver, who hates Jaheira, located at Athkatla), Belgrade (a male merchant who helped to expose Ployer for his crimes, located at Athkatla), Bernard (a male bartender, located at Copper Coronet).
The following locations are related to this quest: Athkatla (a city).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Ployer has cursed Jaheira: the curse might resist removal by normal means. All magic is regulated in Athkatla. Ployer spoke to Jaheira before: Ployer mentioned that he lived in squalor, and also mentioned Belgrade.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Ployer! That... that fat excuse for a slaver, he's cursed me! Damn him! If the curse was tailored to me, it might resist removal by normal means. I doubt Ployer would have done this if the solution were simple.
I have a few options. Ployer mentioned that he lived in squalor, suggesting he may be in the poor section of the city. Not likely to find him quick though. The mages with him wore odd colors that might be traceable. Ask at the government building, as all magic is regulated in Athkatla. If they will talk... He also mentioned Belgrade, a merchant that helped expose Ployer. He frequents the Copper Coronet, and the bartender Bernard might know his whereabouts.
My very bones ache today. It is as though I age on the inside. Ohh, this cannot go on for long. We must remove this curse!"
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate II.
The quest-giver is called Bodhi. Bodhi is a well-spoken woman who hates the Shadow Thieves.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to pin the murder of Senior Armagaran Vulova on the Shadow Thieves.
The player should first murder Senior Armagaran Vulova to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Senior Armagaran Vulova's small house, in the Government District, between the jail and the government building.
The following characters are related to this quest: Senior Armagaran Vulova (a man leading a merchant house, linked to the Shadow Thieves, located at Senior Armagaran Vulova's small house).
The following groups are related to this quest: Shadow Thieves (a guild of thieves).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player has done assignments to Bodhi before. Bodhi gives the player a cloak and a dagger to implicate the Shadow Thieves: when Senior Armagaran Vulova is dead, the player must put the cloak and the dagger in the fountain in Senior Armagaran Vulova's house.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Now I ask for a more specific task that will disrupt the Shadow Thieves further.
The task is... unseemly.
It calls for the murder of a man. Not a truly innocent man, but hardly a villain of epic scope. You must kill, blaming the murder on the Shadow Thieves. He is head of a merchant house, and his link to Shadow Thieves is blatant. If he were to die and certain gear were at the scene, it would implicate the guild we oppose.
Take this cloak and dagger, and go kill Senior Armagaran Vulova. When he is dead, put the cloak and dagger in the fountain in his house. He will die easily, though there may be guards. His small house is in the Government District, between the jail and the government building.
Go."

There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player is a ranger. Delon has been looking for the player. Nelleck saw orcs coming down from the hills: he says that the orcs will be at the village no later than three or four days from now.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Oh! There you are, my noble ranger! It's me, Delon. I... I've been looking all over the place for you! You... you've got to come to Imnesvale!
There's orcs... big ones! Nelleck says he saw them coming down from the hills. Soon they'll attack! The Minister sent me to find you! Nelleck says that they'll be at the village soon... no later than three or four days from now. You've got to hurry!
I'll run back and tell Minister Lloyd that you're coming! Everyone will be so relieved!"

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate II.
The quest-giver is called Lord Logan Coprith. Lord Logan Coprith is the High Merchant of Trademeet.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to investigate the issue with the Dao genies.
The player should first talk with Guildmistress Busya about what needs to be done to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: the next room.
The following characters are related to this quest: Guildmistress Busya (a woman), Ihtafeer (a rakshasa, located at the next room).
The following groups are related to this quest: Dao genies (a group of genies from Calimshan).
The following locations are related to this quest: Trademeet (a merchant town), Calimshan (a country).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Dao genies came to Trademeet. Dao genies are hunting Ihtafeer. Dao genies won't allow trade to occur in Trademeet until Ihtafeer's head is delivered to them.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"My name is Lord Logan Coprith, and I am the High Merchant of Trademeet.
A group of Dao genies from Calimshan arrived to Trademeet a while ago. They and their gold were welcome enough at first... But in only weeks, they have taken all business and put a stop to it. They are hunting a rakshasa named Ihtafeer and insist that she is present in the town.
The genies will allow no trade to occur until Ihtafeer is found and her head given to them. Why... why they have chosen this particular tactic, I am unsure.
Without proper trade, however, the merchants are penniless. Soon, the food resources will dry up as well, so something must be done... and done soon.
Perhaps you might be able to look into this genie issue for us? Guildmistress Busya in the next room can tell you more about what needs to be done."
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate II.
The quest-giver is called Aran Linvail. Aran Linvail is a man leading a guild of thieves, who is located at thieves' guild hall.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to find the lair of the rival guild.
The player should first pose as the rival guild's new recruit to the rival guild's recruiter to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Five Flagons, a tavern in the Bridge District.
The following characters are related to this quest: Jaylos (a male member of Aran Linvail's guild), Caehan (a male member of Aran Linvail's guild).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Jaylos and Caehan are planning leave Aran Linvail's guild to join the rival guild: they are supposed to meet their contact on the second floor of the Five Flagons.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Two of our men, Jaylos and Caehan by name, are planning to leave our little community and join with our enemies. Greener grass and all of that, I suppose.
They are to meet their contact on the second floor of the Five Flagons tavern in the Bridge District. Go there and pose as one of our enemy's new recruits. I want to know where our enemy's lair is. We have yet to find it.
This recruiter could arrive at any time so I suggest that you go to the Five Flagons now. They may prove unreasonable, so prepare yourself for hostility.
Return when you have the information we need."

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate II.
The quest-giver is called Cernick. Cernick is the player's captain of the guard.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to punish Lastin for thieving in the keep.
The player should first decide punishment on Lastin to complete their objective.
The following characters are related to this quest: Lady de'Arnise (a dead noblewoman), Lastin (a new male guard, and one of the player's subjects, located at here with Cernick).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player is a noble. There have been minor thefts in the player's keep: Cernick investigated the thefts and caught Lastin taking a necklace that belonged to Lady de'Arnise. Lastin has confessed his crime. The player is being watched carefully by the people who oppose the player's rule.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Greetings, my liege. It is I, Cernick, your captain of the guard.
I am not sure if you have been aware, but we have been experiencing a number of thefts in the keep over the past couple of weeks. A goblet, some silverware, a few coins from the servants' quarters. All of these things have value, although none of them were major thefts.
Still... I investigated. Lastin here is one of the new guards. I caught him red-handed, attempting to take a necklace that belonged to the late Lady de'Arnise. Lastin has confessed his crime. I am unsure how to punish him, my liege, so I have brought this before you.
He is your subject, my liege, so yours is the right to decide punishment, but you are also... being watched carefully by those who oppose your rule, however."

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate II.
The quest-giver is a servant ogre.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to survive the mind flayers' arena.
The player should first fight to survive to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: the mind flayers' arena.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: the player will live.
The following groups are related to this quest: mind flayers (creatures with powerful mental abilities).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player was captured by the mind flayers while trespassing their home. The mind flayers like watching their captives fight in the arena. The player should not attack the mind flayers. The player should not anger the arena spectators: they are especially strong because of their big brain.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Me a servant ogre. Now it time to fight!
You fight in the arena. Listen, I tell you what you need to know.
You trespass on the home of the mind flayers, and you got caught. Now you pay for your stay. Understand?
Next thing, you better fight well in the arena, because if you don't fight well, you die. If you don't fight at all, you die.
Oh, last rule, never attack the mind flayers. You are in their home. They kill you with their thoughts.
You will live if you fight well.
I warn though: Do not anger spectators. They extra strong in this place because of big brain."
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate II.
The quest-giver is called Captain Samand. Captain Samand is captain of the Saradush guard.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to discover the real traitor.
The player should first talk to Mateo to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Mateo's cell.
The following characters are related to this quest: Mateo (a young man, and a faithful soldier, located at Mateo's cell), Ardic Santele (the missing son of Countess Santele, and the primary witness in the traitor investigation), Kiser Jhaeri (a vile male merchant, located at Saradush), Countess Santele (a noblewoman, located at Saradush).
The following locations are related to this quest: Saradush (a town under siege).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Someone opened a secret gate into Saradush: the enemy came through a small sewer outlet that was protected by both a locked iron grate and several powerful magical wards. The Saradush guard found three soldiers in the area: Mateo, Ardic Santele, and Kiser Jhaeri. Countess Santele told the Saradush guard that Ardic Santele had implicated Mateo before Ardic Santele disappeared. The jailer will let the player see Mateo.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"My name is Captain Samand, and I'm a very busy man right now.
A few days ago, someone opened a secret gate into the town — Saradush could easily have been overrun. We just discovered the traitor was a young man named Mateo. There's no doubt in my mind that *someone* betrayed us. The enemy came through a small sewer outlet that was protected by both a locked iron grate and several powerful magical wards. There is no way to open that entrance from the outside. But Mateo is a faithful soldier, not the type of man to betray Saradush.
An alarm was raised, and my soldiers arrived only a few moments after the gate was opened. We found three soldiers in the area: Mateo, Ardic Santele, and the merchant Kiser Jhaeri. We didn't get a chance to complete our investigations. Ardic, the son of the Countess Santele, disappeared. He was our primary witness. Our attention was focused on the vile Kiser Jhaeri, but we had no proof. Then the countess told us that Ardic, her son, had implicated Mateo before he disappeared.
If you wish to investigate further, I will not stand in your way. Speak to Mateo in his cell. The jailer will let you see him."
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate II.
The quest-giver is called Giran. Giran is a young boy.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to investigate the circus tent.
The player should first find Giran's mother to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: the circus tent.
The following characters are related to this quest: Giran's mother.
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Guards do not let anyone in the circus tent.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"sniff* My momma's still inside. They says she can't come out. My momma went into the tent to see a circus show. But somethin' happened, and now nobody comes out. There's guards who won't let nobody in anymore, too. But my momma's in there!
I want my momma! Please find her, please!"
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate II.
The quest-giver is called Kangaxx. Kangaxx is an undead man, who is located at a tomb.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to reverse Kangaxx's curse.
The player should first find Kangaxx's arms, legs, and torso to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: within the city in tombs such as this one.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: anything the player wants.
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Kangaxx has been cursed to eternal entrapment in this tomb by his enemies. Kangaxx's curse can be reversed by collecting the pieces of his body: he will become mortal again.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I am Kangaxx, and I have been cursed. I am dead yet not dead.
Cursed to eternal entrapment in this tomb by cruel enemies! Cursed to a fate worse than death! But the curse can be reversed! With your assistance, I may live again. I have suffered for so long... will you help me?
The fiends that did this to me keep me from returning by tearing apart my mortal form and keeping the pieces separated. You must find my body that I might again take mortal form. The pieces are very close! I have no doubt that they lie within the city in tombs such as this. My enemies are predictable if nothing else. Seek my arms, legs, and torso.
I will give you anything you want. Power, riches beyond number! Anything!"
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate II.
The quest-giver is called Keldorn. Keldorn is a betrayed man, and the player's friend, who is located at Athkatla.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to bestow some justice on Sir William of Thorpe.
The player should first go find Sir William of Thorpe with Keldorn to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Mithrest, an inn in the Promenade District of Athkatla.
The following characters are related to this quest: Keldorn's wife, Sir William of Thorpe (a foreign noble, and a good man, located at Athkatla).
The following locations are related to this quest: Athkatla (a city).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Keldorn's wife has been seeing Sir William of Thorpe. Sir William of Thorpe has challenged Keldorn's honor.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"My wife has been seeing another man. Sir William of Thorpe... He's a foreign noble establishing trade here in Athkatla. He was a good man — at least I always thought so until... until now.
My friend, let us bestow some justice. Sir William has challenged my honor. There must be a reprisal.
We must make haste to the Mithrest in the Promenade District. I cannot live like this for long."

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate II.
The quest-giver is called Talon Yarryl. Talon Yarryl is a priest of Talos.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to convince Sir Sarles to create a work of art for the temple of Talos.
The player should first find Sir Sarles to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Athkatla.
The following characters are related to this quest: Sir Sarles (a good artist who is also a pretentious and demanding man, located at Athkatla), Talos (the evil god of thunder and destruction).
The following items are related to this quest: illithium (an expensive material).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Sir Sarles demands illithium as his art medium. If the player sees the representatives of the other churches, the player must kill them.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I, Talon Yarryl, priest of Talos, have a mission for you!
Talos demands proper tribute, and that occasionally means artwork pleasing to the eye. If a piece of his fury can be represented, more might see and fear it.
An artist visits Athkatla now. The artist travels under the name Sir Sarles, though it is surely a fake. He is pretentious, demanding, and very good.
We must command a commission from him. But he is not being cooperative. His commission is outlandish, and he demands illithium as his medium! He may as well have asked for dragon tears.
Convince him to work for Talos. Use whatever means you must. Other churches are trying the same... if you cross their representatives, kill them.
Incur what debts you must, and use force where it will help. Stop at nothing. This man must realize there is no choice but to work in the service of Talos."
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate II.
The quest-giver is called Higgold. Higgold is a frightened theater director.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to do something about the Turmish fanatics.
The player should first stop the Turmish fanatics to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: the playhouse.
The following groups are related to this quest: Turmish fanatics (a group of barbarians).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player is Higgold's patron. The Turmish fanatics are not permitting the play: the dress rehearsal is supposed to be tomorrow.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Ah! Patron! This is unbelievable! There are... a group of Turmish fanatics in the playhouse! They have taken it over!
They charged in and scared the cast to death yelling nonsense about not permitting the play! They said they would sooner burn the playhouse than allow the show! And the dress rehearsal is supposed to be tomorrow! Gah! Patron, you've got to do something! Stop them, please!"

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate II.
The quest-giver is called Higgold. Higgold is a theater director.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to choose who will play Karenina.
The player should first choose between two female actresses who are desperate for the part of Karenina to complete their objective.
The following characters are related to this quest: Karenina (the lead female role in "The Sorcerer's Bane"), two female actresses.
The following items are related to this quest: "The Sorcerer's Bane" (a grand epic about the pride of a great sorcerer and the love that is his downfall).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player is Higgold's patron. Higgold has gathered together a play and a troupe of actors like he promised: the play is "The Sorcerer's Bane". Higgold shall introduce the player both actresses and the rest of the actors.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"It is good to see you again, my patron. I have managed to gather together a play as well as a troupe of actors, as I promised.
They are a fine lot. I have worked with some, and they should serve well. As for the play, I have come across a translated copy of, uh, "The Sorcerer's Bane." You will like it, my patron. A grand epic about the pride of a great sorcerer and the love that is his downfall. Seldom performed, but well attended when it is.
The only problem I am having is deciding who will play Karenina, the lead female role. There are two actresses in the troupe who are desperate for the part. I know them both well and cannot decide, so I shall leave the choice to you. Here... I shall introduce you to both of them, as well as the rest of the actors."

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate II.
The quest-giver is the player's servant.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to find out why Tolmas Bendelia is angry.
The player should first grant an audience to Tolmas Bendelia to complete their objective.
The following characters are related to this quest: Tolmas Bendelia (an angry male merchant).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player is a noble. Tolmas Bendelia's caravan was waylaid by bandits. Tolmas Bendelia owns the deed to more than one local farmhold.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Greetings, Your Grace. I actually have a rather angry merchant by the name of Tolmas Bendelia that has been demanding to see you.
It might have something to do with his caravan being waylaid by bandits passing through the region, but he refuses to speak to anyone but Your Grace. He is an influential merchant in this area; I believe he owns the deed to more than one local farmhold. Will you grant this man an audience, my liege? I shall show him in."

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate II.
The quest-giver is called Raelis Shai. Raelis Shai is leader of the troupe of bards and actors.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to return Haer'Dalis and his gem to the troupe.
The player should first find Mekrath's lair to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: the city's sewers.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: Mekrath might have treasure that could be taken from him.
The following characters are related to this quest: Haer'Dalis, sparrow (a male actor in Raelis Shai's troupe, located at Mekrath's lair), Mekrath (a greedy wizard, located at Mekrath's lair).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Haer'Dalis is an actor in Raelis Shai's troupe. Haer'Dalis was captured by Mekrath because Mekrath coveted Haer'Dalis' gem.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I am Raelis Shai, the leader of this merry troupe.
The vagaries of fortune blow an ill wind over us. One of our members is absent due to circumstances we cannot control.
You must hear our story. One of our actors, Haer'Dalis, has been kidnapped by a wizard native to this city... he has made no effort to negotiate with us. The wizard's greed may have called to him at the sight of Haer'Dalis's beloved gem... something our sparrow would not gladly surrender. So this wizard has stolen both away, and there is nothing we can do. I would ask that you return our sparrow and his gem to us both, by whatever means possible.
The wizard's name is Mekrath, I believe... I know that his lair can be accessed through the city's sewers, though where exactly it lies is a mystery.
We are but a destitute troupe of players, child, and can afford little. Mekrath may have treasure of his own... Wrest it from his grasp if you wish to do so."

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate II.
The quest-giver is called Mairyn. Mairyn is a spirit of this forest.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to stop the humans from further desecrating Mairyn's forest.
The player should first seek out the nature of the humans' quest to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Mairyn's sacred lands to the north of this place where the temple of the sun god once stood.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: Mairyn's gratitude.
The following groups are related to this quest: humans.
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player is a ranger. The humans have come recently, digging and tearing down the trees: Mairyn begged the humans to stop but they refused.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Good ranger! My name is Mairyn... I am a spirit of this forest, and I am in desperate need of your aid!
There are... other humans... in my sacred lands to the north of this place where the temple of the sun god once stood. They have come recently, digging and tearing down the trees... I have begged them to stop, good ranger... I have pleaded with them that they are destroying not only me, but many of the other forest spirits as well. The humans have refused.
I implore you... go to the forest in the north and do whatever you can to stop these humans from further desecrating my forest! You must go to them, and seek out the nature of their quest, if you wish. Whatever you do, however, you must stop them.
I... I have nothing to offer you, ranger, other than my gratitude. May Mielikki shine on you, good ranger."

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate II.
The quest-giver is called Higgold. Higgold is a seriously troubled theater director.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to do not upset the member of the city council who is among the audience of the play.
The player should first play Velden in the play to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: playhouse.
The following characters are related to this quest: Zaren (an actor who plays Velden), Velden (the main character of the play).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player is Higgold's patron, and a bard. Zaren is ill: the player must replace him. The player observed the rehearsals of the play.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Ooooh... my patron... We have a real problem. A very large problem. A gigantic problem!
One of... one of the council members is here... or, at least, I believe he is one! On opening night! This... this could make or break the playhouse! And Zaren... Zaren is ill! Deathly ill! He cannot even move from his bed! I see only one chance... it's too late for anything else... You must play Velden. You are a bard, naturally gifted... you observed our rehearsals.
Please, my patron, I'm begging you! This could be the biggest chance for all of us! And... and we mustn't upset the council member! PLEASE, you must do it!"

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate II.
The quest-giver is called Aran Linvail. Aran Linvail is a man leading a guild of thieves, who is located at thieves' guild hall.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to find the rival guild's hideout, and destroy the rival guild.
The player should first find the rival guild's hideout to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Graveyard District, a city district with a large graveyard.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: Aran Linvail and the player's bargain will be fulfilled.
The following characters are related to this quest: Bodhi (an intelligent, brutal female vampire, and the leader of the rival guild, located at the rival guild's hideout).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player was on a mission for Aran Linvail last night: Bodhi attacked Aran Linvail's guild in the meantime. There is a network of tombs beneath the graves where another spy tracked one of Bodhi's servants: the player shall find a set of blue doors just north of a spider den. The doors are too heavy for any mortal to open: Aran Linvail sends a mage to open the doors for the player. Aran Linvail gives the player stakes: the stakes can kill vampires permanently.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"You were not the only one who was busy last night.
The leader of this rival guild, Bodhi by name, made a daring attack upon us. She can only be a vampire, and I suspect many of her servants are as well. The time has come to strike back to protect our people and the city she has invaded.
Go to the Graveyard District and find their hideout. There is a network of tombs beneath the graves where another spy tracked one of Bodhi's servants. There you shall find a set of blue doors just north of a spider den. The doors are too heavy for any mortal to open, but the vampires likely pass with ease. I shall send a mage to meet you there and arrange for the doors to be opened. Here, you shall need these stakes if you are to truly finish these creatures.
Be on your guard. This Bodhi is the most intelligent and brutal foe I have ever had. If we are lax in our vigilance, we will be at the disadvantage. When you have destroyed their evil, return to me and I will fulfill our bargain."

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate II.
The quest-giver is called Jaheira. Jaheira is the player's companion.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to see the Harpers with Jaheira.
The player should first go with Jaheira to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Harper Hold in Athkatla.
The following groups are related to this quest: Harpers (keepers of balance).
The following locations are related to this quest: Athkatla (a city).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Jaheira kept the player waiting as there were things she had to take care of. Jaheira was asked to bring the player to the Harper Hold.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Hail there! I said I would return, and I have. Sorry to have kept you waiting, but there were things I had to take care of. Now that we have met once again, there is something I must ask of you.
We must go to the Harper Hold in Athkatla. I have been asked to bring you, and we must go soon. They will allow us to pass the wards of the door, but I must be with you."

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate II.
The quest-giver is called Marlowe. Marlowe is a worried father, who used to be a successful merchant in Calimshan, who is located at Marlowe's home.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to save Malla by returning her soul to her.
The player should first kill Vongoethe to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: the cavern that serves as a graveyard in this place.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: Vongoethe has items that the player could take.
The following characters are related to this quest: Vongoethe (a powerful lich and wizard, located at the cavern), Malla (Marlowe's daughter, and a pure, young girl, located at Marlowe's home).
The following locations are related to this quest: Calimshan (a great city to the south).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Marlowe requested the player to see him before. Vongoethe chased Marlowe and Malla here. Vongoethe desired Malla's soul: he stole it. Malla lies near death, and there is nothing the local priestess can do to help her. The monks sealed off the cavern rather than getting Marlowe's daughter's soul. The guard guarding the cavern will let in whomever Marlowe asks.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Welcome to my humble accommodations, adventurer. Will you hear out my tale?
As I said before, my name is Marlowe... I hail from Calimshan to the south, where I was a merchant. A successful one. I... suppose that is where I first came into contact with Vongoethe.
Vongoethe is a lich, adventurer. A powerful one. In Calimshan, there are many strange wonders of magic, and Vongoethe is not out of place. It is he who has chased us here, hunting us mercilessly. Vongoethe desired my poor Malla, my daughter. She is the young woman here on the bed. A... a good girl, a virgin and pure of heart. He desired her soul, he said, so I fled Calimshan with her. But he caught up to us nevertheless. And somehow he has taken her soul despite my efforts! She... she lies near death, and there is nothing the local priestess can do to help her. I know Vongoethe is in the cavern that serves as a graveyard in this place. I told the monks about him... but they sealed off the cavern rather than somehow getting my daughter's soul back as I had hoped.
Malla is the world to me! And I do not know how much longer Vongoethe will remain trapped in that cavern... he could already be loose! He will kill me and keep Malla's soul, I am sure of it!
Getting inside the cavern is not a problem. I... paid the guard there what little money I have left. I had thought to... try and get Malla's soul myself. But the guard will let in whomever I ask him to.
I have no coin left to offer you. I have bankrupted myself in trying to flee the lich's reach. But... Vongoethe himself is a powerful wizard. Surely he has items that would interest you, that you could take from him!"
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate II.
The quest-giver is called Acolyte Byron. Acolyte Byron is the player's tutor in the player's duties to Helm, who is located at temple of Helm.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to hear questions from believers of Helm.
The player should first reassure believers of Helm that duty is above all to complete their objective.
The following characters are related to this quest: Helm (a god of duty).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player is one of Helm's chosen: a cleric of Helm.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Greetings, I'm Acolyte Byron.
I will be your tutor in your duties here as one of Helm's chosen.
You have many things you are responsible for.
As a favored of Helm, you will hear questions from those that seek guidance in their duty. They merely needed to be reassured that duty is above all, and that reverence for such duty is the way to happiness.
You will steer them on the true path to Helm's grace.
You have the wisdom that has secured your position within the church.
You will dispense it to those that are needy.
This is a sacred trust that you are given. Do not disappoint."
