This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate II.
The quest-giver is called Garren Windspear. Garren Windspear is a friendly man.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to discover why you were tricked to kill knights.
The player should first take sanctuary with Garren Windspear to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Garren Windspear's cabin, a short distance south of here.
The following characters are related to this quest: Helm (the god of order).
The following groups are related to this quest: knights, priests of Helm.
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Garren Windspear saw the player change their shape. Garren Windspear observed the player kill knights who looked like beasts: priests of Helm will seek justice and only the player's head will suffice.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I'm Garren Windspear. What goes on here? I've seen many a strange thing in my time, but the events of the past few moments tops them all.
Who are you that can change shape so readily, and why have you slain these beasts that become men?
It appears that you have been tricked into killing these knights! Though the priests of Helm will not believe what has happened. They will seek justice, and only your head will suffice.
I suggest that you take sanctuary with me until you can discover how this unfortunate event came to pass. My cabin is but a short distance south of here. I will meet you there."
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate II.
The quest-giver is called Tolgerias. Tolgerias is a member of the Amnian Cowled Wizards, who is located at Athkatla.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to deliver Valygar Corthala to the Cowled Wizards dead or alive.
The player should first track down Valygar Corthala to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Valygar Corthala's house in the Docks District of Athkatla, or Umar Hills.
The following characters are related to this quest: Valygar Corthala (last son of a wealthy family and a true brute).
The following items are related to this quest: Amnian (something or someone from Amn).
The following groups are related to this quest: Cowled Wizards (an organization of wizards who regulate magic usage).
The following locations are related to this quest: Amn (a country), Umar Hills (an area in the wilderness), Athkatla (the capital city of Amn).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Magic is hated in Amn. Valygar Corthala has murdered two Cowled Wizards: he is currently in hiding. Valygar Corthala's friends and servants will not speak to Cowled Wizards.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I am Tolgerias, a proud member of the Amnian Cowled Wizards.
This matter must be handled with discretion and expediency. There is something that has been plaguing us for more than a week now and has become quite alarming.
You know of the prevailing attitude against magic here in Amn, yes? Well, amongst some it is even worse than that... a burning, palpable hatred. One particular man here in Athkatla has murdered two of our number in cold blood. He is currently in hiding, and we need you to track the fellow down. We have been unable to do so, much to our frustration. Cowled Wizards cannot be assaulted without repercussions or it will lead to... serious problems.
He is Valygar Corthala, last son of a wealthy family and a true brute. Ask around and you may discover if he is hiding within the city or someplace else. He has a home here in the Docks District, or he may have fled to the Umar Hills. His friends and servants will not speak to us, but they may to you.
We do not ask that you commit any murder. We wish Valygar be delivered to us, that is all. He will likely resist, so if you must kill him, so be it. But if you do kill him, I simply must have his body. Valygar must be delivered to us whether he is dead or alive. You understand, yes?"
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate II.
The quest-giver is called Korgan Bloodaxe. Korgan Bloodaxe is a powerful warrior.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to bring the the Book of Kaza to the book collector.
The player should first find the Book of Kaza with Korgan Bloodaxe to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: a tomb over in the lower crypts of the Graveyard District.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: sacks of loot and odd magics.
The following characters are related to this quest: book collector, a man.
The following items are related to this quest: Book of Kaza (a grimoire).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Korgan Bloodaxe and his fellows were on a mission to obtain the Book of Kaza for a book collector. Korgan Bloodaxe and his fellows had a heated argument: only Korgan Bloodaxe remained alive afterwards.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I'm scouring for a band of desperate adventurers to aid me in a gallant task. Come and hear Korgan Bloodaxe's tale!
A fortnight past, me fellows and I were in the midst of obtaining an ancient text fer our patron when a skirmish visited our midst. Vile words, alas, became a lake of bloodshed. So it goes the sacred grimoire ne'er made it to our benefactor's hand. And now he awaits its arrival with a zeal reserved for a grog-blossom in an alekeg. The scuttlebutt is the pay is handsome and worthy of note — sacks of loot and odd magics. The volume sits not far from 'ere, and the bibliomaniac, he paces the floor in the meantime. 'Tis called the Book of Kaza.
The Book of Kaza is in some hobnail's tomb over in the lower crypts of the Graveyard District. It's nae abandoned, but rumors and half-truths only scare the young and infirm. Keeps the curious away, me guess.
Well... it'll take far more than a few shambling bags of skin and stitches to deter Korgan Bloodaxe from a king's ransom! A foolhardy jaunt into a hive of undead? How could ye resist?"
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate II.
The quest-giver is called Oisig. Oisig is a cleric of Helm.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to investigate the Cult of the Eyeless.
The player should first meet Keldorn to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: the sewers.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: the player will be rewarded if they serve well.
The following characters are related to this quest: Helm, He of the Unsleeping Eyes, The Vigilant One (the god of order), Keldorn (a male paladin of Torm, and an ally of Helm, who will assist the player in finding the Cult of the Eyeless, located at the sewers), Torm (the god of duty).
The following groups are related to this quest: Cult of the Eyeless (a cult that promotes blindness).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Blindness is abhorrent to Helm. The Cult of the Eyeless is hiding in the sewers: the player must infiltrate the sewers and find a hidden passage leading to the Cult of the Eyeless.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"The task I ask will be treacherous, but you seem capable. Serve well, and you will be rewarded. Display any treachery, and it will be seen. Now to the task.
A cult of the eyeless has emerged: He of the Unsleeping Eyes must know of this cult. The blindness they promote is abhorrent to Helm. We ask you to investigate and identify the cult.
The Vigilant One informs us that the cult is underground and close, but we cannot see past the sewers. You must infiltrate it, as friend or conqueror. You must suffer the filth of the sewers to find the filth of the cult. They are not hiding amidst the pipes, so there must be a passage leading further away.
Our resources are thin at the moment, but an ally of Helm and servant of Torm is awaiting you in the sewers now. Seek Keldorn to serve with you. Faith guide you both."
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate II.
The quest-giver is the majordomo of the player's castle, who is located at the player's castle.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to decide who gets to marry Chanelle.
The player should first go see Chanelle and her two suitors to complete their objective.
The following characters are related to this quest: Chanelle (a female maid, located at the player's castle).
The following groups are related to this quest: de'Arnise family (the former rulers of the player's castle).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player is a noble. Chanelle was an orphan who was took in by the de'Arnise family: the player is Chanelle's guardian as the ruler of the keep. No one can marry Chanelle without the player's permission.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Greetings, Your Grace. It is I, the majordomo of your castle. We have a small problem here at the keep, one that I doubt that you would be aware of at all.
I am unsure if you have met Chanelle... She has been a maid here most of her life. She was an orphan, and the de'Arnise family took her in as a servant when she was young. As the ruler of the keep, you are technically her guardian. Ordinarily, that would not be a problem, but there are two men who desire her hand in marriage. It is... up to you, my liege, to give her away and decide which of the men has your blessing for the marriage.
I shall bring them in to see you, my liege. If you do not resolve this issue, then... no one shall be permitted to marry Chanelle. And I am sure that is not what she wants."
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate II.
The quest-giver is called William Reirrac. William Reirrac is a knight of the Most Noble Order of the Radiant Heart.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to rescue the knights of the Most Noble Order of the Radiant Heart.
The player should first repel the invasion to the Amnian outpost to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Umar Hills, hills.
The following groups are related to this quest: Most Noble Order of the Radiant Heart (an order of holy knights), Sythillisian Empire (a hostile empire).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player is a member of the Most Noble Order of the Radiant Heart. Sythillisian Empire has invaded Amnian lands.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Welcome. I, William Reirrac, have been awaiting you. You should know the particulars of your service here and what being a member of the Most Noble Order of the Radiant Heart really means.
You are aware of the conflict with the Sythillisian Empire? There have been invasions into Amnian lands. We have been monitoring outposts, and all is not well. One outpost reported an imminent attack because an enemy unit needed their supplies. A runner barely made it with the information, and we fear the worst.
You must leave immediately for the furthest lengths of the Umar Hills. You must join the combat and rescue our knights, for they are surely outnumbered.
Go, and rescue whom you can. You have little time."

This is an RPG quest from Baldur's Gate II.
The quest-giver is called Dawnbringer Sain. Dawnbringer Sain is priest of Lathander, who is located at temple of Lathander.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to return Dawn Ring to the temple of Lathander.
The player should first intercept the thieves transporting Dawn Ring to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: the slums at night.
The following characters are related to this quest: Lathander, the Morninglord (the good god of dawn), Talos (an evil god).
The following items are related to this quest: Dawn Ring (a ring).
The following groups are related to this quest: Talassans (followers of Talos), thieves.
There are some important facts concerning this quest. There are many new artworks and aged relics on display at the temple of Lathander. Dawn Ring was stolen from the temple of Lathander. The thieves were hired by the Talassans of temple of Talos.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Good day, it's Dawnbringer Sain, the priest of Lathander.
I would ask a dangerous thing of you. You're free to refuse, but the greater glory of Lathander is at stake.
The Morninglord takes great pride in the artifacts of his rule. We have many items on display at the temple of Lathander, from new artworks to the aged relics of bygone days. Today we are one less. We are the victims of thievery, and our followers have been shaken by this vulnerability. Quick steps must be taken to rectify this.
We know the culprits; they have not concealed their crime. Talassans, slinking from their temple to degrade our worship, hired common thieves for the deed! They fear no retribution. The Morninglord cannot suffer his relics in the hands of such evil.
Find these thieves before the Talassans receive the items.
The spark of dawn has lit the way.
Go to the filth of the slums at night and intercept the delivery of our Dawn Ring. Bring it back to its proper place."
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from Minecraft.
The quest-giver is called Heide. Heide is an annoyed fisherman, who is located at Fishing Hamlet.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to recover Heide's fishing rod.
The player should first find the Elder Guardian that swallowed Heide's fishing rod, and kill it to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: an ocean monument: a dangerous underwater temple made out of turquoise stone blocks, located far south of Fishing Hamlet.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: enough cooked salmon to last the player's lifetime.
The player will encounter the following enemies during this quest: Elder Guardian (one-eyed, large, pale, evil pufferfish that can shoot laser, and make the player fatigued when the player is near them).
The following locations are related to this quest: Fishing Hamlet (a fishing village).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player is an enemy of Heide.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I just escaped with my life from a friggin' Elder Guardian, and now I run into you, my least favorite person in the whole world.
The damn Elder Guardian swallowed the hook, line, and sinker of my fishing rod while I was out in the sea fishing on my boat. It must have eaten the whole fishing rod after it slipped from my grip into the sea.
I shouldn't have gone fish so close to the ocean monument far south of this village. I just couldn't see the turquoise stones that make up the monument before it was too late. Who even built those dangerous underwater temples anyway?
I have a proposition for you: recover my fishing rod from the Elder Guardian, and I'll set you up with enough cooked salmon to last your lifetime. We might even become friends. First, you have to find the Elder Guardian, and kill it.
Elder Guardians are one-eyed, large, pale, evil pufferfish. They can shoot laser, and make you fatigued when you get close to them."
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from Minecraft.
The quest-giver is called Harry. Harry is a mason.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to give 10 pistons to Harry.
The player should first craft 10 pistons to complete their objective.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: 32 Nether Quartz (a rare crafting ingredient, used to make quartz pillars).
The following items are related to this quest: 3 wooden planks, 4 cobblestone, Redstone Dust (a crafting ingredient that powers up contraptions).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player is an infamous person. The player can craft a piston with 3 wooden planks, 4 cobblestone, an iron ingot, and Redstone Dust.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"You are the person who's been causing trouble in these parts, aren't you?
Why don't we put your energy to a better use? I'm a mason, which means that I have to move large quantities of stone from one place to another. I'd like to automate that process with pistons. That would save me from backache.
The problem is I don't have the materials for making pistons, or the know-how to craft them. This is where you enter the picture. Craft 10 pistons, and then bring them to me. I know that you need 3 wooden planks, 4 cobblestone, an iron ingot, and Redstone Dust for crafting a piston.
Some quarts pillars broke while we were transporting them. You could have the remaining 32 Nether Quartz from them."

The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to bring Kate's notebook to her.
The player should first find the buried treasure to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: a beach not that far away from Seaside Settlement.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: the player may keep the rest of the buried treasure.
The following locations are related to this quest: Seaside Settlement (a coastal village).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Kate has heard that the player helps people. Kate gives the player a map that points the player to the buried treasure.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I have not always been a simple villager of Seaside Settlement. I was a pirate queen: I pillaged many a ship that linger the bottom of the ocean with my crew.
Alas, my life was turned upside down one fateful day: my ship sank, and I washed up to the shore. A kind villager from this very village found me and helped me regain my strength. I left my pirate days behind, and settled down in Seaside Settlement.
However, I'd still like to obtain my notebook from those days: I accidentally dropped it into the last treasure chest we buried into the ground. My adventuring days are over: you, however, are known to do odd tasks of more or less adventurous nature to others. I'll give you my treasure map: it will lead you to the buried treasure.
You may keep the buried treasure to yourself, I just ask you to give me my notebook."

The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to see what happens after eating suspicious stew, and report back to Dave.
The player should first eat the suspicious stew Dave gives you to complete their objective.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: 10 emeralds.
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Suspicious stew is mushroom stew laced with some flowers: it may have positive or negative effects on its eater.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I keep the villagers fed. Without my crops, our village would surely face a famine!
Sometimes, I like to cook new foods using various natural ingredients to prepare us for poor harvests. This time, I tried to make some mushroom stew, but one of the villagers accidentally tripped, and dropped some flowers into the pot with the stew.
Traveler, could you please taste the suspicious mushroom stew? It can have either positive or negative effects on its eater. I'm giving you some.
Please see what happens after eating the suspicious stew, and report back to me. I'd hate to throw away the whole batch of mushroom stew for nothing. I'll even give you 10 emeralds for being a taster."

The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to bring 32 blocks of iron to Arnold.

"I want to become famous. Just not quite like you, hero. I seek to become the best armorer in the world. To do that, I need a lot of practice in hammering down pieces of armor.
Would you please bring me 32 blocks of iron? Those should help me become a better armorer in no time! First, you have to get iron ore from the many iron veins in the ground. Next, you'll want to smelt the ore into iron ingots in a furnace somewhere. Lastly, you ought to craft those iron ingots into blocks of iron on a crafting table.
Do all that, and I promise to outfit you in better armor than what you are wearing now!"

This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I have made all sorts of things from leather: tunics, hats, and even little tent-houses. There's nothing new I can create...
Could you perhaps help me out of this sea of creative depression? You do help people? Please find me a new material to work with! Perhaps turtle scutes would work...
Please help me get my hands on ten scutes: you can get them from turtles on sandy beaches. I'll give you a stack of leather for your services!"

This is an RPG quest from Minecraft.
The quest-giver is called Tove. Tove is a storyteller, who is located at a village.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to kill the Wither.
The player should first 1) gather up 3 wither skeleton skulls, and 4 blocks of soul sand, 2) summon the Wither with the gathered items to complete their objective. These tasks can be completed in the following locations: 1) Nether(a hellish realm), 2) a place of the player's choosing.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: Nether Star (a rare item).
The player will encounter the following enemies during this quest: Wither (an extremely dangerous skeletal creature capable of bombing out everything in its surroundings).
The following items are related to this quest: 3 wither skeleton skulls, 4 blocks of soul sand.
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Tove draws the summoning pattern of the Wither for the player.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I'm a storyteller. I always like to hear new stories that I can pass along to the people of this village.
Old legends tell about a mighty skeletal creature known only as the "Wither." It is said that it can bomb out everything in its surroundings. If you killed the Wither, I'd give you a rare Nether Star as a reward.
I'll draw you the summoning pattern of the Wither. You need to gather up certain items from the hellish Nether: three wither skeleton skulls, and four blocks of soul sand. Use these items to summon the Wither."

This is an RPG quest from Minecraft.

The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to hit Test Subject with lightning, and report back to Judas.
The player should first go to Test Subject when there's a thunderstorm to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Desolate Plains, the desert outside Woodland Homestead.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: the player can keep the trident.
The following characters are related to this quest: Test Subject (a depressed man from Woodland Homestead, who volunteered for Judas's experiment, located at Desolate Plains).
The following locations are related to this quest: Woodland Homestead (a village).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player is a famous hero. Judas gives the player an enchanted trident: the player can channel lightning with it during thunderstorms.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"As a cleric, my duty is to heal the villagers of Woodland Homestead both spiritually and physically. As a hero, your duty is to help people in trouble.
I sometimes devise new treatments for various illnesses: some of my experiments are successful, the others, sadly, not so much. I would like you to assist me with an experiment. I also have a volunteer participating in the experiment as well: a depressed man from this very village.
I need you to go to the Desolate Plains, the desert just outside this village, and hit that test subject of mine with lightning when there's a thunderstorm. For this, I'm giving you an enchanted trident: you can use it to channel lightning during thunderstorms.
Finally, you should report back to me, and let me know what happened. You can keep the trident.
May the Gods be with you, hero!"

This is an RPG quest from Minecraft.
The quest-giver is called Henrik. Henrik is a sneaky villager.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to make Illagers fight each other.
The player should first 1) steal Tony's axe without being seen, 2) kill Tom, and pin his death on Tony by planting Tony's axe on Tom's corpse to complete their objective. These tasks can be completed in the following locations: 1) an Illager camp to the northeast, 2) an Illager outpost to the north.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: something highly valuable.
The following characters are related to this quest: Tom (a male Illager captain, located at an Illager outpost to the north), Tony (a taciturn male Illager captain, a rival of Tom's, located at an Illager camp to the northeast).
The following groups are related to this quest: Illagers (bandits).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Henrik has heard that the player help people.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"You are a friend of us villagers, and have helped many of us. Now I'd like you to do something a bit... less conventional.
Illagers have been bothering us for ages: we villagers are not fighters; we can't hold our own against those bloodthirsty brigands. I want you to sow distrust among their ranks: make them fight amongst themselves.
I already have a plan for you to follow. There are two Illager captains, Tony and Tom, who do not exactly see eye to eye. You should go to the Illager camp to the northeast, and pinch Tony's axe without being seen. Then, move on to the Illager outpost to the north of here, kill Tom, and plant Tony's axe on Tom's body. Tony is known to be quick to anger: Tom's men will go after him, for they will assume that Tony killed their leader.
Do this grueling task, and I'll have something highly valuable for you."

I'm happy at the moment, but knowing what happens to any sheep named "jeb_" would make me even happier. I something good happens, I shall name all of them so. If something bad happens, I will warn all shepherds about this particular name.

This is an RPG quest from Minecraft.
The quest-giver is called Kitt. Kitt is a sad cleric, who is located at Seaside Settlement.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to recover a bundle of potion ingredients for Kitt.
The player should first find the bundle of potion ingredients to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: a sunken ship east of Seaside Settlement.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: a brewing stand.
The following locations are related to this quest: Seaside Settlement (a coastal village).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player a friend of Kitt. Kitt gives the player a potion of water breathing.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"The ship sank. All those poor sailors have now passed the veil to the other side. This is a sad day for us all.
My friend, that ship carried important potion ingredient for our village. Most of the goods that are not produced here are transported here by the sea. Now I can't fashion remedies for our villagers, and the next shipment will not be here for a long time.
You are a good person. I ask you to find a bundle of life-saving potion ingredients for me. That would mean a lot for the whole village! The bundle should be in the sunken ship east of here. Here, this potion of water breathing should help you dive to the ship save and sound.
I'll even let you have my old, extra brewing stand as a gift upon your return. Be careful while you dive; there a many lethal things lurking beneath the waves. I'd hate to bury a friend."
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from Minecraft.
The quest-giver is called Dana. Dana is a female butcher.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to bring a lava bucket, blaze rod, and a block of coal to Dana.
The player should first 1) obtain a lava bucket, 2) obtain a blaze rod, 3) obtain a block of coal to complete their objective. These tasks can be completed in the following locations: 1) lava pools deep underground, 2) Nether(a hellish place), 3) ore veins seated in stone.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: a year's supply of steak.
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Dana gives the player a bucket.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"My job is to sell meat of all sorts: both cooked and raw. I take pride in my craftsmanship: I always try to find new, improved ways to cook meat.
I have a hypothesis: the fuel used in my oven affects the taste of the meat that's cooked in it. I'd like to test out different materials to feed the flames of my oven: a bucket of lava, a blaze rod, and a block of coal, for starters.
Would you help a butcher better her craft? Bring the items I mentioned to me, and I'll cook you a year's worth of steak.
Lava can be found in pools deep under the ground. I'll give you a bucket for scooping out the lava. Blaze rods a trickier to obtain; you have to brave the hellscape that is the Nether. Coal, on the contrary, is quite easy to get. Just look out for ore veins seated in stone."
<|endoftext|>

I would like you to scout out Darkwood. Be cautious. Darkwood is a dark, dense forest with thick leaf canopies that block sunlight: perfect for ambushes. Find out if the Dark Hall truly exists. I'll pay you a block of emerald! Those are not that easy to come by!"

This is an RPG quest from Minecraft.
The quest-giver is called Kaz. Kaz is a weaponsmith.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to bring 8 Ancient Debris to Kaz.
The player should first mine 8 Ancient Debris to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Nether, a lethal dimension, where the player can easily burn in lava.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: a new kind of sword.
The following items are related to this quest: Netherite (a metal that cuts sharper than diamond), Ancient Debris (a rare ore that can be refined into Netherite).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player is an enemy of Kaz.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"A nasty person like you can go to the Nether. No one would miss you, if you were to die in there. If you don't burn yourself in lava, you could do a bit something for me there.
I have heard that there's a new kind of metal that can be fashioned into a sword that cuts sharper than diamond! I can't wait to experiment on that metal: it's called Netherite, and it can be refined from a rare ore known only as "Ancient Debris".
Mine 8 Ancient Debris, and bring them to me. I'll even fashion you a new kind of sword for your help. Only use it on monsters: you'll just dull its blade for nothing by sticking it into innocent villagers."

This might be a difficult task to accomplish. You will be rewarded accordingly: five blocks of diamond. Surely you too are curious about what happens."

So here it is: What does the name Hazadir mean to you? Few recognize the name anymore, even though he was famous.

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Vangaril. Vangaril is an exiled mage, giving quest via "Weathered Journal", who is located at Lost Boy Caverns.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to follow the story of Vangaril trying to save Erandur from lichdom.
The player should first explore the Lost Boy Caverns for more clues about the fate of Vangaril and Erandur to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Lost Boy Caverns, a cave with catacombs.
The following characters are related to this quest: Erandur (a male necromancer, Vangaril's friend who become a lich, located at Lost Boy Caverns).
The following items are related to this quest: "Weathered Journal" (a journal).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Erandur's necromantic studies got Erandur and Vangaril expelled from the Guild of Mages. Vangaril tried to get from the Guild of Mages after Erandur became a lich, but Vangaril was turned away: Vangaril went to face Erandur alone.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Weathered Journal
by Vangaril

Long have I sought to purge the evils haunting Erandur. Even when his necromantic studies resulted in our mutual expulsion from the Guild of Mages, I persisted in guiding him towards good with a gentle hand. Alas, in our exile, my old friend has mired himself in the foul practice, and in shocking discovery I learned he had become a miserly disciple of the Worm King, a cunning wraith. A Lich.
Frail memory strengthened by dogmatic resolve, the Archmages turned me away when I came to them with my discovery. My pleas for a detachment of battlemages ignored, only my long-past expulsion remembered. And thus, the grave duty falls only to me. I must bear the burden of purging the Lich that was once a friend.
I wander now into the foreboding maw of these catacombs known as the Lost Boy Caverns, far from the climes of common elves and men. With pure spirit and rites of cleansing, I hope to strike down the fearsome Lich and set free the soul of Erandur, but I leave this testament behind, lest I may never return from these depths; as a warning to those who may follow my path.
Faithful, even in Exile,
Vangaril"
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Lucien Lachance. Lucien Lachance is the Speaker for the Black Hand, and the player's superior in the Dark Brotherhood, giving quest via "Orders", who is located at Fort Farragut.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to put a stop to the unseen powers that are unraveling the very fabric of the Dark Brotherhood.
The player should first discuss your special assignment with Lucien Lachance to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Fort Farragut, Lucien Lachance's private refuge, a ruined fort located in the forest northeast of the Cheydinhal Sanctuary.
The following characters are related to this quest: Ocheeva (the leader of the Cheydinhal Sanctuary, located at Cheydinhal Sanctuary).
The following items are related to this quest: "Orders" (a message to the player).
The following groups are related to this quest: Dark Brotherhood (a guild of assassins), Black Hand (the governing body of the Dark Brotherhood).
The following locations are related to this quest: Cheydinhal Sanctuary (one of the guildhalls of the Dark Brotherhood).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. "Orders" is addressed toward the player: the player is an Eliminator. The player should not share the contents of this message with anyone at the Cheydinhal Sanctuary, including Ocheeva, and make no mention of their journey to Fort Farragut. Fort Farragut is guarded by rotting sentinels who will attack any interlopers on sight.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Orders
by Lucien Lachance

Eliminator,
You have served the Dark Brotherhood well in the short time you have been with us. Indeed, the rate of your advancement has been rather remarkable. Now the Black Hand itself is in need of your abilities.
You must proceed with all haste to my private refuge in the ruins of Fort Farragut, located in the forest northeast of the Cheydinhal Sanctuary. When you arrive, we will discuss the nature of your special assignment.
I cannot stress to you enough the importance of your swift arrival at Fort Farragut. There are unseen powers working to unravel the very fabric of the Dark Brotherhood. The Black Hand is counting on you to prevent this disaster.
Do not share the contents of this message with anyone at the Cheydinhal Sanctuary, including Ocheeva, and make no mention of your journey to Fort Farragut! Also, be warned -- my refuge within Fort Farragut is guarded by denizens who will attack any interloper on sight. Get through these rotting sentinels and you will surely have earned the right to visit my private sanctum.
Lucien Lachance"
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.

The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: recommendation from Kud-Ei.
The following characters are related to this quest: Ardaline (a female mage who is bullied by Varon Vamori), Varon Vamori (a man).
The following groups are related to this quest: Mages Guild (a guild of mages).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player asked a recommendation from Kud-Ei. Varon Vamori stole Ardaline's mage's staff. Kud-Ei gives the player a scroll with a powerful Illusion charm spell.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I'm afraid I haven't had time to prepare anything conventional for your recommendation. I'm very preoccupied with this situation concerning Ardaline.
Perhaps you can help with that, however. I can't directly get involved, for fear of embarrassing the poor girl. Varon Vamori's been bothering Ardaline every day for a while now. He even stole her Mages' Staff! Perhaps he thinks it's amusing; I don't know. But it needs to stop. It's making her miserable.
I'll need you to have a little chat with Varon Vamori to get Ardaline's staff back, and you can learn something about the power of Illusion in the process. Take this charm scroll. With it, you should find Varon more receptive to questioning.
Don't come back without that staff. I'll write you a recommendation for your help."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Lathon. Lathon is the squire of Sir Roderic.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to avenge Sir Roderic, and recover the Sword of the Crusader for yourself.
The player should first find the the wraith of Sir Berich to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Underpall Cave, not a cave - a buried keep hosting Sir Berich's tomb.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: Sword of the Crusader (a holy sword).
The following characters are related to this quest: Sir Roderic (a holy knight, located at Underpall Cave), Sir Berich (a questing knight of old, located at Underpall Cave).
The following items are related to this quest: Greaves of the Crusader (holy greaves).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player is a holy knight. Sir Roderic is dead: he was questing for the holy Relics at the Prophet's call with Lathon. Sir Roderic prayed at all the shrines, and received a disturbing vision featuring Sir Berich: Sir Berich had found the Greaves of the Crusader and the Sword of the Crusader, but had then turned to evil. Sir Roderic found the Relics and the wraith of Sir Berich within Sir Berich's tomb: Sir Roderic shouted for Lathon to take the Greaves of the Crusader. Lathon gives the player the Greaves of the Crusader. The wraith of Sir Berich attacked Sir Roderic with the Sword of the Crusader.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Sir knight! I have terrible news. Sir Roderic... I think he's dead.
Sir Roderic was a holy knight, like you, questing for the Relics at the Prophet's call. I, Lathon, was his squire. I believed he was chosen by the gods to reclaim the Relics. At first things were going well. He prayed at all the shrines, and received a vision. A disturbing vision. "The shade of Sir Berich spoke to me," was all he said. "We must put him to rest." He said that Sir Berich's tomb was in Underpall Cave -- which is no cave, but some kind of buried keep.
He had learned that Sir Berich had once been a questing knight, like us. He had found the Greaves and Sword of the Crusader, but then turned to evil. Sir Roderic hoped to find the Relics within Sir Berich's tomb. And he did. But we also found a terrible guardian -- the wraith of Sir Berich.
I brought you... Sir Roderic shouted for me to take them... the Greaves of the Crusader. The holy Relic. They're yours. The wraith used the Sword of the Crusader against Sir Roderic. I don't know how that evil thing could use the holy weapon, but it did.
You must avenge Sir Roderic by killing the foul wraith and get yourself the Sword of the Crusader!"

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Diram Serethi. Diram Serethi is an innkeeper, who is located at Aleswell.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to help the citizens of Aleswell become visible again.
The player should first find Ancotar and make him remove the invisibility to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: ruins of Fort Caractacus, just to the southeast of Aleswell, the path down the hill.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: free lodging in Aleswell Inn.
The following characters are related to this quest: Ancotar (a male wizard, located at ruins of Fort Caractacus).
The following locations are related to this quest: Aleswell (a small town).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. All citizens of Aleswell became invisible several weeks ago: the citizens of Aleswell think that Ancotar is behind their invisibility. There are invisible monsters in the ruins of Fort Caractacus.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Excuse me. I'm innkeeper Diram Serethi. We have a small problem that we hope you can help us with.
You may be wondering why you can't see me. We are all wondering the same thing. Everyone in Aleswell suddenly became invisible several weeks ago. It was sort of fun at first, but the novelty has definitely worn off now. You can imagine how difficult it is to run an inn while invisible. Once you get a reputation as a haunted inn, you can just forget about it. So we've all been keeping quiet, hoping the spell will wear off. But we're running out of patience. We're sure it was Ancotar's doing, but we can't find him. If you can help us, we will be extremely grateful.
Ancotar's a wizard who took up residence in the ruins of Fort Caractacus a couple of years ago. He's caused us no end of trouble with his magical experiments, but nothing as bad as this. We've tried to find him, but had no luck. If he's still living in the fort, he's hiding from us, and no wonder. If you could find him and get him to remove this cursed invisibility, we will all be in your debt. The ruined fort is just to the southeast of here. Follow the path down the hill. But watch out for the invisible monsters that infest the ruins!
If you make us visible again, you'd be welcome at the Aleswell Inn anytime. Free of charge."

Well, if you're dead set on learning something from me, then how about you do a little something for me, first? Something for her, to be honest.
I'd like to get her a gift of a sort. Nothing terribly fancy, and something useful... How about a nice silver pitcher, and a set of four glasses. Here's 50 gold to cover the costs, that should be more than enough. Come see me when you've got everything, and we'll talk more."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Sickly Bernice. Sickly Bernice is a sickly woman, and the proprietor, who is located at a tavern.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to bring Aquanostrum to Sickly Bernice.
The player should first find Aquanostrum to cure Sickly Bernice's illness to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Knotty Bramble, a root cave.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: Circlet of Verdure.
The following items are related to this quest: Aquanostrum (a liquid cure that bubbles up from around an old statue).
The following locations are related to this quest: Shivering Isles (a realm).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Sickly Bernice thinks these may be her last days in the Shivering Isles. On the lowest level of the Knotty Bramble, there is a pool containing Aquanostrum: Sickly Bernice gives the player a special flask to collect the Aquanostrum.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Oh... hello. Sickly Bernice, proprietor. Don't get too close now. You might catch what I have.
Well... it seems I am dying. Yes, these may be my last days in the Shivering Isles. That is, unless someone like yourself could help me find the cure. But no one has taken me up on my offer, even with the promise of a reward. Ah well, it's been a good life I suppose....
There's only one place in all the Isles to get the cure for what I have... Knotty Bramble. I'll mark it on your map. There, on the lowest level of the place, is a pool containing the cure: Aquanostrum. Legend has it that it bubbles up from around an old statue. Bring me back the remedy, and I will reward you well with a Circlet of Verdure. Here, take this special flask to collect the Aquanostrum."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Glarthir. Glarthir is a paranoid town eccentric, who is located at Great Chapel of Julianos.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to check out some people for Glarthir.
The player should first 1) see where Bernadette Peneles goes and what she does, 2) meet Glarthir again tomorrow night to complete their objective. These tasks can be completed in the following locations: 1) outside Glarthir's house in Skingrad at 6 am, 2) Great Chapel of Julianos(a large church in Skingrad).
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: lots of gold.
The following characters are related to this quest: Bernadette Peneles (a woman who has been kind to Glarthir, located at Skingrad).
The following locations are related to this quest: Skingrad (a town).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player came to meet with Glarthir. Glarthir thinks that everyone in Skingrad is watching him. The player should not contact Glarthir in public.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Ah, you came. You're sure you weren't followed? Good, I thought I could trust you. Nobody else in town.
They're all in on it ... all watching me. Well. Yes. I need you to do something for me. I'll pay you -- gold. You like gold, don't you? Lots of gold.
Here's my problem. I'm being followed. Watched. Marukhati Selectives, maybe. Not sure. I'm a threat, you see? To their plans. I know too much. I need you to check out some people for me, the ones that are following me. Watch them, see where they go, who they report to. Will you help me?
Today I caught Bernadette Peneles watching me. I have very little doubt now that she is one of them. This saddens me. I had thought her one of the few to show me kindness in this nest of treachery. But now it seems that it was all a lie.
Be outside my house at 6 am, you'll see her watching me. See where she goes and who she reports to. We'll meet here again tomorrow night. Oh, and NEVER contact me in public. They're watching. They can't know you're helping me."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Tove. Tove is an eccentric man, nicknamed "The Unrestful".
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to help Tove build a sky boat from calipers and tongs.
The player should first sell calipers and tongs to Tove to complete their objective.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: 5 gold per calipers and tongs.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Hello, my name is Tove. "The Unrestful," they call me. So much to do, and so little time. There's only one of me to go around, you know!
I keep forgetting that most people don't remember when we'll meet in the future. Wait, this is yesterday's future. I'm the one that's confused. Anyway, you're going to help me find calipers and tongs. No point in denying it. You've already agreed tomorrow.
I'm using them to build my skyboat. Just between you and me, the hardest part has been getting the water to not fall out of the air. Now if I can just get the water to fly through the air. That's what the calipers and tongs are for. I need them to keep the water airborne.
Are you willing to sell me calipers and tongs? Five gold each, just like I told you next week."

There are some important facts concerning this quest. The Greymarch has swept the Fringe.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"The Greymarch has swept the Fringe. Order gathers its forces there as we speak. And I hate when people gather forces in My Fringe. You'll need to put an end to that. Stop them.
My armies should already be there, but I want you to see what you can do to help. If they continue to marshal their forces there, we won't be able to contain them. Make sure they can't."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Countess Valga. Countess Valga is a female noble ruling over Chorrol, who is located at Chorrol.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to purchase Arborwatch.
The player should first give 20,000 gold to Countess Valga to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Chorrol, a city.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: Arborwatch (a gorgeous house in Chorrol, on the main plaza).
The following characters are related to this quest: Seed-Neeus (a female merchant, located at Northern Goods and Trade).
The following locations are related to this quest: Northern Goods and Trade (Seed-Neeus's store).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The last tenant of Arborwatch has cleaned the place of furniture. Seed-Neeus should have furniture for sale.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"It is a pleasure to meet you. I am Countess Valga of Chorrol.
Are you looking for a house to buy? There is a positively gorgeous home for sale right on the main plaza. You'll be hard pressed to find a nicer home for sale in Chorrol.
The house is called Arborwatch, and it costs 20,000 gold to buy the house from me. It would be a pleasure to have you become a citizen of Chorrol.
The last tenant of Arborwatch has cleaned the place of furniture. I'd recommend stopping by Northern Goods and Trade. The owner, Seed-Neeus, should have everything you need."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Guilbert Jemane. Guilbert Jemane is a grateful man.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to help Guilbert Jemane and Reynald Jemane recover Weatherleah.
The player should first find Weatherleah, and see if it is still inhabited by ogres to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: somewhere south of Chorrol, but southwest of Fort Carmala.
The following characters are related to this quest: Reynald Jemane (Guilbert Jemane's twin brother).
The following locations are related to this quest: Weatherleah (the childhood home of Guilbert Jemane and Reynald Jemane, where no human has lived for years), Chorrol (a town), Fort Carmala (a fort).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player reunited Guilbert Jemane and Reynald Jemane. Ogres attacked Weatherleah when Guilbert Jemane and Reynald Jemane were little children: Guilbert Jemane and Reynald Jemane's parents fled from Weatherleah. Guilbert Jemane and Reynald Jemane's father carried Guilbert Jemane to safety and later returned to Weatherleah believing Reynald Jemane and the boys' mother had perished. Guilbert Jemane and Reynald Jemane's mother carried Reynald to safety: their mother did not survive.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I can't thank you enough for helping to reunite me with Reynald. I never would have guessed he was still alive. We have much to discuss, but if you have time, I'd beg you stay a moment longer and hear about our home, Weatherleah.
Weatherleah was our family's home for generations. Our parents fled it when ogres attacked; they became separated. My father carried me to safety. He later returned and believed Reynald and my mother had perished. Since ogres are cannibals, he didn't expect to find their bodies. Thankfully, however, it seems that my mother managed to carry Reynald to safety. While my mother didn't survive, Reynald did, and for that I'm grateful.
But we both want more - we want our home back. We're not fighters; you appear to have more skill than either of us. Would you go to Weatherleah, and see if it's still inhabited by ogres?
Now, we're not quite sure where the estate is located. We'll offer up what we know, however. We believe it's somewhere south of Chorrol, but southwest of Fort Carmala. It may be difficult to find. Since no one's lived there for many years, it may be quite overgrown by now.
If you find Weatherleah, let us know. We'll be waiting anxiously."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Ursanne. Ursanne is a worried wife.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to find Aleron Loche.
The player should first speak with Kurdan gro-Dragol to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Lonely Suitor Lodge, an inn.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: anything.
The following characters are related to this quest: Aleron Loche (Ursanne's missing husband who developed a gambling addiction), Kurdan gro-Dragol (an impatient male usurer, located at Lonely Suitor Lodge).
The following items are related to this quest: 500 gold.
The following locations are related to this quest: Imperial City (a nice town).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Aleron Loche wasted Ursanne and his hard earned money on bets: Aleron Loche wanted to move him and Ursanne to the Imperial City. Aleron Loche borrowed money from Kurdan gro-Dragol: Aleron Loche owes Kurdan gro-Dragol 500 gold. Aleron Loche did not return home after meeting Kurdan gro-Dragol at the Lonely Suitor Lodge yesterday.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I'm Ursanne. I'm sorry to impose upon you like this, but I'm in need of assistance, and I don't know what to do. My husband, Aleron, is missing.
It all started when Aleron became foolish, and started gambling. He'd visit the arena every week and spend our hard earned money on bets. I told him to stop, but he didn't listen. He was certain he could win us a fortune and move us somewhere nicer, like the Imperial City. It didn't take long for Aleron to begin losing. He resorted to borrowing money from a usurer to cover his losses and place new bets. As you can imagine, it didn't pay off. He ended up owing around 500 gold. We could never have that kind of money to pay back the usurer.
Yesterday, the usurer, Kurdan gro-Dragol, sent for my husband to meet him at the Lonely Suitor Lodge. He hasn't returned since. I fear for his life. Kurdan isn't known for his patience. Please, I'm not wealthy, but I'd give anything to see Aleron again. Please, find Aleron.
Farewell, and be careful, Kurdan is not to be trusted."

"You seem far too nice to be one of Ulrich Leland's men. What can I do for you?
Don't even get me started about Ulrich. That madman won't be satisfied until everyone in town is dead broke...or in jail! What in Oblivion is Ulrich doing with all that money anyway? I'm sure he's lining his pockets with the gold of the good citizens of Cheydinhal.
There's only one man who seems to care: Garrus Darelliun, the second-in-command of the guard. I hear he isn't happy with Ulrich. I don't know what you can do for us in this situation. I mean, Ulrich Leland is the Captain after all.
Perhaps you could speak to Garrus. You can find him roaming the County Hall of the castle most of the time."

The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: Benirus Manor (a manor in Anvil, across the street from the Chapel).
The following locations are related to this quest: Anvil (a city).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Benirus Manor belonged to Velwyn's grandfather: Velwyn is selling Benirus Manor because he has pressing matters elsewhere. The player gets the key to the front door and the deed of ownership after buying Benirus Manor.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I'm Velwyn. You wouldn't happen to be in the market for a home would you? If you are, I just happen to be selling a manor located right here in Anvil.
I'm selling my grandfather's house, Benirus Manor. If you're interested, I could let you have it for a modest sum, 5,000 gold. I have to sell it soon, as I have pressing matters elsewhere. You're welcome to take a look at it. It is located across the street from the Chapel.
Once you buy, you get the key to the front door and the deed of ownership. That's the deal."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Arnora Auria. Arnora Auria is a female thief.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to find out where Jorundr and Arnora Auria's stolen gold is hidden.
The player should first speak to Jorundr to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Bruma Castle Dungeons, a prison in Bruma.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: Arnora Auria will split the stolen gold between the player and herself.
The following characters are related to this quest: Jorundr (a male thief, and Arnora Auria's ex-boyfriend, located at Bruma Castle Dungeons).
The following locations are related to this quest: Bruma (a city in Cyrodiil), Imperial City (a major city in Cyrodiil), Cyrodiil (a province).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Jorundr and Arnora Auria have had a rocky relationship: Jorundr and Arnora Auria committed petty crimes all over Cyrodiil. Jorundr started to take risks and began robbing more dangerous targets. Arnora Auria got afraid of Jorundr. Jorundr and Arnora Auria's last score was a tax shipment being delivered to the Imperial City: Jorundr killed a guard and he was captured by the Bruma guard two days later at Jorundr and Arnora Auria's makeshift campsite. Jorundr had moved the stolen gold away from the campsite.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Here's the deal. Jorundr and I have had a rocky relationship at best.
Against my will, I've been dragged all over Cyrodiil helping him commit petty crimes. I wouldn't say we're thieves. I mean, we've stolen things... sure. But we've never stolen that much at one time. Just enough to keep us going. That is, until last year.
Jorundr started to take risks and began robbing more dangerous targets. Not just lone merchants, mind you. I'm talking about the bigger scores. Like estates and tax shipments. I begged him to stop, as I knew that his capers would one day lead to violence. He just threatened to... hurt me if I got in his way. I think the gold changed him. I really do. He wasn't the man I met seven years ago. The few times I tried to say something, he'd strike me or push me away. I began to become frightened of him.
Our last score was a tax shipment being delivered to the Imperial City. We robbed it, and in the midst of the chaos, Jorundr killed a guard. I was mortified. We snatched up the gold and holed up in the mountains. He said if I breathed a word of the murder to anyone, he'd kill me. I was terrified of him at this point. Two days later, the Bruma City Guard traced us to our makeshift campsite. I was off gathering food, but Jorundr was captured. Served him right. When I went back to the site later, the gold was gone! He'd moved it! What I need you to do is go to the Bruma Castle Dungeons and speak to him for me. Convince him to tell you where the gold is and then we split it."
<|endoftext|>

"This one moves! A welcome change. So, mortal, you have found my shrine, and you have seen my followers. They are an embarrassment to me, Peryite.
The fools cast a spell in the hopes of summoning me to them. It was prideful and foolish, and it has had its consequences. My followers are trapped between worlds; their bodies here on this plane, their souls in Oblivion. I would have you reunite the bodies and the souls.
I will transport you to the plane of Oblivion in which they are trapped. Find their souls. When all are collected, I will return you here.
You shall have Spell Breaker, with my blessing. May it bring you order."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Tivela Lythandas. Tivela Lythandas is a distraught wife, who is located at Tivela Lythandas and Rythe's home.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to help Tivela Lythandas find her husband who has gone missing.
The player should first find clues about Rythe's whereabouts to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Rythe's painting studio.
The following characters are related to this quest: Rythe (Tivela Lythandas' husband, and one of the best painters in all Cyrodiil).
The following locations are related to this quest: Cyrodiil (a province).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Rythe makes lifelike paintings about the Great Forest. Rythe keeps his studio locked: he did not come out of his studio for a full day. Tivela Lythandas unlocked the studio with the key Rythe said to use only in emergencies: Rythe was not inside his studio. Tivela Lythandas gives the player the key to Rythe's studio. Tivela Lythandas will be around the house should the player need her.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I'm Tivela Lythandas. I apologize that I can't give you the respect a guest in my home would normally receive, but I am at my wit's end. I am sorry to be so forward, but I desperately need your help. It seems that my husband, Rythe, has gone missing, and I just don't know what to do.
Rythe is known far and wide as one of the best painters in all Cyrodiil. His specialty is setting the Great Forest to canvas. The paintings look so amazingly real that some say they can see the trees sway in the breeze. That's a silly notion of course, but it just goes to show the attention to detail Rythe uses when he paints.
Rythe likes to work in his studio with the door locked, so no one can disturb him. He usually comes out to eat dinner and sleep, but two days ago, he didn't come out at all. At first, I wasn't worried. He does that occasionally. But when he didn't come out for a full day, I unlocked the studio with the key he said to use only in emergencies. It turned out he wasn't inside! I'm sure he never left that room. So I have no idea where he's gone.
Please. Help me find Rythe. I love him dearly, and I am so worried. Here's the key to Rythe's studio. You may come and go as you please. If you need me, I'll be around the house."
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Arch-Mage Traven. Arch-Mage Traven is the player's guildleader in the Mages Guild, who is located at Arcane University.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to return the Bloodworm Helm to the Arcane University.
The player should first find Irlav Jarol, his group of mages, and the Bloodworm Helm to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Fort Teleman, a fort.
The following characters are related to this quest: Irlav Jarol (a male master wizard of the Mages Guild, located at Fort Teleman), Mannimarco (the male leader of the necromancers).
The following items are related to this quest: Bloodworm Helm (a relic of the necromancers, a helmet).
The following groups are related to this quest: Mages Guild (a guild of mages).
The following locations are related to this quest: Arcane University (the headquarters of the Mages Guild).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Irlav Jarol and his group of mages want to use the Bloodworm Helm to fight Mannimarco. Arch-Mage Traven fears that necromancers might target Irlav Jarol.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"A group of mages led by Irlav Jarol took the Bloodworm Helm, and have retreated to Fort Teleman, in an effort to study it further.
They hope to learn enough from it to find some sort of way to fight Mannimarco. I tried to dissuade them, but it was no use.
I would like the helm to be returned, so that it may be kept safe here in the Arcane University. I fear Irlav has made himself a target for the Necromancers."

The player should first kill Kylius Lonavo and his group of Skooma dealers to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Greyland, a house just up the road.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: the bounty on Kylius Lonavo.

I've been trying to catch Lonavo for months, but every time I approach the place, his lookout sees me and he goes running. I need someone to go in there and put a stop to those fetchers. I don't care what it takes. We must get that poison they're selling off the street.
Bring me Lonavo's ring as proof he's... been dealt with... and I'll give you the bounty on him. Be vigilant. Lonavo is a snake."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Gray Fox. Gray Fox is a legendary thief, and the player's guildmaster at the Thieves Guild.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to steal one of the Elder Scrolls from the Imperial Palace.
The player should first 1) locate the Old Way and use it to travel to the Imperial Palace, 2) find the reading room to complete their objective. These tasks can be completed in the following locations: 1) Imperial Sewers(sewers), 2) Imperial Palace(a palace).
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: if the Gray Fox's plan works, the player will get a reward worth far more than money.
The following characters are related to this quest: Celia Camoran (a famous woman).
The following items are related to this quest: Elder Scrolls (mystical scrolls that simultaneously archive both past and future events, the Gray Fox needs one), Savilla's Stone (a stone that reveals secrets to its fielder), Boots of Springheel Jak (boots that allow the player to leap to unreachable places, they also protect the player from long falls), Arrow of Extrication (an item needed to unlock the final door).
The following groups are related to this quest: Thieves Guild (a guild of thieves).
The following locations are related to this quest: Old Way (an old escape route of Imperial Emperors).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The Gray Fox has worked for eleven years planning this final heist: Savilla's Stone provided the last bit of information he needed. The Elder Scrolls are kept in the Imperial Palace behind a door that cannot be breached: the player will take the Old Way instead. The Gray Fox gives the player the key for the gate to the section of the sewers housing the Old Way. The Gray Fox gives the player the Boots of Springheel Jak, and the Arrow of Extrication: the player needs them to overcome the obstacles in the Old Way. In the reading room, the blind priests will deliver a scroll to the player thinking that the player is Celia Camoran if the player does not speak to them. The Gray Fox will pay the bloodprice for anyone the player kills during this heist, but he cannot stop the Watch from putting a price on the player's head. The Gray Fox has written the player a book with instructions.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"This is the big one. This is the heist that will be written about and talked about for decades to come. We are going to steal one of the Elder Scrolls from the Imperial Palace. Are you ready for this challenge?
There is no buyer. This is for glory, not for money. Our names will become legend. I also have a personal need for this particular scroll. As for your compensation, I ask you to trust me. If my plan works, you will get a reward worth far more than mere money.
I have worked for eleven years planning this heist. Savilla's Stone provided the last bit of information I needed. The Elder Scrolls are kept in the Imperial Palace behind a door that cannot be breached. Savilla's Stone has revealed a path around this door. You will have to travel the Old Way. Once used as an escape route for Imperial Emperors, it has been forgotten for centuries.
The Old Way can be found in the Imperial Sewers. Here is the key for the gate to that section of the sewers. My scrying with Savilla's Stone has provided clues, but not the details. I know the tools you will need there, but not the obstacles themselves. The Boots of Springheel Jak will allow you to leap to an unreachable place. They will also protect you from a long fall. The Arrow of Extrication is the only way to unlock the final door. Take them both.
Once you are inside the Palace itself, you need to find the reading room. The blind priests will deliver a scroll to you there. I arranged for the notable Celia Camoran to want to read a particular Elder Scroll. Don't ask how. However, she will be... unavoidably detained. You will take her place. Do not speak to the priests. They are blindfolded and will not realize it isn't her unless you speak. As the guildmaster, I am waiving bloodprice for anyone you kill during this heist. However, I can't stop the Watch from putting a price on your head.
I have written it all down for you in this book. I've chosen you because you are the best. Good luck."
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Lucien Lachance. Lucien Lachance is an assassin, giving quest via "Dead Drop Orders #6".
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to receive Silencer's next contract after killing Havilstein Hoar-Blood.
The player should first assassinate Havilstein Hoar-Blood to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: a small campsite, on the summit of Gnoll Mountain.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: 500 gold.
The following characters are related to this quest: Silencer (an assassin), Alval Uvani (a dead man), Havilstein Hoar-Blood (a male Nord barbarian, lives alone and exposed, located at a small campsite).
The following items are related to this quest: "Dead Drop Orders #6" (a note).
The following locations are related to this quest: Nornal (an ancient ruin), Solstheim (an island inhabited by Nords), Gnoll Mountain (a mountain).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. "Dead Drop Orders #6" is addressed toward Silencer. Silencer assassinated Alval Uvani like all the others. Havilstein Hoar-Blood savagely butchered the chieftain of a mead hall on Solstheim. In the flooded section of Nornal, Silencer will find a chest submerged in the water: the chest contains contains Silencer's reward for killing Havilstein Hoar-Blood, and Silencer's next contract.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Dead Drop Orders #6
by Lucien Lachance

Alval Uvani is dead, just like all the others. You continue to impress me, Silencer, and I am only too eager to indulge your homicidal instincts.
Your next target is a savage Nord barbarian, living alone and exposed at a small campsite on the summit of Gnoll Mountain. This barbarian, Havilstein Hoar-Blood by name, savagely butchered the chieftain of a mead hall on the island of Solstheim. The chieftain's sister has forgone the Nord custom of extracting the monetary retribution of wergild, and instead wants Hoar-Blood to pay with his life. You, dear Silencer, will help put her family at peace.
You are to go to Gnoll Mountain, locate Havilstein Hoar-Blood, and send his soul to the great beyond.
When Hoar-Blood has been executed, journey to the ancient ruin of Nornal. In the flooded section of that ruin you will find a chest, submerged in the water. As you may have guessed, the chest contains your reward for killing Havilstein Hoar-Blood, 500 gold, and your next contract."
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Umbacano. Umbacano is a collector of Ayleid artifacts, who is located at Imperial City.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to escort Umbacano to the Throne Room of Nenalata.
The player should first try to buy the Crown of Nenalata from Herminia Cinna to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Herminia Cinna's home, in the Imperial City, the Elven Gardens district.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: whatever plunder the player wishes to carry off from Nenalata.
The following characters are related to this quest: Herminia Cinna (a female collector of Ayleid artifacts, and a rival to Umbacano, located at Herminia Cinna's home).
The following groups are related to this quest: Ayleids (an ancient, extinct race of elves).
The following locations are related to this quest: Nenalata (an ancient Ayleid city), Imperial City (a large city).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player has obtained Ayleid artifacts for Umbacano before. Herminia Cinna refuses to sell the Crown of Nenalata to Umbacano. Umbacano needs to go to Nenalata in order to bring his research on the last king of the Ayleids to its final stage.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I have another job for you. This is not quite in your usual line of work, but I hope you can help me just the same.
A rival collector has an item, the Crown of Nenalata, which I very much want to add to my collection. But she stubbornly refuses to consider any of my offers. She and I have had our differences over the years, I admit. Now she is taking this opportunity to get her revenge. I believe that you may be able to persuade her to part with the item, where I cannot due to her prejudice against me. Her name is Herminia Cinna. She lives here in the Imperial City, in the Elven Gardens district.
I hope you will succeed where I have so far failed. Afterwards, in order to bring my research on the last king of the Ayleids to its final stage, I need to go to the Throne Room of Nenalata. While I am not without means of defending myself, I believe you would be an invaluable companion on such an expedition. Your reward will be whatever plunder you wish to carry off from Nenalata. Since the Throne Room has been sealed since the time of the Ayleids, it should provide rich pickings."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Nerussa. Nerussa is a wine collector.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to bring the Shadowbanish Wine to Nerussa.
The player should first find 6 bottles of Shadowbanish Wine to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: the many military fort ruins scattered all over Cyrodiil.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: 1,000 gold.
The following items are related to this quest: 6 Shadowbanish Wine (rare wine from Tamriel that grants its drinker Nighteye).
The following locations are related to this quest: Tamriel (a continent), Cyrodiil (a province in Tamriel).
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Greetings. I'm Nerussa. I'm quite fond of collecting all manners of wines from all over Tamriel. But one vintage continues to elude me: Shadowbanish Wine. How I'd love to add it to my collection.
Apparently the wine is so rare because it was only made in one tiny batch. It's the product of an alchemist who was also a vintner. Besides tasting incredible, the magic within the wine allows the imbiber to be gifted with Night Eye! The vintner made it special for the Legion soldiers posted at the forts when they were active long ago. It was perfect for keeping lookouts warm on cold nights and helping them see better in the dark.
If you can retrieve six bottles of Shadowbanish Wine, I'll gladly pay you well: 1,000 gold. All I know about them is that they're found in the many fort ruins scattered all over Cyrodiil."

Get over to Lord Drad's estate. Let my ogres loose, and get them out! Okay? Get going!
