This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Big Head. Big Head is a madman.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to find the Fork of Horripilation for Big Head.
The player should first talk to Bolwing to hear his secret to complete their objective.
The following characters are related to this quest: Bolwing (a mute male beggar).
The following items are related to this quest: Fork of Horripilation (a special fork).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Big Head will give the player his charm so that the player can speak with Bolwing.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Sing for Big Head.
The Fork for Big Head. Oh, where has Master put the Fork? It sings alone. Far from home. Sad, sad Fork. Sad, sad Big Head.
The Fork! The precious, precious fork! Hear how it sings to Big Head! Beautiful, perfect Fork of Horripilation! But it is gone. Gone, gone, gone. No more singing. No more ringing. Taken from Big Head, never returned. That is when Big Head came here. Master brought me! Whispered shouts into my ear! Songs of Madgods! Songs of bad gods! Softly, Master. Softly.
It went away. But it will come back! It always comes back! It is close. Big Head can hear it! The Fork of Horripilation! Hear it singing! Songs of home! It comes again. It brings presents! It is not present. Soon it will be! You will find it! Bring the Fork! Hear the music. Music of toads. Music of roads! Sing to yourself, so all can hear!
Talk to the beggar! Talk to Bolwing! He knows secrets, but no one can hear them. No one but Big Head. Take Big Head's charm! Listen to Bolwing! His tongue is tied, but his mind is unraveled! He'll tell you the secret. Who has the Fork?"
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Raminus Polus. Raminus Polus is the player's superior in the Mages Guild.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to complete your induction into the Mages Guild by creating your own staff.
The player should first speak to Zahrasha or Eletta, and choose wisely to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: the grove, to the northeast of the Imperial City, near Wellspring Cave.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: the player's own mage staff.
The following characters are related to this quest: Zahrasha (a female mage), Eletta (a female mage).
The following groups are related to this quest: Mages Guild (a guild of mages).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Several mages tend the grove.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Before you can begin work for the guild, you'll need to do something for yourself. Every mage carries a staff. It is crafted and enchanted by the guild, and is a symbol of status. You need such a staff.
The wood used for staves comes from a grove to the northeast of the Imperial City, near Wellspring Cave. Several mages tend to the grove, and should be able to assist you. Speak with either Zahrasha or Eletta when you arrive.
And choose wisely."
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Jauffre. Jauffre is a military leader.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to help the Bruma guard close an Oblivion Gate just outside Bruma.
The player should first meet up with Captain Burd and let him show you the Oblivion Gate to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: outside the Bruma city gate.
The following characters are related to this quest: Countess (the female noble who rules Bruma, located at Bruma), Captain Burd (the male captain of the Bruma guard, located at outside the Bruma city gate).
The following groups are related to this quest: Mythic Dawn (an evil cult that wants to destroy everything).
The following locations are related to this quest: Bruma (a city).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Jauffre has received a message from the Countess: an Oblivion Gate has opened outside the city, and the Mythic Dawn are putting their plan to attack Bruma into motion. Jauffre wants the player to show the Countess's guard how to close Oblivion Gates.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I've just received word from the Countess of Bruma that an Oblivion Gate has opened outside the city. It seems that the Mythic Dawn are putting their plan to attack Bruma into motion.
Since you've dealt with these Gates before, I'd like you to help the Countess's guard close this gate. Once they've seen how it's done, they should be able to handle any new gates on their own.
Captain Burd is waiting for you outside the Bruma city gate. He'll show you the Oblivion Gate. Although I doubt it will be hard to find."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Sir Henrik. Sir Henrik is a ghost of a knight.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to get the Shield of the Crusader for yourself.
The player should first find the Shield of the Crusader to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Fort Bulwark, a fort in the southeast of Cyrodiil, near the Black Marsh border.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: Shield of the Crusader (a holy shield created by Julianos).
The following characters are related to this quest: Julianos (the god of wisdom).
The following locations are related to this quest: Cyrodiil (a province), Black Marsh (a province).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The knight Order Sir Henrik belonged to crumbled: Sir Henrik found the Shield of the Crusader on his own and brought it to Fort Bulwark. Sir Henrik and his trusted friends began work to keep the Shield of the Crusader safe forever. Sir Henrik died defending the Shield of the Crusader at Fort Bulwark.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"In life, I was known as Sir Henrik.
If you are true to the teachings of Julianos, it may be possible for you to find the Shield of the Crusader.
When the Order crumbled, I set out on my own. After years of searching, I found the Shield and brought it to Fort Bulwark for safe keeping. With the help of a few trusted friends, I began work to keep the Shield safe for all eternity. I never saw my work finished. I died defending the fort from those who would take and misuse the Shield. I never saw our work finished; I trust that the others carried on without me.
The fort lies in the southeast of Cyrodiil, near the Black Marsh border. If all went according to plan, it should be very well guarded now."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Andragil. Andragil is a master blocker.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to demonstrate your blocking skills to Andragil.
The player should first block Andragil's attacks with your shield to complete their objective.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: training from Andragil.
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player asked Andragil to train the player in blocking.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"You want training, from me? Well, perhaps I can accommodate you. If you're worth the time and effort, that is. I think a little test is in order.
Thinking you know how to use a shield is one thing. Actually using one is quite another. So here's what we're going to do. We're going to find out whether or not you can hold up in combat. You put up your shield, and I hit you. If you're still standing when I'm done, you've earned the right to learn what I have to teach.
Shall we find out what you really know? Now, put up your guard, and let's begin. I'm losing interest in this."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called S'Drassa. S'Drassa is an evoker and alchemist, and a member of the Mages Guild.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to find as many Garridan's Tears for S'Drassa as possible.
The player should first talk to Julienne Fanis to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Arcane University, an university for mages in the Imperial City.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: a fair bounty in gold for each Garridan's Tear.
The following characters are related to this quest: Julienne Fanis (the female head of the Alchemy Headquarters, located at Arcane University), Garridan Stalrous (a male knight of old).
The following items are related to this quest: Garridan's Tears (magical crystals called Tears, frozen tears of Garridan Stalrous).
The following groups are related to this quest: Mages Guild (a guild of mages).
The following locations are related to this quest: Imperial City (a city).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Julienne Fanis can tell the player more about Garridan's Tears.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"S'Drassa of the Mages Guild. Evoker and Alchemist. Could you assist me in acquiring something for my crystal collection?
I'm searching for some specific crystals known as Garridan's Tears. I want you to bring me as many of Garridan's Tears as you can find. If you do, I will pay you a fair bounty in gold for each one. I confess I have a weakness for crystals of a magical nature, and I must add these to my collection. This is a personal errand, you must understand. Just between you and I. The Mages Guild has nothing to do with it.
The Tears are not just a namesake. They're literally the frozen tears of a knight named Garridan Stalrous who lived many years ago. I'm not certain what happened to the knight, or why the tears were frozen, but I do know someone you could ask. Seek out Julienne Fanis at the Arcane University in the Imperial City. She oversees the Alchemy Headquarters there. If anyone can help you get more information on about these crystals, she can."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Syl. Syl is the Duchess of Dementia, an incredibly paranoid woman.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to find the people who conspire against Syl.
The player should first talk to Herdir for help to complete their objective.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: if the player does not find conspirators, they will be held responsible.
The following characters are related to this quest: Madgod (Syl's ruler), Herdir (a man).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player was sent by the Madgod. The player will be Syl's Grand Inquisitor.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Why do you approach Syl, the Duchess of Dementia? Do you seek death?
You're the one the Madgod sent, aren't you? Then you're safe for now. Speak to no one unless I instruct you to. None of them can be trusted. Do you hear me? None! Surrounded by traitors and spies, I am. Always, always. They watch and wait, eager to slip a knife into my spine when I'm not looking.
Could be all of them. Every last one. None can be trusted. But they'll never take me down. Never! I'll see them all rotting in shallow graves before I let my guard down! You... you will help me. Yes, yes. You will be most useful.
You're going to find out who knows. You're going to learn who keeps secrets, who conspires against me. You will be my Grand Inquisitor. Expose the conspirators, and they will be punished, I assure you. Find out who keeps secrets, and what they are. Speak with Herdir. He will help you. Do you understand what is required of you? If no one is found, you will be held responsible."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Janus Hassildor. Janus Hassildor is Count of Skingrad, who is located at Skingrad.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to report to Janus Hassildor's steward after finding a cure for vampirism.
The player should first find the witch of Glenmoril to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: along the Corbolo, east of the Imperial City and south of Cheydinhal.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: a cure for vampirism, Janus Hassildor will reward the player in whatever small way he can.
The following characters are related to this quest: Rona (Janus Hassildor's wife, located at Skingrad), the witch of Glenmoril, the last remaining Glenmoril witch in Cyrodiil, a woman, located at along the Corbolo river.
The following groups are related to this quest: Glenmoril (a coven of witches).
The following locations are related to this quest: Corbolo (a river in Cyrodiil), Cheydinhal (a city in Cyrodiil), Cyrodiil (a province), Skingrad (a city in Cyrodiil), Imperial City (the capital city of Cyrodiil).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player has not met Janus Hassildor before: the player and Janus Hassildor are both looking for a cure for vampirism. Over 50 years ago Rona and Janus Hassildor were turned into vampires: Janus Hassildor embraced the vampirism, Rona did not. Rona slipped into coma from refusing to feed herself: Janus Hassildor wants to cure Rona's vampirism. Janus Hassildor cannot risk drawing too much attention on himself by searching for a cure to vampirism by himself: he found out that witches of Glenmoril have made a cure for vampirism before.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I'm sorry. We've not met. I'm Janus Hassildor, Count of Skingrad. I understand you're looking for a cure for vampirism. This is fortunate, as I also seek the cure.
I wish to tell you a story so that you might understand why I would trust you with my secrets. More than 50 years ago, my wife Rona and I were both turned into vampires. While I came to embrace the changes in myself, she did not. She hated what she had become, and refused to feed to keep herself healthy. She eventually slipped into a coma from which she has not awoken. My trusted servants have cared for her all this time, but I wish for her to at last find peace. The cure is for her. I have researched what I can, but acquiring the cure is beyond my grasp. I cannot risk drawing too much attention to myself. So I would ask that you took up the search on my behalf. If you are successful, I will reward you in whatever small way I can. Will you aid me?
What little I have discovered points to the witches of Glenmoril. In the past, they have been capable of creating a cure. I have searched for these witches throughout Cyrodiil, but no covens still exist within its borders. There may be one left. I have unconfirmed reports of a woman seen near the Corbolo river, who fits the description of these witches. Seek her out, and learn whether she can help. She lives somewhere along the river, east of the Imperial City and south of Cheydinhal. If you are successful in finding a cure, report to my steward. You have my thanks."
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Graman gro-Marad. Graman gro-Marad is the Bloated Float's bouncer and helmsman, who is located at Bloated Float.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to clear a safe path to the top deck for Graman gro-Marad.
The player should first kill the Blackwater Brigands to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Bloated Float, a ship turned into an inn.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: Graman gro-Marad will steer the Bloated Float home.
The following characters are related to this quest: Ormil (the man who owns the Bloated Float, located at Bloated Float).
The following groups are related to this quest: Blackwater Brigands (a gang of well-armed thieves).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player freed Graman gro-Marad from a storage room. Not long ago, the Blackwater Brigands stormed the Bloated Float: the Blackwater Brigands took Graman gro-Marad and Ormil hostage and and put the Bloated Float to the sea.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"About time someone showed up. Thank you for freeing me. I'm Graman gro-Marad, the Bloated Float's bouncer and helmsman.
I've been locked in that storage room for hours. I don't know exactly what's going on, but not long ago, a gang of thieves calling themselves The Blackwater Brigands stormed the ship. They took myself and Ormil, the Bloated Float's owner, hostage and put the ship to sea. I have no idea what they're after. If you can get me safely to the top deck, I can steer the Float home. But I'm not budging until the coast is clear. I'm used to dealing with drunken louts, not a gang of well-armed thieves.
Good luck... you'll need it."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Arch-Mage Traven. Arch-Mage Traven is the player's guildmaster in the Mages Guild.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to retrieve a unique Black Soul Gem from the necromancers, and return immediately to Arch-Mage Traven.
The player should first oversee a contingent of Battlemages in their fight with the necromancers to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Silorn, ruins in the south of Cyrodiil.
The following characters are related to this quest: King of Worms (the male master of the necromancers).
The following groups are related to this quest: Mages Guild (a guild of mages).
The following locations are related to this quest: Cyrodiil (a province).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Necromancers have been creating black soul gems for the King of Worms. Arch-Mage Traven believes that the Black Soul Gem may be instrumental in saving the Mages Guild.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Time is against us, and our enemies grow stronger. There is much to do, and little time in which to do it. Your next task is essential.
Word has been sent that the Necromancers have been quite busy, creating black soul gems for their master. In particular, a unique Black Soul Gem has been crafted in the south of Cyrodiil, in the ruins of Silorn.
This gem needs to be confiscated and brought here, before it can be delivered to the King of Worms and used against us. I have need of it. I believe the Black Soul Gem  may be instrumental in saving our guild. I will explain once you have returned with it. Until then, discussion is useless.
A contingent of Battlemages has been sent to the site. I would like you to oversee their actions on my behalf. The only thing that matters is that gem. Do you understand? Once you have it safely in your possession, return here immediately.
Know that you have my complete confidence. I would not entrust this job to you if I did not feel you were prepared for it. Now, go."

The player should first seek Agata to complete their objective.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: recommendation from Dagail.
The following characters are related to this quest: Agata (a young woman, whose heart is old and wise).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Dagail hears voices without her amulet.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"You seek wisdom from me, child? Ah, no. You seek words of recommendation. Words are... difficult. They come and go. The voices, though. So loud they are, they drown out the words. Without my amulet, my stone to lock the voices away, the words will never come and stay. Would you lift your hands to help another, to help me find the words?
Seek Agata, child. She will see the path, and set you on it. She may be young, but her heart is old and wise. It guides her well through these troubled times.
I must rest."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Helvius Cecia. Helvius Cecia is a martial artist.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to prove Helvius Cecia that you deserve his training.
The player should first have a sparring match with Helvius Cecia to complete their objective.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: Hand to Hand training from Helvius Cecia.
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player asked Helvius Cecia to give them Hand to Hand training. Helvius Cecia will not throw a single punch during the sparring match. The rules of the sparring match: 1) the player must not reach for a weapon, 2) Helvius Cecia will tell the player to stop if they hurt him or if the match goes on for too long.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Hand to Hand training, eh? The real question is, can you fight?
You know, throw a good punch? Can you? I'd like to find out if I'm going to spend time working with you. So are you up for a sparring match?
I'll make it easy on you. I won't throw a single punch. I just want to see what you've got, anyway. So, is it a deal?
If I see you reach for a weapon, I'm calling it off. And if you can actually hurt me, I'll tell you to stop. If this goes on for too long, and I get bored, I'll stop you.
Now show me what you've got!"

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Arquen. Arquen is Speaker for the Black Hand, who is located at Applewatch.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to perform an ancient ritual to wake the Night Mother from her slumber, and seek her guidance.
The player should first 1) ask about the Night Mother from Arquen between 12.00 PM and 3:00 AM, 2) go to the Night Mother's home with Arquen to complete their objective. These tasks can be completed in the following locations: 1) Applewatch(a farm), 2) Bravil(a city).
The following characters are related to this quest: Lucien Lachance (a male Speaker of the Black Hand, who betrayed the Dark Brotherhood for some reason, located at Applewatch), Night Mother (an immortal female spirit who is revered and worshiped by the Dark Brotherhood, located at Bravil).
The following groups are related to this quest: Dark Brotherhood (a guild of assassins), Black Hand (the governing body of the Dark Brotherhood).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player is a Silencer of the Dark Brotherhood. As the player can see, the Black Hand have dealt with Lucien Lachance. Lucien Lachance tricked the player to kill the Black Hand off: the player killed the Listener and the Listener's successor. Arquen promotes the player to Speaker from Silencer: the player becomes a member of the Black Hand. There are only five members of the Black Hand, including the player.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Silencer! At last you've arrived! Fear not, for the crisis that has threatened the Dark Brotherhood has finally come to an end. I am Arquen, Speaker for the Black Hand.
As you can see, we have dealt with the betrayer, Lucien Lachance! No longer will you serve as his puppet! It seems Lachance wanted revenge against the Dark Brotherhood for some reason, and used you to do his dirty work. But now, we can begin anew!
I bestow upon you the title of Speaker. You will take Lucien Lachance's place on the Black Hand! Welcome! As you know, the Black Hand is now in a state of disarray. Lachance ordered you to kill us off! We five, including you, are now all that remain. Even worse, you killed the Listener! The Black Hand without a Listener is like a hand with no thumb. Even the Listener's successor is dead!
So, we have no choice but to invoke an ancient ritual. We must wake the Night Mother from her slumber, and seek her guidance! Between the hours of midnight and 3:00 AM, ask me about the Night Mother, and we will away to our Lady's home in Bravil. Only then will the ritual begin.
May the Night Mother hold you in her cold embrace."
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Vicente Valtieri. Vicente Valtieri is the player's superior in the Dark Brotherhood.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to assassinate Baenlin by staging an accident.
The player should first enter Baenlin's house secretly and avoid Gromm to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Bruma, a city.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: a bonus if the player kills Baenlin in the manner specified without killing Gromm.
The following characters are related to this quest: Baenlin (a male Wood Elf, located at Baenlin's house), Gromm (Baenlin's manservant, located at Baenlin's house).
The following groups are related to this quest: Dark Brotherhood (a guild of assassins).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. On the second floor of Baenlin's house is a secreted door leading to a crawlspace containing the fastenings of a mounted head that hangs over Baenlin's favorite chair: if the player loosens the fastenings any night between 8:00 pm and 11:00 pm, the head will fall on Baenlin.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"We need you to stage an... accident. Kill the target in the manner specified, and you'll receive a considerable bonus. The target is a Wood Elf named Baenlin. You will find him at his home in Bruma.
Enter secretly and avoid his manservant, Gromm. On the second floor is a secreted door leading to a crawlspace. Inside are the fastenings of a mounted head that hangs over Baenlin's favorite chair. Loosen the fastenings any night between 8:00 pm and 11:00 pm, and the head will surely fall on Baenlin as he relaxes in his chair, as is custom. If Baenlin is killed in any other manner, or if the manservant Gromm is killed, you will forfeit the bonus.
Now go, and may Death be with you."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Jensine. Jensine is a merchant, and the chairperson for the Society of Concerned Merchants, who is located at Market District.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to find proof about Thoronir's wrongdoing.
The player should first investigate Thoronir's store to find out where he gets his inventory to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Market District, an area filled with stores.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: a fair bounty in gold.
The following characters are related to this quest: Thoronir (a male merchant, located at Market District).
The following groups are related to this quest: Society of Concerned Merchants (an organization of merchants that keeps a nice fair economic balance in town).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Trouble began when Thoronir opened his store selling all kinds of merchandise undercutting the competition: Thoronir refuses to join the Society of Concerned Merchants or discuss the matter.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I think you may be just the kind of person we're looking for. Perhaps you can assist us with a problem we're having here in the Market District.
I'm the chairperson for the Society of Concerned Merchants. We formed this group a while back to keep a nice fair economic balance in town. Not every store is a member, but we're slowly trying to convince them to join. Everything was fine until Thoronir opened his shop nearby.
Selling all sorts of merchandise, Thoronir undercuts prices like you wouldn't believe. He doesn't always sell what we sell, but it is still a problem. People who buy tend to want to spend their money there. That leaves none for us. It's getting so bad, a few of us may have to close up shop. He outright refuses to join the Society or even discuss the matter. We are convinced he is up to no good.
What we need is for you to case his establishment, and figure out where he gets his inventory. Find some proof of his wrongdoing, and let us know. We cannot do it ourselves, as he recognizes all of us. The job pays a fair bounty in gold when he is brought to justice."
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Daravyn the Gray. Daravyn the Gray is a thief hiding from the guards, giving quest via "Long Forgotten Note".
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to find Daravyn the Gray's hidden treasure.
The player should first solve the riddle that takes you to the treasure to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Rosethorn Hall, a manor house.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: Daravyn the Gray's treasure (a treasure).
The following characters are related to this quest: Delgariun (a man who betrayed Daravyn the Gray).
The following items are related to this quest: "Long Forgotten Note" (a note), riddle, "Two bodies have I, though both joined in one. The more I stand still, the quicker I run.".
The following locations are related to this quest: Imperial City (a city).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. "Long Forgotten Note" is addressed to Daravyn the Gray's fiancée. Daravyn the Gray escaped from the prison in the Imperial City.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Long Forgotten Note
by Daravyn the Gray

My love,
I write this with trembling hands. The guards are after me, and I have nowhere else to turn. Soon they will be at the doors to Rosethorn Hall, and nothing will keep them from taking me away back to that horrible prison. I don't know how they found me; perhaps it was that traitor, Delgariun. Whoever told them I was hiding in your home must have known both of us very well. I know Delgariun has eyes for you, I know he's the one that framed me in the first place and had me sent to that dank hole in the Imperial City. He has to be the one. Beware of him, my love. He's treacherous and only wants you to get to the treasure. I didn't give it up to the guards, and I won't give it up to Delgariun. I've hidden the treasure within the walls of Rosethorn Hall. Remember the toy we played with as we ran through this place as children?
Remember the riddle we had for it? It was our secret code: "Two bodies have I, though both joined in one. The more I stand still, the quicker I run."
The key to the treasure lies with the answer. Take care of it, my love. It is your ticket far from Delgariun. Do not fret, I've escaped once, I shall do so again. Soon we will be together, and the sun will shine upon us.
Daravyn the Gray"

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Sheogorath. Sheogorath is the prince of madness, one of the Daedric Princes, who is located at Sheogorath's realm.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to meet the Duke of Mania and the Duchess of Dementia, and join their courts.
The player should first seek out the Duke of Mania and the Duchess of Dementia to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Sheogorath's Palace, a palace in New Sheoth.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: you'll make some friends along the way.
The following characters are related to this quest: Haskill (Sheogorath's Chamberlain who knows a lot), Duke of Mania (a male noble serving Sheogorath, located at Sheogorath's Palace), Duchess of Dementia (a female noble serving Sheogorath, located at Sheogorath's Palace).
The following groups are related to this quest: Daedric Princes (immortal, fickle, infamous divine beings).
The following locations are related to this quest: New Sheoth (the capital city of Sheogorath's realm).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Sheogorath gives the player summon Haskill spell for their previous services. The Duke of Mania and the Duchess of Dementia show the player what New Sheoth truly is. Once the player understands what Sheogorath's Realm is, the player might understand why it's important to keep it intact.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I'm Sheogorath, Prince of Madness. And other things. I'm not talking about them. As you should know by now.
You've run a maze like a good little rat, but no cheese for you yet. Well, maybe a little. I've granted you a new spell - the ability to summon Haskill, my Chamberlain, to aid you in your travels. He knows a lot. More than he knows.
Now we're going to give you a taste of where you have found yourself. You're going to learn. Two halves, two rulers, two places within my palace. Meet and greet. Do what they will, so you know what they're about.
The Duke of Mania and the Duchess of Dementia. Seek them out, and let them show you what New Sheoth is. You might be surprised. Once you understand what My Realm is, you might understand why it's important to keep it intact. And maybe you'll make some friends along the way. That's always nice!"

Brithaur is a thief, but what irks me the most is that he's a BAD thief. Between my shop and a few others in Crucible, he's been caught stealing maybe a dozen times last month. Who has time for this sort of thing? I mean, at this rate, I'll grow old and die before he's out of our hair! I'll tell you what I tell anyone else who asks.
Get rid of him for me and I'll make it worth your while. Do hurry... time's wasting!"

My followers seek to perform a divination. For this, they need souls, one of each of the ten sentient races of Tamriel. You will provide these souls. I give you a spell to trap these souls. Return to me when you have finished. When you do, I will further your journey on your true path.
Do your service onto me and I give you this, the Oghma Infinium. Knowledge given by me to Xarxes is recorded within."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Horkvir Bear-Arm. Horkvir Bear-Arm is a demented, lazy man, who is located at Split.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to resolve the issue with duplicate citizens.
The player should first kill the manic citizens of Split to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Split, a village.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: Horkvir Bear-Arm would make it worth the player's while.
The following locations are related to this quest: Hill of Suicides (a nasty place where people who have committed suicide end up).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. A wizard split all citizens of Split into two people: one Demented and other Manic. Horkvir Bear-Arm cannot resolve the issue himself: there is a law about that and the Hill of Suicides is not a nice place.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Talking wears me, Horkvir Bear-Arm, out.
My double is always working. It takes all my energy just watching him work. It's got to stop. It's a problem, all these doubles walking around. And it's tiresome. Didn't used to be like this.
Some blasted mage. Had a theory. They've always got theories. He thought there was a Manic and a Demented in each of us. So, what does he do? What else? Casts a spell. You can see how well that went. Two of each of us walking around this place. Nothing we can do about it, either. There's a law about that here. Been to the Hill of Suicides? Not a nice place. But you might be able to help.
Only one group can stick around. Either we Demented or those blasted Manics. It's the only way we'll find any peace. You get rid of those Manics. All of them. If you can take care of that for me, I'd make it worth your while.."

The following characters are related to this quest: Captain Burd (the male captain of the Bruma guard).

"Good work. Captain Burd and his guardsmen should be able to handle any additional Gates, at least for now. But the Bruma Guard cannot defend the city indefinitely. The Daedra of Oblivion are innumerable; the guardsmen of Bruma are not.
We need to gather what allies we can before Bruma is hopelessly besieged. If the Mythic Dawn manages to open a Great Gate here, the city will need a stronger garrison for there to be any hope of defending it.
You should speak to the rulers of the other cities of Cyrodiil, as well as the Elder Council. Ask them to send aid to Bruma before it is too late."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Pyke. Pyke is a polite former Knight of the Thorn from Cyrodiil, who is located at Pyke's home in Shivering Isles.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to bring Pyke's gold medallion back to him.
The player should first retrieve Pyke's gold medallion from Grummites to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Fetid Grove, a grove.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: Thorn Shield (a shield).
The following characters are related to this quest: Farwil (Pyke's old friend).
The following items are related to this quest: gold medallion (a small, round gold medallion, with an inscription "To Pyke, from Farwil" on the back).
The following groups are related to this quest: Knight of the Thorn, Knights of the Thorn (a knight order), Grummites (thieving creatures).
The following locations are related to this quest: Cyrodiil (a land), Shivering Isles (a strange realm).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Pyke made his way to the Shivering Isles as soon as he heard the gates to the Shivering Isles open. Pyke will mark the Fetid Grove on the player's map.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"It's good to meet you. The name's Pyke, and I welcome you to my humble home. Please, make yourself comfortable.
Since you're here, I was wondering... do you think you could assist me? I'm having a bit of a crisis.
I was a Knight of the Thorn from Cyrodiil. As soon as I heard the gates to the Shivering Isles opened, I knew a threat was lurking inside. I made my way here and began exploring this strange place. As I was passing Fetid Grove, I was waylaid. Some dastardly Grummites stole my most prized possession... my medallion that signified my membership in the Knights. It's a small, round, gold medallion. On the back is the inscription "To Pyke, from Farwil".
Could you bring back my medallion from the Grummites at Fetid Grove? I will mark Fetid Grove on your map. You could have Thorn Shield as a reward. Good luck to you, friend!"

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Countess Narina Carvain. Countess Narina Carvain is a collector of Akaviri relics, who is located at Cyrodiil.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to bring the Draconian Madstone to Countess Narina Carvain.
The player should first find the Draconian Madstone to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: the ruins in Pale Pass.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: an Akaviri artifact.
The following items are related to this quest: Draconian Madstone (an Akaviri artifact, an amulet that protects its wearer from poisons of any type, looks like a snake coiled around and encircling itself: the eyes of the snake are precious gems).
The following groups are related to this quest: Akaviri (an ancient race of people).
The following locations are related to this quest: Cyrodiil (a realm).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player has seen Akaviri relics displayed by Countess Narina Carvain. Countess Narina Carvain gives the player a translation of an Akaviri messenger's translated diary, a rough map and a unique key that may help the player in the ruins in Pale Pass.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Allow me to formally introduce myself. I'm Countess Narina Carvain. I assume you've noticed all of the Akaviri relics I'm displaying.
Well, it's safe to say I'm a collector of sorts. I've invested a great deal of time and money acquiring these bits of ancient history. In fact, I'd be so bold as to proclaim my collection the most complete in all Cyrodiil; perhaps even beyond. Except for one thing.
A particular relic has eluded me for many years. Possessing this piece of Akaviri antiquity would make my collection complete. I'm of course referring to The Draconian Madstone. The stone is a fine bit of Akaviri craftsmanship. Worn like an amulet, this talisman is said to protect the wearer from poisons of any type. The talisman appears as a snake coiled around and encircling itself. The eyes of the snake are supposed to be precious gems or some such. Through my sources, I've learned that the last reported location of the Draconian Madstone was the ruins at Pale Pass.
If you retrieve the Draconian Madstone for me, I'll be happy to compensate you by rewarding you with another Akaviri artifact. Are you in the game?
Let me tell you how you're going to find the talisman. I've come into the possession of a diary written by an Akaviri messenger. I suspect that the text within can lead you to the ruins. Here's a translation of the passages we could still read. It was quite damaged. I've also included a rough map that was drawn in the diary as well. I'm also providing you with a unique key that was supposedly found with the diary. I'm assuming it will prove useful when you arrive at the site."
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.

The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: Ahjazda's Paranoia (a spell that confuses all those around the player).

"So much to gather, so little time. Perhaps you can help? You might help against the coming storm.
It's coming. I, Ahjazda, think I'm the only one who sees it, though. And I'm going to be ready. Oh, yes. I'll be ready. I've been stockpiling supplies. Things I'll need to ride it out... or survive when they come for me.
I've been gathering things for quite a while, but there are still a few I'm missing. Perhaps you'd bring them to me? I still need the Amulet of Disintegration, the Ring of Desiccation, and, of course, the Calming Pants. Must have the Calming Pants. Bring these to me, and I will reward you well. Ahjazda has many, many things.
Let me teach you a special spell, Ahjazda's Paranoia, after you return with the items. It will affect all those around you. You might find it handy to cause confusion in your enemies. You know... when the time comes."

"Hear my final passings of praise and wisdom!
You have stepped from the humble shadows of obscurity and into legend. No feat you have accomplished in your life compares to what you have become. You are an embodiment of Pelinal Whitestrake, the bane of Umaril the Unfeathered.
The time has come for you to fulfill your destiny. Umaril lies hid in the ancient fane of Garlas Malatar. You must go there and destroy him. Umaril's Daedric nature allows his spirit to escape into Oblivion after death. This is what Pelinal learned upon defeating Umaril the first time. You must first kill his living body. While beyond the power of most mortals, this is only the lesser of your two tasks. It will allow you to follow Umaril into the spirit realm upon his death. It will allow you to destroy him, body and soul, utterly and for all time."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Ocheeva. Ocheeva is the player's superior in the Dark Brotherhood.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to assassinate Roderick without been seen by his company of loyal mercenaries.
The player should first replace Roderick's medicine with a poisoned bottle Ocheeva gives you to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Fort Sutch,  a fort far to the west, nestled in the mountains.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: a bonus if Roderick dies of poisoning.
The following characters are related to this quest: Roderick (a male warlord, located at Fort Sutch).
The following groups are related to this quest: Dark Brotherhood (a guild of assassins).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Roderick lies in eternal slumber, kept alive only by the daily administration of a powerful medicine.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Far to the west there lives a fierce warlord and his company of loyal mercenaries. Your target is the warlord. Do you accept this contract?
Now listen closely. Nestled in the mountains to the west lies Fort Sutch. It is the home of the warlord Roderick and his mercenaries. Roderick has recently taken ill. He now lies in eternal slumber, kept alive only by the daily administration of a powerful medicine.
You must infiltrate Fort Sutch, find Roderick's medicine, and replace it with a poisoned bottle I will provide. But you must remain undetected! Whomever arranged this contract wants it to look like Roderick died from his illness, so discretion is essential. Attack no one! Be seen by no one! If you are detected, the poisoning will fail, and Roderick must be killed in some other manner. That will, of course, forfeit your bonus.
Roderick may lie near death, but dead he is not. Until his soul has passed, our client -- and the Grim Reaper himself -- will not be satisfied."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Irene Metrick. Irene Metrick is a killer, and a master of blunt weapons.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to become Irene Metrick's equal in killing.
The player should first kill 50 people to complete their objective.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: blunt weapons training from Irene Metrick.
The player will encounter the following enemies during this quest: 50 people.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I'm Irene Metrick. If you needed to know more, you'd already know.
How many people have you killed in your lifetime, eh? Not as many as I, my little friend. When we're equals, you might interest me and get some blunt weapons training out of it.
If you've killed fifty people, it's still not enough for my tastes, but I might reconsider training you at that point.
Leave some bloody trails and tell yourself they all deserved it. Right? Ha, ha."
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Corrick Northwode. Corrick Northwode is a vengeful widower, who is located at Harm's Folly.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to find Kayleen's jade amulet that was stolen by goblins, and bring it back to Corrick Northwode.
The player should first avenge Kayleen by killing the goblins that killed her to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Exhausted Mine, a goblin den.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: 6 gems.
The following characters are related to this quest: Kayleen (Corrick Northwode's dead wife).
The following locations are related to this quest: Harm's Folly (Corrick Northwode's home village).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Goblins killed Kayleen while Corrick Northwode was away on business.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Please... I implore you, help me, Corrick Northwode, avenge my wife's death!
Barely a week ago, I left Harm's Folly to go buy supplies as I usually do once a month. What a fool I was to leave my wife alone. The goblins must have been watching me, as they knew right when to strike. I could hear her screams from far away. Those wretched beasts killed her! Filthy animals! Had I only been there to stop them!
I'll tell you how you can help. Go to Exhausted Mine. Kill those goblins. Every last one of them! They destroyed everything I hold dear! In their greed, the creatures grabbed a jade amulet off of Kayleen's... body. Bring me back that amulet, so I may use it to remember her by.
Please, I'll give you six gems as a token of my gratitude. They're all I have left of value, but you must have them if you do the deed."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Martin. Martin is the player's friend.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to have the Countess meet Martin in the Chapel of Talos for a council of war.
The player should first explain Martin's plan to the Countess to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Bruma, a city.
The following characters are related to this quest: Jauffre (a male military leader), Countess (the noblewoman who rules over Bruma, located at Bruma).
The following items are related to this quest: Great Sigil Stones (rare items, the player needs one of these), Amulet of Kings (an important amulet).
The following groups are related to this quest: Mythic Dawn (an evil cult that wants to destroy everything).
The following locations are related to this quest: Kvatch (a city that was destroyed by Daedra), Chapel of Talos (a large church).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player and Jauffre won't like Martin's plan to obtain a Great Sigil Stone. Great Sigil Stones are the anchors of Great Gates: the Mythic Dawn opened a Great Gate at Kvatch, and they want to open another one here to destroy Bruma. Martin was at Kvatch and saw the terrible power of the Daedric siege engine. The only way to recover the Amulet of Kings is to allow the Mythic Dawn to proceed with their plan to attack Bruma.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"We need a Great Sigil Stone. You're not going to like it. Jauffre doesn't like it. The Countess of Bruma certainly isn't going to like it. Great Sigil Stones are the anchors of Great Gates. The kind of gate the Mythic Dawn opened at Kvatch. The kind of Gate the Mythic Dawn wants to open here to destroy Bruma.
The risk is great, I know. I was at Kvatch. I saw the terrible power of the Daedric siege engine. But we have no choice. The only way to recover the Amulet of Kings is to allow the Mythic Dawn to proceed with their plan to attack Bruma.
Please, my friend. I explain myself to you so you understand me. And so you can explain to the Countess. I'm afraid she may take a bit more convincing than you.
Have the Countess of Bruma meet me in the Chapel of Talos for a council of war. That seems a fitting place to make such desperate plans."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Armand Christophe. Armand Christophe is the player's superior in the Thieves Guild, who is located at Waterfront District.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to steal back the taxes of the poor Waterfront citizens.
The player should first find out where Hieronymus Lex is keeping the taxes and tax records to complete their objective.
The following characters are related to this quest: Gray Fox (a legendary thief), Hieronymus Lex (male captain of the city watch).
The following groups are related to this quest: Thieves Guild (a guild of thieves lead by the Gray Fox).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player is the newest member of the Thieves Guild. Hieronymus Lex collected taxes from the Waterfront: the city usually doesn't bother collecting taxes from the Waterfront District, because it costs more money than its worth. The Gray Fox has always protected the poor of the Waterfront.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Ah! Our newest member. I'm glad you stopped by. I have a... situation that you might be able to help with.
The Gray Fox has asked me to take care of a problem, and I'm putting you on it. Hieronymus Lex actually collected taxes from everyone living here on the Waterfront! Your job is to recover those taxes.
The people of the waterfront are very poor. Traditionally the city has not collected taxes from them, even though by law they could. The money the city would collect would barely cover the cost of collecting. The Gray Fox has always guaranteed protection to the poor of the waterfront. He doesn't want to let this injustice stand. It's a matter of principle.
Find out where Hieronymus Lex is keeping the taxes and bring them to me. I'll also need the tax records of what each citizen paid so we can return it."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Arch-Mage Traven. Arch-Mage Traven is the player's guild leader in the Mages Guild, who is located at Cyrodiil.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to locate Mucianus Allias, and return him safely to the Arcane University.
The player should first find Mucianus Allias before the battlemages of the Mages Guild apprehend him to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Nenyond Twyll, a Necromancer lair in ancient ruins, south of the Imperial City, south of the White Rose River, nearly halfway to the border of Elsweyr.
The following characters are related to this quest: Mucianus Allias (a male mage who infiltrated the Necromancers, located at Nenyond Twyll), Raminus (a male mage, the player's superior in the Mages Guild).
The following groups are related to this quest: Mages Guild (a guild of mages), Council of Mages (the ruling body of Mages Guild).
The following locations are related to this quest: Imperial City (a major city), White Rose River (a river), Elsweyr (a province), Cyrodiil (a province).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player is meeting Arch-Mage Traven face-to-face for the first time. Raminus has told Arch-Mage Traven good things about the player: the player has advanced quickly, and shows great promise. The Council of Mages has been aware of the increased Necromancer activity in Cyrodiil for some time: Mucianus Allias was sent to infiltrate the ranks of the necromancers, but he stopped sending reports to the Council of Mages. The Council of Mages distrusts Mucianus Allias, unlike Arch-Mage Traven.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Greetings. It is high time that we met face to face, don't you think? Raminus has told me good things about you. You have advanced quickly, and show great promise. I now intend to put your talents to a more direct test.
I have a difficult task that you can, perhaps, assist with. Let me explain what is at stake. The Council of Mages has been aware of the increased Necromancer activity in Cyrodiil for some time. It had been our position to sit back and watch what unfolded, but that time has clearly passed. We cannot tolerate these attacks on the guild. Most of our information on Necromancers has come from an informant inside the cult itself, a guild member who offered to infiltrate their ranks.
Though the information he has provided is limited, it has given us a sense of their scope and power. The Council was initially reluctant to believe the information was reliable, but with recent events, they have little choice but to trust it. I fear that our informant is in danger, and that is why I have called you here.
The informant is a mage called Mucianus Allias. He is not a Council member, but has long served the guild here at the Arcane University. Aware in the growing interest in the guild after the band of Necromancy was put into place, he offered to help the Council track the cult's actions. With my blessing, he infiltrated the group, and has fed us information for quite some time, until recently. I have not heard from him, and I fear for his safety.
The lack of reports from Mucianus has disturbed the Council, and they are now concerned about the legitimacy of his information. A group of Battlemages were dispatched to Mucianus's last know location, with the intent on bringing him in for questioning. I argued against it, but eventually agreed to maintain order in the Council. I regret that decision, and that is why I wish to send you there. I fear the Battlemages may mistreat Mucianus, if they do not mistake him for one of the many Necromancers no doubt present in the ruins.
I wish for you to find Mucianus, and ensure his safe return to the Arcane University. I do not want anything to go wrong. Please, hurry. The Battlemages will arrive there soon, if they have not already, and time is of the essence. If for any reason they are unsuccessful, Mucianus' life will be forfeit. You must make sure he is safe. Go now, and bring word to me as soon as he has been escorted to safety. Mucianus last reported being sent to the ruins of Nenyond Twyll, south of the Imperial City. That is where the Battlemages went. South of the White Rose River, nearly halfway to the border of Elsweyr. I'm afraid I know nothing more about the location, or what you may expect to find once you arrive."
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Armand Christophe. Armand Christophe is a member of the Thieves Guild, and the Doyen of the Gray Fox.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to win the contest against Methredhel and Amusei.
The player should first steal Amantius Allectus's diary without killing him, Methredhel, or Amusei to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Imperial City, a large city.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: the player gets to join the Thieves Guild.
The following characters are related to this quest: Methredhel (a female thief), Amusei (a male thief), Amantius Allectus (a man, located at Imperial City), Gray Fox (the legendary guildleader of the Thieves Guild).
The following groups are related to this quest: Thieves Guild (a guild of thieves, thought to be a myth).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Armand Christophe is addressing the player, Methredhel, and Amusei. Members of the Thieves Guild are followers of the Gray Fox: the one who wins the contest is allowed to join the Thieves Guild. The beggars will help the player locate Amantius Allectus's diary, for a price. Armand Christophe can sell the player lockpicks.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Everyone is here, let's begin.
Each of you is seeking membership in the Thieves Guild. The Thieves Guild is not a myth. We are followers of the Gray Fox, and I am his Doyen.
Merely by finding me, you have passed the first test. It's unusual for us to have three potential recruits at the same time. Rather than the normal test of skill, I'm going to make this a contest. Methredhel, you know the rules. However, for Amusei and the newcomer, let me state them clearly.
Whoever brings me the diary of Amantius Allectus, without killing him, will be invited into the guild. It's somewhere in the Imperial City. The beggars will help you locate it, for a price. I can sell you lockpicks if you need them.
One more thing. You cannot kill each other during this trial. We may be thieves, but we're not murderers."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Haskill. Haskill is a servant of Sheogorath, who is located at Shivering Isles.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to remake the Staff of Sheogorath and fill the throne of Madness after Sheogorath's passing.
The player should first find the being who can help you to remake the Staff of Sheogorath to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Knifepoint Hollow, once a great library.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: Staff of Sheogorath (a staff, and the symbol of power in this Realm).
The following characters are related to this quest: Sheogorath (the prince of madness, one of the Daedric Princes), Jyggalag (the prince of order, one of the Daedric Princes).
The following groups are related to this quest: Daedric Princes (immortal, fickle, infamous divine beings).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Sheogorath is gone: Jyggalag will win, if the throne of Madness remains empty. The Staff of Sheogorath faded with Sheogorath. Haskill gives the player a crystal that opens the sealed door at Knifepoint Hollow: the library is a thing of Order, and it will still serve that end.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Sheogorath is gone, but hope is not lost. We have a rare opportunity here, but I hesitate to do what must be done. If the Throne of Madness remains empty when Jyggalag storms the palace, he will prevail. But there is a chance that the throne may not be empty. The only way to protect the Realm from Jyggalag is to place you in the Throne of Madness.
Unfortunately, when Sheogorath faded, the power of the Staff of Sheogorath faded with him. It must now be remade. The Staff is the symbol of power in this Realm. He who rightfully holds the Staff may hold the throne of the Shivering Isles. However, the secrets of its construction are lost.
That which is lost can be found again. There is one being in the Shivering Isles who may be able to assist you in the construction of a new Staff. The ruins of Knifepoint Hollow once served as a great library. There, you will find a door. Behind that door, you will find the answer you seek.
Take this crystal. It contains the power to open the sealed door. Inside, you will find the final remnants of the library. Be mindful of what you find there. The library is a thing of Order, and it will still serve that end."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Hirrus Clutumnus. Hirrus Clutumnus is a man who desperately wants to die, who is located at New Sheoth.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to help Hirrus Clutumnus end his life.
The player should first kill Hirrus Clutumnus when he is unaware to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: New Sheoth, a city.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: the key to Hirrus Clutumnus' house, the contents of the jewelry box inside Hirrus Clutumnus' house.
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Hirrus Clutumnus is  going to go about his daily life.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Won't someone end me? Take my life, please!
I, Hirrus Clutumnus, am in desperate need of a champion, a hero. Are you brave and fearless? There's a... a simple task. Yes, a simple task that you must perform.
This life, it's... well, it's too painful. Everywhere I look, I see death, dying, and decay. When I dream, I see a world without sunshine. I'm constantly on the verge of retching up, or falling asleep, or screaming at someone who doesn't deserve it. I'm just so fed up with it all.
I need your help. I need you to send my soul away from this world! You must... you must kill me. I don't necessarily want to see it coming. And I want to die here in the city so all these people finally believe me. They'll wish they were nicer. You probably want to do it without spectators though, so you don't get in trouble. Best to make it look like an accident. But remember, I don't want to see it coming. Take me unaware!
I'm going to go about my daily life, such as it is, as if nothing has changed. Make your move when you wish. But, please, do it soon. When you kill me, take the key to my house. Nothing really worth taking, except what's locked up in the jewelry box. You can have that."
<|endoftext|>

The quest-giver is called Ganredhel. Ganredhel is an advanced acrobatics trainer, who trains dogs and prefers them to people.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to seek acrobatics training from Aerin.
The player should first find Aerin to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Aerin's Camp, a camp located in the mountains in the north of Cyrodiil.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: acrobatics training from Aerin.
The following characters are related to this quest: Aerin (a female master acrobat, located at Aerin's Camp).
The following locations are related to this quest: Cyrodiil (a province).
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Ganredhel. I train dogs. And people.
Prefer dogs. People, I teach them advanced acrobatics. Up and jump. Dogs, I teach them to bite people.
If you require further training, you might consider venturing into the mountains in the north of Cyrodiil. Aerin's Camp, specifically.
Aerin's a very gifted acrobat, and could teach you anything you needed to know."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Ocheeva. Ocheeva is the player's superior at the Dark Brotherhood.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to assassinate Adamus Phillida when he is out of his Legion armor with or without the Rose of Sithis.
The player should first find Adamus Phillida to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Leyawiin, a city.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: a bonus if the player deposits Adamus Phillida's finger bearing an Imperial Legion signet ring in the desk of Adamus Phillida's successor, in his office in the Prison Barracks, in the Imperial City.
The following characters are related to this quest: Adamus Phillida (a recently retired Imperial Legion officer who spent his entire career investigating the Dark Brotherhood, and a powerful man, located at Leyawiin, in the City Watch barracks).
The following items are related to this quest: Rose of Sithis (a magic arrow specifically enchanted to kill its target, cannot pierce armor).
The following groups are related to this quest: Dark Brotherhood (a guild of assassins), Black Hand (the governing body of the Dark Brotherhood).
The following locations are related to this quest: Imperial City (a large city).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The Black Hand has sanctioned the Rose of Sithis against Adamus Phillida.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I have another assassination contract for you.
Do you recall the name Adamus Phillida? The Imperial Legion pest? It's time he joined Death in the Void. Think you're up to the task?
Adamus Phillida has spent his entire career investigating the Dark Brotherhood, interrupting our contracts, killing our family members! We tried to eliminate Phillida, of course, but failed on three separate occasions. He's a powerful man, and was surrounded by powerful associates. Now the Legion's pig's years of service have come to an end. He has retired. Phillida must not be allowed such a victory! His destiny is... darker. Phillida now resides in Leyawiin, in the City Watch barracks, an honored guest of the soldiers there. He is, in fact, more vulnerable than ever.
The Black Hand has sanctioned the Rose of Sithis. It is a magic arrow specifically enchanted to kill its target. In this case, Phillida. As long as the arrow hits Phillida, he will die. But it cannot pierce armor! Shoot while Phillida is armored, and the Rose will be wasted. Travel to Leyawiin. Track Phillida. Learn his schedule. Observe when he removes that blasted Legion armor! And then, let fly the Rose of Sithis! Kill Phillida in any way, Rose or not, and the contract is complete. But to receive a bonus, you must go beyond murder. You must send a message! Once Phillida is dead, take the very finger from his corpse, the one that bears an Imperial Legion signet ring! Deposit this finger in the desk of Phillida's successor, in his office in the Prison Barracks, in the Imperial City! Do this, and the bonus is yours."
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Teinaava. Teinaava is a fellow member of the Dark Brotherhood, and a Shadowscale.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to bring back Scar-Tail's heart as proof for Teinaava.
The player should first assassinate Scar-Tail to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Bogwater, a swamp far south of here, on the southern end of Cyrodiil.
The following characters are related to this quest: Ocheeva (Teinaava's sister, a fellow member of the Dark Brotherhood, and a Shadowscale), Scar-Tail (an Argonian Shadowscale, Ocheeva and Teinaava's childhood friend, and a royal assassin of Black Marsh who escaped his duties, located at Bogwater).
The following groups are related to this quest: Dark Brotherhood (a guild of assassins), Argonians (a race of people), Shadowscale (Argonians who were born to become assassins).
The following locations are related to this quest: Cyrodiil (a province), Black Marsh (a province inhabited by Argonians).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Teinaava needs help with a personal matter. Just as a member of the Dark Brotherhood cannot kill a fellow family member, a Shadowscale is forbidden from slaying another Shadowscale.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Ah, dear friend, may I steal a moment of your time? I have a rather delicate situation I was hoping you could help me with. This is a personal matter, and will have no bearing on your standing within the Dark Brotherhood. Would you like to hear more?
Now, the details. Far south of here, on the southern end of Cyrodiil, lies a swamp called Bogwater. Hiding in that swamp you will find an Argonian Shadowscale named Scar-Tail. Kill this renegade. and bring me his heart as proof of the deed.
I have some history with Scar-Tail. When Ocheeva and I trained with the Dark Brotherhood as children, we befriended another initiate, a Shadowscale by the name of Scar-Tail. The three of us were inseparable. When our training was completed, we reluctantly parted ways. But now... Now, the unthinkable has happened! Scar-Tail has fled Black Marsh and refuses to fulfill his duties as royal assassin! This is an act of treason! This treachery must be punished! Just as a member of the Dark Brotherhood cannot kill a fellow family member, a Shadowscale is forbidden from slaying another Shadowscale. That is why you must go to Bogwater and eliminate that treacherous snake!
Please kill Scar-Tail, so Ocheeva and I can put this matter behind us."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Vicente Valtieri. Vicente Valtieri is the player's superior in the Dark Brotherhood.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to assassinate Gaston Tussaud.
The player should first board the Marie Elena to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Waterfront District of the Imperial City.
The following characters are related to this quest: Gaston Tussaud (a male pirate captain).
The following groups are related to this quest: Dark Brotherhood (a guild of assassins).
The following locations are related to this quest: Marie Elena (Gaston Tussaud's ship), Imperial City (a large city).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. This is the player's first assignment. The pirates have been moving cargo: the player may be able to smuggle themselves onboard the Marie Elena in one of the packing crates. The player's fellow assassins provide insight about any current contract.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Warmest greetings to you. I am Vicente Valtieri. I'm eager to see how you fare on your first assignment.
Go to the Waterfront District of the Imperial City. There you will find a ship named the Marie Elena. Board the ship and find its captain, Gaston Tussaud. He'll be in his cabin. Eliminate Tussaud in any manner you see fit. As a pirate, Gaston Tussaud has certainly spilled his share of blood. Someone wants revenge, and they've hired us to extract it.
The pirates have been moving a lot of cargo onboard lately. You may be able to smuggle yourself onboard in one of the packing crates. Oh, and one more thing. Get into the habit of asking your fellow assassins about any current contract. Their insight may prove invaluable."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Gilgondorin. Gilgondorin is a keeper of local legends.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to lay the Watchman to rest.
The player should first go see the Watchman at 8 o'clock at night to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Bawnwatch Camp, a camp on the shore of Niben Bay.
The following characters are related to this quest: Watchman (a harmless, sad ghost of a sailor).
The following locations are related to this quest: Niben Bay (a sea bay).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player asked Gilgondorin about the Watchman. Gilgondorin pinpoints where the Watchman appears on the player's map.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"So you want to learn more about the ghostly Watchman?
The Watchman looks like he may have been a sailor. No one knows where he came from, or why he looks so sad. I don't like talking about the dead like they're some kind of tourist attraction, but that spirit has been making his ghostly journey for years now. We've learned to just accept that he's there.
Every night, sure as clockwork, he appears at Bawnwatch Camp at 8 on the shore of Niben Bay. He's never harmed anyone, but most people give him a wide berth. You seem curious enough, so I'll be glad to pinpoint where he appears on your map."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Fathis Ules. Fathis Ules is a man employing thieves.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to recover an item stolen by Albert Jemane from ogres.
The player should first find the item in a troll lair to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Redguard Valley, a well-known ogre den.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: Fathis Ules would pay the player very well for the item.
The following characters are related to this quest: Albert Jemane (the dead father of the Jemane brothers, and a former professional thief employed by Fathis Ules' organization), Reynald (one of the Jemane brothers, located at Weatherleah).
The following groups are related to this quest: Jemanes (a family).
The following locations are related to this quest: Weatherleah (a farmhouse built by Albert Jemane, in the middle of nowhere), Chorrol (a city).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player has recently escorted the two Jemane brothers back to Weatherleah. Albert Jemane was supposed to obtain a valuable item for Fathis Ules, but he kept it for himself. Albert Jemane fled from Chorrol with his family to wilderness, and was never heard from again: only his small son Reynald was found. Albert Jemane kept the item in Weatherleah, but Weatherleah was ransacked by ogres: they took the item.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Fathis Ules. I may have a bit of a proposition for you involving the Jemane family you so recently assisted.
It was kind of you to escort the Jemanes back to Weatherleah. However, their father, the original owner of Weatherleah left them an even greater legacy.
My tale actually begins with the father, Albert Jemane. He was once in my employ, or should I say the employ of my organization. He was very good at obtaining things from people who did not want to part with. A professional thief, to put it bluntly. He was assigned to obtain a very valuable item for me. He succeeded, but decided to keep this item for himself. An unfortunate decision.
Albert Jemane fled from Chorrol with his family, and was never heard from again. Only his small son Reynald was found, wandering alone in the wilderness. Naturally, my associates and I believed he had perished. The wilderness is, after all, a dangerous place. No place to take your family. Then, these many years later, voila! The brother reappears. It seems the rest of the family did not die in the wilderness after all.
What is the point of my tale? Albert Jemane builds Weatherleah way out in the middle of nowhere. He was a thief, not a farmer. The only reason to establish such a place would be to stay out of the Chorrol Guard's sight. I believe that the item Albert stole, which rightly belongs to me, was hidden at Weatherleah. Unfortunately, the notorious Redguard Valley Ogres ransacked the place and probably took all of the loot back with them.
If you were to obtain this item, somehow, and bring it to me, I would pay you very well for it."
