This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Modryn Oreyn. Modryn Oreyn is the player's superior in the Fighters Guild.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to help Modryn Oreyn prove that the Blackwood Company lied about completing a contract for Argoth.
The player should first 1) meet up with Modryn Oreyn, 2) investigate Arpenia with Modryn Oreyn to complete their objective. These tasks can be completed in the following locations: 1) Leyawiin guild hall, 2) Arpenia(Azani Blackheart's stronghold).
The following characters are related to this quest: Azani Blackheart (a ruthless male bandit leader), Argoth (a male wizard), Vitellus Donton (a fellow member of the Fighters Guild, a man), Vilena Donton (the female guildmaster of the Fighters Guild).
The following groups are related to this quest: Fighters Guild (a mercenary guild), Blackwood Company (a shady mercenary organization, who are very good at what they do).
The following locations are related to this quest: Leyawiin (a city).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Modryn Oreyn has been investigating the Blackwood Company: they are a danger to the Fighters Guild. The Fighters Guild was contracted by Argoth to recover an artifact from Azani Blackheart: Modryn Oreyn went in there with twenty good men, and left with five. Vitellus Donton was not one of the survivors: he died while covering the Fighters Guild members' retreat. Argoth is dead and the artifact is gone after the Blackwood Company supposedly finished the contract instead of the Fighters Guild. Vilena Donton is not going to know about this mission: it's the player's choice to accept the mission.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Good. You're here. We've got duties to attend to.
I've been looking into the Blackwood Company. Heard some disturbing things. We know they're a danger to us. And we know they're good at what they do.
I've heard stories, but nothing I can prove is true. Maybe they've got a mage working with them. Maybe they're just well trained. All I know for sure is that they'll accept any contract, and they'll do anything to complete it. And they don't care who gets in the way.
We were contracted by a wizard, Argoth, to recover an artifact from Azani Blackheart, a ruthless bandit leader. I went in there with twenty men. I left with five. Vitellus Donton wasn't one of them. He died covering our retreat. I snooped around. Apparently, the Blackwood Company completed that contract for us. I went in there with twenty good men. I can't believe that bunch finished the job. There's more. Argoth -- he's dead, the artifact gone. Sounds like a set-up. Maybe they made a deal with Blackheart. I don't know. But I'll find out.
Now we find out what really happened. And we let it be known. I want to show the people who the Blackwood Company really are. I can't order you do this with me. It's dangerous, and Vilena Donton isn't going to know about it. It's your choice.
If you accept this mission, we leave as soon as you're ready. I want to investigate Blackheart's stronghold at Arpenia. Meet me at the Leyawiin guild hall. We'll go from there."
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Sir Ralvas. Sir Ralvas is a ghost of a knight.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to retrieve the Mace of Zenithar for yourself.
The player should first complete the challenge of Zenithar to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: a shrine to Saint Kaladas, below the Chapel of Zenithar in Leyawiin.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: Mace of Zenithar (a holy mace).
The following characters are related to this quest: Zenithar (the god of work and commerce, one of the Nine), Saint Kaladas (a long-dead saint).
The following groups are related to this quest: Nine (a pantheon of gods).
The following locations are related to this quest: Leyawiin (a city).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player has passed the gauntlet unlike others in three hundred years: the player can redeem the souls of the ghost knights and restore their order. Sir Ralvas placed his own will and lust for fame over the will of the Nine. Sir Ralvas failed the challenge of Zenithar: the inscription for the challenge says to "walk in the faith". The player must pray at the shrine of Saint Kaladas to receive a vision: the player will see the Mace of Zenithar, separated from them by a great chasm. Sir Ralvas fell from the platform each time he tried to cross the chasm.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"You have my, Sir Ralvas', tribute, sir knight. In three hundred years, none have passed the gauntlet. In three hundred years, we have never known hope. But for the first time, it seems that someone may succeed where we have failed. I see in you the chance to redeem our souls and restore the order. And now, I must ask you to press forward where I could not. I must ask you to face the challenge of Zenithar.
I was arrogant and foolhardy. I sought personal glory. I placed my own will and my own lust for fame over the will of the Nine. In facing the challenge of Zenithar, I failed. I tried dozens -- no, hundreds of times to reach the Mace. I fell each time. And each time I awoke in the chapel, I leaped again. I tried to enlist the help of the other knights, but none would come to my aid. The inscription says to "walk in the faith" but even now, I do not know what this means.
Below the Chapel of Zenithar in Leyawiin there is a shrine to the great craftsman, Saint Kaladas. Those seeking the Mace must pray before the shrine. When you bow, you will receive a vision -- or perhaps not. It is unclear. The priests saw that my body never moved, but it felt so real. You will see the Mace of Zenithar, separated from you by a great chasm. The chasm represents your doubt. Your faith must be your guide across it.
This is what I know. As I said, my faith was weak. I did not understand the test and I fell from the platform each time I tried to cross. I have told you all that I know. All that is left is for you to prove yourself more worthy than I. If you seek the Mace, travel to Leyawiin's chapel, kneel at the shrine in the undercroft, and let your faith in the Nine be the salvation of us all."
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Gray Fox. Gray Fox is a legendary thief, and the player's guildmaster at the Thieves Guild.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to return to the Gray Fox with Savilla's Stone.
The player should first steal Savilla's Stone to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Temple of the Ancestor Moths, an extensive, well-guarded monastery, in the far northeast of Cyrodiil, beyond Cheydinhal.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: if the player succeeds, the Gray Fox will pay the player well.
The following items are related to this quest: Savilla's Stone (a large crystal with special properties).
The following groups are related to this quest: Thieves Guild (a guild of thieves).
The following locations are related to this quest: Cheydinhal (a city in Cyrodiil), Cyrodiil (a region).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Retired, blind Moth priests go to die in the Temple of the Ancestor Moths. The Gray Fox will mark the location of the Temple of the Ancestor Moths on the player's map. The player must not kill innocents: however, there is no bloodprice for slaying the stone's guardians.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I have need of your special gifts. There is an item, hidden away in a remote monastery. I need you to go get it for me.
The monastery is extensive and well guarded, so you should make sure to be well prepared. Should you succeed, I will pay you well for your services.
The monastery is called the Temple of the Ancestor Moths. It is where retired, blind Moth priests go to wait out the rest of their days. I will mark the location on your map. Look for it in the far northeast of Cyrodiil, beyond Cheydinhal.
I need you to acquire Savilla's Stone. It is a large crystal with special properties that I need to gain... advantage. Remember, do not shed innocent blood. However, there is no bloodprice for slaying the stone's guardians, human or inhuman. When I receive word that Savilla's Stone is missing, I will be here waiting for you."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Lucien Lachance. Lucien Lachance is the player's superior in the Dark Brotherhood, giving quest via "Dead Drop Orders #3".
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to assassinate J'Ghasta.
The player should first find J'Ghasta to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: J'Ghasta's house in Bruma.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: the player will find their next dead drop in a rotten box under the Old Bridge, just south of the Imperial City: it will contain the player's reward for killing J'Ghasta and their next assassination contract.
The following characters are related to this quest: J'Ghasta (a Khajiit nobleman, and a skilled hand to hand fighter, located at J'Ghasta's house).
The following items are related to this quest: "Dead Drop Orders #3" (a note).
The following groups are related to this quest: Dark Brotherhood (a guild of assassins).
The following locations are related to this quest: Bruma (a city), Cyrodiil (a realm).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. "Dead Drop Orders #3" has been addressed toward the player: the player is a Silencer of the Dark Brotherhood. J'Ghasta turned down the offer to marry a prominent Cyrodiil noble's daughter: the noble hired the Dark Brotherhood to kill J'Ghasta. J'Ghasta is aware someone may be trying to kill him, and has bribed the guards not to interfere if a fight should spill out into the Bruma streets.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Dead Drop Orders #3
by Lucien Lachance

Are you ready to get your hands dirty, Silencer?
Your next target is a Khajiit nobleman by the name of J'Ghasta, who can be found at his home in the city of Bruma. J'Ghasta was recently offered the hand of a prominent Cyrodiil noble's daughter, but turned down the offer when he learned of the girl's rather negligible dowry. The girl's family is outraged, of course, and has hired the Dark Brotherhood to make J'Ghasta pay for his insolence.
Go to J'Ghasta's house in Bruma and end his miserable life. But be warned! The Khajiit is rich and bored, and spends most of his time honing his skills in unarmed combat. Any opponent who can kill with merely his hands is not to be trifled with, so tread carefully. Even worse, J'Ghasta is aware someone may be trying to kill him, and has bribed the guards not to interfere if a fight should spill out into the city streets.
When the target has been eliminated, you will find your next dead drop in a rotten box under the Old Bridge, just south of the Imperial City. The box will contain your reward for killing J'Ghasta, as well as information regarding your next contract."
<|endoftext|>

The player should first take Viranus Donton on a mission with you to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Donton house, Viranus Donton's home.

"I've got another job for you, slightly off the record. You'll be going on a mission with Viranus Donton. Yes -- the guildmaster's son.
You're to accompany him, and make sure he succeeds. He needs some time in the field, to get his confidence up, or he'll never become a good warrior. Vilena coddles the boy too much. Doesn't want him in the line of fire. Suppose it's no surprise after Vitellus.
Vitellus was Vilena Donton's eldest son. Good man. We lost him on a botched mission recently. You've probably seen the other wounded around. If you're smart, you'll steer clear of the subject around the guildmaster. Perhaps you and I will have time to discuss it more later.
Viranus' mother's been holding him back, protecting him. You'll go to Nonwyll Cavern with him. Galtus Previa was lost there, and you're to find him. And not a word of this to the guildmaster! Go find him. He'll be in the Donton house, most likely. And bring him back in one piece!"

I've been studying the Welkynd Stones. Yes, the aquamarine colored crystals usually native to Ayleid ruins. It seems I'm the first to discover them growing in a natural cave. That's about all I can say about it.
I don't suppose I could convince you to help me recover my research notes? I was doing some research in Bramblepoint Cave, and suddenly I was attacked. I grabbed everything I could and ran, but I fear I dropped my notes. Those notes are very important to me and represent ten years of my life. This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called S'Krivva. S'Krivva is the player's superior in the Thieves Guild, who is located at Bravil.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to get Hieronymus Lex reassigned as the captain of the guard in Anvil.
The player should first 1) steal the list of guard captain candidates from Dairihill's desk, 2) find a forger to make a forgery of the candidate list, 3) sneak into the Legion Commander's office and seal the forged letter with his seal to complete their objective. These tasks can be completed in the following locations: 1) Anvil(a city), 2) Imperial City Prison(a prison), 3) NONE.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: the player's payment will be higher than normal to cover the expense of the forgery.
The following characters are related to this quest: Gray Fox (the guildmaster of the Thieves Guild), Hieronymus Lex (a guard who has made things difficult for the Thieves Guild), Lady Umbranox (a noblewoman ruling over Anvil, an Umbranox, located at Anvil), Dairihill (Lady Umbranox's dishonest steward, located at Anvil).
The following groups are related to this quest: Thieves Guild (a guild of thieves), Umbranox (a noble family).
The following locations are related to this quest: Bravil (a city).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The Gray Fox has asked that the player does this personally, as this is a delicate matter. Lady Umbranox is looking for a new guard captain: the Legion Commander of the Imperial Watch sent her a list of guard captain candidates. Dairihill lied to Lady Umbranox, telling her that the list has yet to arrive. The Gray Fox has extended his protection to the Umbranox family and Lady Umbranox in particular: Hieronymus Lex's unwavering loyalty and resolve make him the perfect protector for Lady Umbranox.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"S'Krivva gives you greeting. Hieronymus Lex must be eliminated once and for all. The Gray Fox has asked that you do this personally. It is a most delicate matter.
Lady Umbranox of Anvil, is hunting for a new captain of her guard. The Legion Commander of the Imperial Watch sent her a list of candidates. The Gray Fox wants this list replaced with one that highly recommends Hieronymus Lex. From Anvil he can do little harm to the guild. The letter carrying the list is currently in steward Dairihill's desk. She has lied to Lady Umbranox, telling her that the letter has yet to arrive.
For reasons unknown to this one, the Gray Fox has extended his protection to the Umbranox family and Lady Umbranox in particular. While Lex is a problem for the guild, his unwavering loyalty and resolve make him the perfect protector for Lady Umbranox.
You will have to track down a forger on your own. I don't know of any in Bravil. With the forged letter in hand, sneak into the Legion Commander's office in the Imperial City Prison and seal it with his seal. Dairihill cannot be trusted. You must deliver the letter to Lady Umbranox in person.
Remember, this is a mission of stealth, not blood. Your payment will be higher than normal to cover the expense of the forgery."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Count Cirion. Count Cirion is the ghost of the nobleman who ruled over Vitharn, who is located at the inner sanctum of Vitharn.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to break the cycle of torment for the ghosts of Vitharn.
The player should first correct the mistakes of the four people who failed to protect the gate lever to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Vitharn, a castle keep.
The following characters are related to this quest: Sheogorath (a fickle god).
The following groups are related to this quest: Fanatics.
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Vitharn was overrun by Fanatics centuries ago: Count Cirion and his people failed to defend Vitharn. Sheogorath cursed the shades of Count Cirion's people to repeat the final moments of their failures. Within Vitharn, no one will attack the player.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I am Count Cirion, and you have violated the inner sanctum of Vitharn Keep.
However, my people and I are in need. Maybe you can help us. Centuries ago, Vitharn was overrun by Fanatics. We were soft and failed to defend ourselves. I was the weakest of all. Now, the shades of my people are cursed by Sheogorath to repeat the final moments of their failures, over and over again. You must help us break the cycle of torment.
Help my people overcome their weakness and defend Vitharn from the Fanatics. Walk among them. There were four who failed to protect the gate lever. Find out what they did wrong and help them correct it. You can put away your sword in these halls. Unlike the defending spirits, within these walls, none will war with you. Not even the Fanatics.
My people long to be laid to rest. Please help them."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is a prophet.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to show that you are a worthy knight to seek out the holy relics of Pelinal Whitestrake.
The player should first complete the Pilgrimage of the Nine Divines to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Wayshrines of the Nine Divines, shrines to the gods.
The following characters are related to this quest: Pelinal Whitestrake (a legendary male knight of old).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Knights who wished to quest for the holy relics of Pelinal Whitestrake would walk the Pilgrim's Way: the player should pray to each of the gods in turn, and ask their favor upon the player's quest.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Oh my. To what do I owe this honor? I am but a humble prophet. What business do you have with me?
You would quest for the holy panoply of Pelinal Whitestrake? The legendary Relics that have been sought by mighty warriors throughout the ages? Are you a worthy knight?
The gods grant insight to those they deem worthy. Why and how they act is not predictable. What I can tell you is that traditionally, knights who wished to quest for the Relics would walk the Pilgrim's Way.
Travel to the Wayshrines of the Nine Divines. Pray to each of the gods in turn, and ask their favor upon your quest."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Sir Casimir. Sir Casimir is a ghost of a knight.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to retrieve the Gauntlets of the Crusader for yourself.
The player should first talk to the priests of Stendarr to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Chorrol, a city.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: Gauntlets of the Crusader (holy gauntlets).
The following characters are related to this quest: Sir Berich (one of Sir Casimir's fellow knights at the Order), Stendarr (the god of mercy, and one of the Nine).
The following groups are related to this quest: Nine (a pantheon of gods).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Sir Casimir followed Sir Berich into a war after the Order fractured. The war changed Sir Casimir: he no longer had sympathy for the weak, or pity for the suffering. After the war, Sir Casimir tried to serve the Nine at the Chapel of Stendarr in Chorrol. Sir Casimir was cursed after killing a beggar at the Chapel of Stendarr: he was weak, constantly weary, and lacked the energy to do almost anything. The Gauntlets of the Crusader slipped from Sir Casimir's hands after killing the beggar: they are still in the Chapel of Stendarr, too heavy to move.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I, Sir Casimir, know where you may find the Gauntlets of the Crusader, for I was the one who lost them when I was still alive. Though many know where they are, they are still lost. I believe there is something you must do in order to retrieve them.
When the Order fractured, I followed Sir Berich into war, taking the Gauntlets with me. When it was over, I returned to this land. I attempted to return to the service of the Nine, but the war had changed me. I no longer had sympathy for the weak, or pity for the suffering. In the brief time I was there, I did more to hurt the Chapel of Stendarr than help it. It was there that I was cursed.
A beggar who came to the Chapel each day for help tried my patience one too many times. I lost my temper, and struck him. My blow landed harder than I had intended, and he fell to the floor, dead. Killed in the very Chapel of the God of Mercy. I left the Chapel at once, of course, but the damage was done. I was weak, constantly weary, and lacked the energy to do almost anything.
As proof of the deed, when I struck the poor man the Gauntlets slipped right off my hands and fell to the floor. Heavy as stone, they would not move. None could lift them. I suspect they lie there still, in Chorrol's Chapel. You must prove to Stendarr you are worthy to lift the Gauntlets once more. Seek out the priests of Stendarr in Chorrol. Perhaps they can help you."
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Adrienne Berene. Adrienne Berene is one of the leader of the Mages Guild.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to find Erthor.
The player should first ask around about Erthor to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: a Guild Hall of the Mages Guild.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: Adrienne Berene's recommendation.
The following characters are related to this quest: Erthor (a male guild mage at Guild Hall).
The following groups are related to this quest: Mages Guild (a guild of mages).
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"My research occupies nearly all of my time.
Now that I think about it, I do have a small problem concerning Erthor. He's one of the guild mages here. Think you can do something about it?
I just don't have the time to search for him again, but I do need to consult him about some notes he borrowed. You might want to ask around the Guild Hall, and see if anyone can be of some help. Let me know when he's back, and you'll have your recommendation."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Lucien Lachance. Lucien Lachance is a fellow assassin, giving quest via "Dead Drop Orders #2".
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to assassinate all five members of the Draconis.
The player should first get the locations of other Draconis from Perennia Draconis, and assassinate her to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Applewatch, a farmhouse.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: the player should go to Skingrad after killing all Draconis family members: in the castle courtyard there is a well containing the player's reward and a further assignment from Lucien Lachance.
The following characters are related to this quest: Celedaen (a dead necromancer), Perennia Draconis (the matron of the Draconis, located at Applewatch), Matthias Draconis, Andreas Draconis, Sibylla Draconis, Caelia Draconis (the rest of the Draconis, the children of Perennia Draconis).
The following items are related to this quest: "Dead Drop Orders #2" (a note).
The following groups are related to this quest: Draconis (a family marked for death).
The following locations are related to this quest: Skingrad (a city).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. "Dead Drop Orders #2" is addressed toward the player: the player is a Silencer. The player killed Celedaen in the player's previous assignment.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Dead Drop Orders #2
by Lucien Lachance

The Necromancer Celedaen is dead, and you are not. That is quite an accomplishment. But your work as a Silencer has just begun.
Your next assignment requires you to eliminate not just one target, but five. An entire family, in fact. The unlucky kin are Perennia Draconis, Matthias Draconis, Andreas Draconis, Sibylla Draconis and Caelia Draconis. The locations of most of the family members are unknown, so you should begin your search with the family matron, Perennia, who resides at the farm called Applewatch.
You must discern the locations of all the Draconis family members and then systematically eliminate them. I suggest you first speak with the mother and find out if she has any valuable information on the whereabouts of her children, before ending her life.
When every member of the Draconis family lies dead, journey to the city of Skingrad. In the castle courtyard you will find a well containing your reward for the Draconis contract, as well any further assignment I might have."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Maeva the Buxom. Maeva the Buxom is a regretful wife.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to recover the Rockshatter for Maeva the Buxom.
The player should first find Bjalfi the Contemptible to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Fort Strand, a marauder hideout.
The following characters are related to this quest: Bjalfi the Contemptible (Maeva the Buxom's husband).
The following items are related to this quest: Rockshatter (a mace, and Maeva the Buxom's family heirloom).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Bjalfi the Contemptible snatched Rockshatter, and took off to join a local marauder gang at Fort Strand.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Perhaps you can help me. I'm Maeva the Buxom. My husband's name is Bjalfi the Contemptible. My father said I was a fool to marry him, but I didn't listen. At our wedding, my father gave us a family heirloom as a gift; Rockshatter, a mace that's been in my family for many generations.
Bjalfi snatched Rockshatter from our mantle and took off to "find his fortune" with the local Marauder gang at Fort Strand. I want that mace back. Please, I don't think he's ever coming back, and I'd hate to lose such a precious heirloom to a gang of thugs."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Martin. Martin is the player's friend.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to recover a Great Welkynd Stone for Martin.
The player should first find a Great Welkynd Stone to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Miscarcand, the dangerous ruins of an Ayleid city.
The following items are related to this quest: Great Welkynd Stone (the third item the player needs for the Mysterium Xarxes ritual, and a rare larger variant of Welkynd Stones valued by mages and occultists), Welkynd Stones (small magical crystals), Mysterium Xarxes (a mysterious book of rituals).
The following groups are related to this quest: Ayleid (extinct, ancient race of people).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Martin has made some progress in deciphering the Mysterium Xarxes ritual while the player was gone. The player may have seen lesser Welkynd Stones: they are common in Ayleid ruins.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"While you were gone, I've made some progress in deciphering the Mysterium Xarxes ritual.
The third item we need is a Great Welkynd Stone. You may have run across lesser Welkynd Stones; they are fairly common in Ayleid ruins. But a Great Welkynd Stone will not be easy to come by. They have been plundered one by one over the years, due to their great value to mages and occultists.
There is only one place that is rumored to still contain one: the ruins of the Ayleid city of Miscarcand. A place where many have perished seeking its Great Welkynd Stone. But nothing else will do, so you must succeed where all others have failed."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Lucien Lachance. Lucien Lachance is the player's superior in the Dark Brotherhood, giving quest via "Dead Drop Orders #5".
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to assassinate Alval Uvani.
The player should first locate Alval Uvani with a schedule included in this dead drop to complete their objective.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: the player should find Stonewall Shields: there is a dead drop behind that building in a hollowed-out tree stump containing the player's reward for the previous contract and the player's next contract.
The following characters are related to this quest: Alval Uvani (a traveling male Dunmer merchant skilled in Destruction spells, a native of Morrowind, located at Cyrodiil), Shaleez (a dead woman).
The following items are related to this quest: "Dead Drop Orders #5" (a note).
The following groups are related to this quest: Dark Brotherhood (a guild of assassins operating in Cyrodiil), Morag Tong (a guild of assassins operating in Morrowind), Dunmer (dark elves).
The following locations are related to this quest: Cyrodiil (a province), Morrowind (a province far away from Cyrodiil), Stonewall Shields (a shop in the Market District of the Imperial City), Imperial City (a large city), Leyawiin (a city).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The note is addressed toward the player: the player is the Silence of the Dark Brotherhood. The player assassinated Shaleez for Lucien Lachance. Alval Uvani is renting a house in Leyawiin. Alval Uvani's wife hired the Dark Brotherhood to kill her husband: the Morag Tong of Morrowind can't reach Alval Uvani in Cyrodiil. Alval Uvani suffers from a rare Dunmer condition, a serious allergy to honey: he would suffer from complete paralyzation after drinking honey-based mead.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Dead Drop Orders #5
by Lucien Lachance

If you're reading this note, Shaleez is dead. You've done the world a great service, Silencer. It's time to continue the good work.
Your next target is a traveling Dark Elf merchant by the name of Alval Uvani, who is currently renting a house in the city of Leyawiin. Uvani is a well-respected tradesman back in his native Morrowind, but his business often takes him very far from home. Therein lies the problem. Alval Uvani's wife has become disillusioned with her husband's repeated, extended absences and wishes to dissolve their marriage, and has sought the Dark Brotherhood's assistance. Lucky for us Cyrodiil is a bit beyond the reach of Morrowind's Morag Tong.
Alval Uvani is currently traveling around Cyrodiil, and is never in one place for more than a couple of days. In this dead drop you will also find a schedule detailing the Dark Elf's whereabouts; use it to locate him and plan your elimination. Be aware, however, that because he is forced to travel alone to the farthest reaches of the Empire, Uvani has learned to defend himself. He is a master of the Destruction school of Magicka, and is no stranger to killing.
When Alval Uvani lies rotting, journey to the Market District of the Imperial City. There you will find a shop called Stonewall Shields. Your dead drop is located behind that building, in a hollowed-out tree stump. As usual, you will find your reward for the previous contract, as well as information on your next.
Ah yes, I must mention one last detail. Apparently Alval Uvani suffers from a rare Dark Elf condition, a serious allergy to honey. If you could somehow get Uvani to drink the honey-based mead, perhaps by replacing his food, he would suffer from complete paralyzation. This would certainly make the Dark Elf a bit easier to deal with."
<|endoftext|>

"You seek training? If I were to aid you, you would first have to assist me.
I would strip the Creators of their works... you will help with this. Bring me 20 bear pelts, as proof that you have helped tear nature asunder.
Then we shall speak of spells and teaching."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Sheogorath. Sheogorath is the prince of madness, one of the Daedric Princes.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to find a way to make the first two parts of the K'Sharra come true.
The player should first ask about the K'Sharra from the shaman to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Border Watch, a small, peaceful village.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: Wabbajack.
The following items are related to this quest: K'Sharra (a prophesy).
The following groups are related to this quest: Daedric Princes (immortal, fickle, infamous divine beings).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player summoned Sheogorath. Sheogorath wants to make Border Watch an interesting place. The people of Border Watch are superstitious.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Another mortal dares to summon me, Sheogorath, and already I am bored. But enough about me. Let's talk about you.
I could turn you into a goat. Or a puddle. Or a bad idea. I could make you eat your own fingers. Or fall in love with a cloud. Perhaps I could make you into something useful. Let's find out.
There's a little settlement called Border Watch. It's a nice, peaceful place... and dull, dull, dull. You're going to make their lives interesting. They're a superstitious bunch. Everything is an omen or a portent. Let's make one come true. Find their shaman and ask about the K'Sharra prophecy. You are to find a way to make the first two parts of the prophecy come true. I'll take care of the rest, because it's the most fun. Now, run along."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Gray Fox. Gray Fox is the player's guildmaster in the Thieves Guild, who is located at Malintus' house.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to steal the Arrow of Extrication from Fathis Aren, and bring it to the Gray Fox.
The player should first talk to the beggars about locating the Arrow of Extrication to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Bravil, a city.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: the Gray Fox will pay the player well.
The following characters are related to this quest: Fathis Aren (a powerful male court wizard, located at Bravil), Malintus (a fellow member of the Thieves Guild, located at Malintus' house).
The following items are related to this quest: Savilla's Stone (a stone that reveals secrets to its fielder), Arrow of Extrication (a small, unique item).
The following groups are related to this quest: Thieves Guild (a guild of thieves).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Savilla's Stone has revealed that the Gray Fox needs something special for his plans: the Arrow of Extrication. The player may kill Fathis Aren, but not in the castle of Bravil.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"My work with Savilla's Stone has revealed that I need something special for my plans. It's a small item in the possession of a powerful court wizard. Will you do this for me? I will pay you well.
Bring me the Arrow of Extrication. It has a key shaped head. Bravil's court wizard, Fathis Aren, recently acquired this unique item. You may kill Fathis if necessary, but not in the castle. My spy network will tell me when you have it. Return here with the arrow when you do.
The beggars in Bravil will surely know where Aren keeps the Arrow. Now we should get out of Malintus' house before we wear out our welcome."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Lucien Lachance. Lucien Lachance is a Speaker for the Dark Brotherhood.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to complete your initiation to the Dark Brotherhood.
The player should first assassinate Rufio to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Inn of Ill Omen, an inn on the Green Road to the north of Bravil.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: the next time the player sleeps in a secure location, Lucien Lachance comes bearing the love of the player's new family.
The following characters are related to this quest: Rufio (an old and frail man who sleeps his days away, located at Inn of Ill Omen), Night Mother (the spiritual leader of the Dark Brotherhood, a woman).
The following groups are related to this quest: Dark Brotherhood (a guild of assassins).
The following locations are related to this quest: Bravil (a city).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Lucien Lachance has awoken the player from their sleep: the player is a murderer whose work pleases the Night Mother. Lucien Lachance gives the player a new blade.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"You sleep rather soundly for a murderer. That's good. You'll need a clear conscience for what I'm about to propose.
I am Lucien Lachance, a Speaker for the Dark Brotherhood. And you, you are a killer. A taker of life. A harvester of souls. Your work, your deathcraft, pleases the Night Mother. And so, I come to you with an offering. An opportunity... to join our rather unique family.
On the Green Road to the north of Bravil lies the Inn of Ill Omen. There you will find a man named Rufio. Kill him, and your initiation into the Dark Brotherhood will be complete. Know that Rufio is old and weak, and sleeps his days away. You could kill him before he even has a chance to wake. If you so choose. Do this, and the next time you sleep in a location I deem secure, I will reveal myself once more, bearing the love of your new family.
Please accept this token from the Dark Brotherhood. It is a virgin blade, and thirsts for blood. May it serve you well, as does your silence."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Kiliban Nyrandil. Kiliban Nyrandil is the dungeon master, who is located at Xedilian.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to get out of Xedilian.
The player should first deal with the adventurers to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Xedilian, a looping dungeon that is used to get rid of unwanted people.
The following characters are related to this quest: Sheogorath (a man who employs Kiliban Nyrandil).
The following items are related to this quest: the Manual (a manual that tells the player how Xedilian works, given to the player by Sheogorath).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Xedilian would normally have sent the player back to the entrance when they stepped on the pad in the Resonator Chamber: the player mus deal with the adventurers who are entering Xedilian before the player can leave Xedilian. The player should consult Kiliban Nyrandil or the Manual.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Welcome to Xedilian, I'm the dungeon caretaker, Kiliban Nyrandil.
Xedilian would normally have sent you back to the entrance when you stepped on the pad in the Resonator Chamber. Since you're up here, I can only surmise that adventurers are already entering the dungeon as we speak.
I'm afraid until the adventurers are dealt with, Xedilian will keep you here. Even I can't will its doors to open. To put it bluntly, you're stuck here for the moment. No disrespect intended.
The only thing we can do is let the adventurers complete a cycle through here. I'll be glad to help. I assume Sheogorath gave you the Manual. You can consult it for more information, or I can provide instructions."

"Hear me, and hear me well. Mannimarco will have what he seeks, but it will be his undoing at your hands.
With this gem in your possession, you will be impervious to his attempt to enthrall you. When he fails, that is when you shall strike. When we are done speaking, you will take this gem, you will then seek out Mannimarco, and destroy him. Get to him anyway you can. It is your only hope for defeating him. I have full confidence in you, and so I leave the guild in your care.
When I am gone, you will be recognized as Arch-Mage and leader of the Guild. Lead your fellow mages, and lead them well. The future rests on your shoulders.
Farewell, my friend."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Martin. Martin is the player's friend.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to acquire a Daedric artifact for Martin.
The player should first locate one of the Daedric cults to complete their objective.
The following items are related to this quest: "Modern Heretics" (a book), Mysterium Xarxes (a book of rituals), Daedric (an adjective referring to the Daedra).
The following groups are related to this quest: Daedra (immortal, fickle, infamous beings who have artifacts in the mortal world).
The following locations are related to this quest: Camoran's Paradise (the hideout of the player's enemy).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Martin has deciphered one of the four items needed for the ritual needed to open a portal to Camoran's Paradise with the Mysterium Xarxes: the blood of a Daedra Lord. "Modern Heretics" is the best introduction to Daedric cults: the library here has a copy. The Mysterium Xarxes ritual will consume the physical form of the Daedric artifact.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I've deciphered part of the ritual needed to open a portal to Camoran's Paradise.
The Mysterium Xarxes mentions four items needed for the ritual, but so far I have only deciphered one of them: the 'blood of a Daedra Lord'. In fact, Daedric artifacts are known to be formed from the essence of a Daedric Lord, from whence they derive their great power. Not an easy thing to come by, obviously, but we will need a Daedric artifact.
The only way to obtain a Daedric artifact is through the cults devoted to each of the Daedric Lords. The book "Modern Heretics" is the best introduction to Daedric cults. The library here has a copy if you need it.
Bring the artifact to me when you have acquired one. Remember, the Mysterium Xarxes ritual will consume the physical form of the artifact in order to release its Daedric power."
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Jeanne Frasoric. Jeanne Frasoric is the player's superior in the Mages Guild, who is located at Bruma Mages Guild.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to find J'skar, and make him re-appear.
The player should first talk to the mages about J'skar's disappearance to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Bruma Mages Guild, one of the guild halls of the Mages Guild.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: recommendation from Jeanne Frasoric to Raminus.
The following characters are related to this quest: Raminus (a male mage, and one of the leaders of the Mages Guild), J'skar (a mischievous male mage who has gone missing for real), Volanaro (a male mage, and J'skar's friend).
The following groups are related to this quest: Mages Guild (a guild of mages), Council (the ruling body of Mages Guild).
The following locations are related to this quest: Bruma (a city).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player asked a recommendation to Raminus from Jeanne Frasoric: the player is an Associate of the Mages Guild. If someone from the Council were to visit Bruma Mages Guild, and find out that J'skar has vanished, it would look bad on Jeanne Frasoric. Volanaro thinks J'skar's spell backfired.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"A recommendation, from me? Well, of course. Raminus would naturally want my opinion, wouldn't he?
This is a situation we can both benefit from, Associate. You do me a small favor, and I'll happily send along a glowing recommendation.
J'skar's disappeared. I mean he's really disappeared. No one here has seen him in days. Volanaro thinks maybe a spell backfired. If someone from the Council were to stop by, and find him gone, it'd look bad for me. I can't have that. Talk to the mages here, and see what you can find out.
If you can make J'skar re-appear, you'll have your recommendation."
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Ruslan. Ruslan is a man.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to do something about the corrupt watchman.
The player should first ask around about the corrupt watchman to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Market District, a shopping district.
The following characters are related to this quest: Luronk (Ruslan's male friend), Jensine (a female shopkeeper, located at Market District), the corrupt watchman, a male guard.
The following items are related to this quest: septim (a currency, coins).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The corrupt watchman took Ruslan's last septim. Luronk and Ruslan were shopping at Jensine's when the corrupt watchman accused them of stealing: the corrupt watchman fined Luronk and Ruslan even though Jensine said that they were innocent. The corrupt watchman has shaken down most of the shopkeepers in the Market District.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Hey stranger, can you spare a few coins? I've just been shaken down by that bastard watchman and he took my last septim. I don't know his name, but I'd recognize him if I saw him again.
Luronk and I were shopping at Jensine's when he accused us of stealing. Even Jensine said we were innocent, but he didn't care. We had to pay his "fine" or go to jail.
He's shaken down most of the shopkeepers in the Market District. They're all too afraid of him to do anything. Jensine wouldn't even talk about it.
Someone ought to do something about him."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Ocheeva. Ocheeva is the player's superior in the Dark Brotherhood.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to assassinate the other five guests at the party.
The player should first talk to the doorman to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Summitmist Manor, a large manor house in Skingrad.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: a bonus if the player kills all other five guests secretly.
The following characters are related to this quest: the doorman.
The following groups are related to this quest: Dark Brotherhood (a guild of assassins).
The following locations are related to this quest: Skingrad (a city).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The guests falsely believe that they cannot leave Summitmist Manor before finding a chest containing gold and the key to Summitmist Manor. The door to Summitmist Manor will be locked behind the player until the other guests are dead: the doorman will explain the rest.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Do you like parties? Because you've been invited to one. Of course you'll be killing all the other guests. Each guest, at some point in the past, wronged their mysterious host. Now he's hired us to exact his revenge. Are you ready to attend?
You need to go to the city of Skingrad, to the large house known as Summitmist Manor. There you will meet up with five very unlucky guests. In order to receive your bonus, you must kill each guest secretly, one by one. If anyone sees you committing murder, the bonus is forfeit. The guests believe there is a chest of gold hidden in the house, and have agreed to be locked inside until one of them finds it. In fact, the guests believe the key to the manor is inside the chest, and only by satisfying their greed will they be allowed to leave. Poor fools. There is, of course, no chest of gold. The guests will find no key. After you arrive, the doors will be locked behind you, as everyone expects. When all the guests lie dead, you will be free to leave.
Now go, see the doorman at Summitmist Manor. He will explain the rest. Have fun."
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Aelwin Merowald. Aelwin Merowald is an old, frustrated fisherman.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to bring 12 slaughterfish scales to Aelwin Merowald.
The player should first kill slaughterfish and collect their scales to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Lake Rumare, a lake.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: Aelwin Merowald makes it worth the player's time.
The player will encounter the following enemies during this quest: 12 slaughterfish (dangerous fish).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Slaughterfish nearly took off Aelwin Merowald's leg. Aelwin Merowald could retire with the money he would get from the slaughterfish scales.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"You know, stranger, there comes a time in every man's life when he has to admit that he's lost the fight.
Well, I've fought and I've lost. Who did I lose to? Who is my great enemy? Well, don't laugh... it's a bunch of damn fish.
I'm a fisherman. Or at least, I was. Until one of those slaughterfish damn near took my leg off. I was collecting their scales, see. I had a contract with this young alchemist. You wouldn't believe what he was paying for those scales! Then last month, one of the bastards got ahold of my leg. Took me right out of the business. But this alchemist, he needs the scales right away. The alchemist was paying so much for the scales that I'm close to having enough saved so that I can retire. But now, I can't get out there to Lake Rumare -- not with this leg. I only needed twelve more scales! Can you believe it? I was so close!
I've picked up a few things in my travels. If you head out there and bring me back the twelve scales that I need, I can make it worth your time. Help an old fisherman out, won't you?"

Isn't he scary? I wish someone would just make him disappear. I would do just about anything for you if you make him go away. Permanently. For good. Never to be seen again.
You need a dog. I happen to have one of my old ones still lying around. I'll send it to you after you get rid of the filthy cat man."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.

The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to bring Nocturnal's Eye back to Nocturnal.
The player should first recover Nocturnal's Eye from Argonians to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Leyawiin, a city spanning waters.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: Skeleton Key (a key that opens any lock).
The following items are related to this quest: Eye (one of Nocturnal's artifacts).
The following groups are related to this quest: Argonians (two people who stole the Eye of Nocturnal), Daedric Princes (immortal, fickle, infamous divine beings).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The Eye was stolen from its shrine and hid in dark waters.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Night among strangers. Secrets in the dark. Nocturnal is here.
But my Eye is blind and drowned, stolen from its shrine, and hid in dark waters. To steal from a god is most unwise. In Leyawiin, two Argonians think themselves secret, but the Eye has seen them.
Find these thieves in the city that spans the waters. Learn where they hide my Eye. Retrieve the Eye of Nocturnal, mortal, and return it to me, and I shall look favorably upon you.
You, mortal, may take this Skeleton Key upon your return. It shall open the secrets of dark places for you."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Namira. Namira is the lady of decay, one of the Daedric Princes.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to assist Forgotten in eliminating some priests of Arkay.
The player should first cast a spell Namira gives you upon the priests of Arkay, and let Forgotten kill the priests to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Anga, a dark dungeon.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: Ring of Namira.
The following characters are related to this quest: Arkay (the god of the cycle of birth and death).
The following groups are related to this quest: Daedric Princes (immortal, fickle, infamous divine beings), Forgotten (a sect of Namira's worshipers).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player has approached Namira's shrine. Forgotten have lived in peace for many years worshiping Namira from the dark, basking in their misery and filth: priests of Arkay seek to bring light to the Forgotten's darkness.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"You dare approach Namira's shrine, Child of the Light? You, who walk this plane basking in the light of the warm, cruel sun?
Prove to me that you deserve my favor. In Anga, my Forgotten have lived in peace for many years. They worship me from the dark, basking in their misery and filth. Now, though, some would seek to bring light to their darkness.
Priests of Arkay have intruded upon their squalor. I want you to help my Forgotten kill these priests of the Light. Cast this spell upon the priests. Allow my beloved Forgotten to kill the interlopers. When this is done, I shall reward you for your efforts.
You shall have my ring. Let it bring pain to others who would wish it upon you."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Lucien Lachance. Lucien Lachance is the player's superior in the Dark Brotherhood, giving quest via "Dead Drop Orders #4".
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to assassinate Shaleez.
The player should first locate Shaleez to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Flooded Mine, a mine drowned with water.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: the player's reward and another contract will be waiting at the dead drop located in a coffin, just outside Fort Redman.
The following characters are related to this quest: Shaleez (a female Argonian hunter and murderer), J'Ghasta (a dead man).
The following items are related to this quest: "Dead Drop Orders #4" (a note).
The following groups are related to this quest: Dark Brotherhood (a guild of assassins), Morag Tong (a guild of assassins operating in Morrowind).
The following locations are related to this quest: Fort Redman (ruins), Morrowind (a realm), Black Marsh (a realm).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. "Dead Drop Orders #4" has been addressed to the player: the player is a Silencer of the Dark Brotherhood. The player killed J'Ghasta for Lucien Lachance before. Shaleez was banished from her home village near Black Marsh/Morrowind border for a murder of a Dark Elven family: the Morag Tong can't reach Shaleez.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Dead Drop Orders #4
by Lucien Lachance

J'Ghasta is dead! Well done! I was right about you, Silencer. You are a useful tool indeed. Let's see if you can continue to impress me.
You must journey now to the Flooded Mine. There you will find Shaleez, an Argonian hunter who was banished from her village near the Black Marsh/Morrowind border for the brutal murder of a Dark Elven family. Relatives of the murdered family members have located Shaleez, and demand retribution. And, since the assignment is a bit far for Morrowind's Morag Tong to handle, the Dark Brotherhood has been commissioned to perform the elimination.
Be warned, Silencer! Shaleez is a skilled and deadly hunter, and will fight like the desperate fugitive she is.
After Shaleez has been eliminated, your reward and another contract will be waiting at the dead drop located in a coffin, just outside the ruins of Fort Redman."

The player should first escort Martin to High Chancellor Ocato, who is waiting for you both to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Imperial City, a large city.
The following characters are related to this quest: Mankar Camoran (an evil man serving Mehrunes Dagon), High Chancellor Ocato (the head of the Elder Council, located at Imperial City), Mehrunes Dagon (an evil god, located at Oblivion).
The following groups are related to this quest: Elder Council (a government body).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Martin sent a messenger to High Chancellor Ocato while the player was killing Mankar Camoran. The Elder Council rules in the Emperor's absence: they should not object to crowning Martin the Emperor.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"While you were gone, I sent a messenger to High Chancellor Ocato. He waits for us in the Imperial City.
Chancellor Ocato is the head of the Elder Council. The Council rules in the Emperor's absence. I don't expect any objections from the Elder Council, but we should defer to their authority.
Let's go to the Imperial City at once, before the enemy can recover from Mankar Camoran's death. Until we light the Dragonfires, the Gates are open, and Mehrunes Dagon's invasion continues."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Sheogorath. Sheogorath is the prince of madness, one of the Daedric Princes.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to become a ruler in the Court of Madness.
The player should first speak to Arctus and Dervenin to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Sacellum Arden-Sul, a church.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: Sheogorath's citizens will rally around the player.
The following characters are related to this quest: Malacath (the lord of monsters, one of the Daedric Princes), Arctus (a high priest, located at Sacellum Arden-Sul), Dervenin (a high priest, located at Sacellum Arden-Sul).
The following groups are related to this quest: Daedric Princes (immortal, fickle, infamous divine beings).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Sheogorath's citizens need a new ruler when he is gone: the player has to replace a current Duke or Duchess of Madness. Malacath's realm is a nasty place.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Once I am gone, things usually get bad quickly.
You'll need the respect of My citizens. They'll need a leader, someone to look up to when I'm gone. They're the backbone of any great land. Except where the backbone is an actual backbone. Ever been to Malacath's realm...? Nasty stuff. But, back to the business at hand.
You'll need to control one of the Courts of Madness. Replace a current Duke. Or Duchess. Whichever. That will command respect! The people will rally around you. You'll have their love, their admiration, their complaints! Whatever. As long as it keeps them on Our side.
Speak to Arctus and Dervenin, the High Priests at the Sacellum Arden-Sul. They can explain what needs to be done."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Sheogorath. Sheogorath is the prince of madness, one of the Daedric Princes, who is located at Shivering Isles.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to activate Xedilian to make unwanted guests to stay away from Sheogorath's realm.
The player should first use the Attenuator of Judgement and the small book to activate Xedilian to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Xedilian, a maze dungeon in Shivering Isles.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: None.
The following characters are related to this quest: Haskill (a detail-oriented man, and a snappy dresser).
The following items are related to this quest: Attenuator of Judgement (an item the player needs), small book, tells the player how to activate Xedilian.
The following groups are related to this quest: Daedric Princes (immortal, fickle, infamous divine beings).
The following locations are related to this quest: Shivering Isles (Sheogorath's realm).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Sheogorath gives the player the Attenuator of Judgement and a small book: the player can get more information from Haskill.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I'm Sheogorath, the Daedric Prince of Madness. I've been waiting for you, or someone like you, or someone other than you, for some time.
Now? You run an errand for me. An important one. Of course, anything I tell you to do is important. My Realm, my rules. You're going to Xedilian, one of my favorite spots in the Shivering Isles. It's a little place I use to take care of unwanted visitors. And some are more unwanted than others.
There are those that have other ways into my Realm, and they're on the move. We don't want them here. Trust me. So, you're going to get Xedilian up and running. Here's a little book to tell you how, and the Attenuator of Judgement. You'll need that, too. Of course, you can always get more details from Haskill. He's a detail-oriented type of person. A big help. And a snappy dresser.
Now, get going. Before I change my mind. Or my mind changes me."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Pelinal Whitestrake. Pelinal Whitestrake is the ghost of a legendary knight.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to seek Pelinal Whitestrake's Relics, and destroy Umaril the Accursed.
The player should first visit the shrine of Pelinal Whitestrake to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Vanua, the site of Pelinal Whitestrake's death, where the Ayleid tormented him in a final act of revenge.
The following characters are related to this quest: Umaril the Accursed (an old enemy of Pelinal Whitestrake, and a male Ayleid elf).
The following groups are related to this quest: Ayleid (a race of elves who enslaved humans).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player is a knight. The player's prayers have woken Pelinal Whitestrake from death. Umaril the Accursed found a way back to life. Pelinal Whitestrake's friends built a shrine upon Vanua: Pelinal Whitestrake can show the player where Vanua once stood.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Hail knight! I am Pelinal Whitestrake, whose Relics you seek with a worthy heart!
Your prayers have woken me from my endless dream. Or perhaps you have entered my dream, and I still sleep. I think others have sometimes spoken to me, others like you, but my memory is doubtful. Perhaps the others came after you. Your need must be great for the gods to allow us to speak. Has Umaril the Accursed found a way back? The foulest of a foul race. A thousand curses upon his unholy name!
I thought I'd won. But I should have known. The Slavemasters are a cunning breed. Umaril found a way to cheat death, as I could not. If you would seek for my Relics, I know little that can help you. All that has passed since my death is like mist that my mind cannot take hold of. My friends built a shrine upon the site of my death, Vanua, where the Ayleid Elves tormented me in a final act of revenge. I can show you where it once stood. Perhaps it is there still.
Fare thee well, sir knight. May the gods grant you to destroy Umaril utterly, as I failed to do."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is a city guard, who is located at near the Oblivion Gate.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to save Farwil from Oblivion, and close the Oblivion Gate.
The player should first enter the Oblivion Gate to complete their objective.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: Count Indarys is offering a reward.
The following characters are related to this quest: Farwil (Count Indarys' son, and a brash young man, located at Oblivion), Count Indarys (an influential nobleman).
The following groups are related to this quest: Knights of the Thorn (a group of young men pretending to be knights).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Farwil entered the Oblivion Gate with six other Knights of Thorn: Count Indarys posted guards around the Oblivion Gate. Farwil formed the Knights of the Thorn two years ago.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"About two days ago, Count Indarys's son, Farwil, entered the Oblivion Gate with six other men. We haven't heard from them since then. The Count fears the worst, and has posted guards here so we can watch and see if anyone comes back out. So far, nothing.
At this point, Count Indarys is offering a reward for the recovery of his son from inside the gate... or confirmed news of his demise. If you find him or the rest of the Knights of the Thorn, get them out of there. I'm sure that the Count would also be pleased if the gate was closed.
The Knights of the Thorn are a bunch of rabble who fancy themselves true knights. Farwil formed the group around two years ago. They make grand boasts, and talk a good talk, but that's all they are. The real work goes to us, the City Guard. I hate to speak ill of them, as something horrible may have happened, but their own bravado got them into this mess."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Raminus Polus. Raminus Polus is the player's superior at the Mages Guild.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to retrieve a book from Janus Hassildor.
The player should first travel to Skingrad to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Skingrad, an unusual city southwest of the Imperial City.
The following characters are related to this quest: Janus Hassildor (the Count of Skingrad, located at Skingrad).
The following groups are related to this quest: Mages Guild (a guild of mages).
The following locations are related to this quest: Wellspring Cave (a cave), Imperial City (a major city).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The Council of Mages is investigating what happened at Wellspring Cave, leaving the ranks of Mages Guild spread thin. Skingrad is an unusual place.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I, Raminus Polus, have a new task for you.
The Council is investigating what happened at Wellspring Cave. Many of our resources are devoted to the task, leaving our ranks spread thin. There is a related book that needs to be recovered. It was recently loaned to Janus Hassildor, the Count of Skingrad. I'd like you to retrieve it.
I understand this may not seem the most important of tasks, but still... it needs doing, and you are one of the few available to do it. A note of caution: Skingrad is an... unusual place. Be prepared for the unexpected.
The city of Skingrad lies southwest of the Imperial City. You should have no trouble finding it.
You have your task. Perform it as well as you would any other."
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Sheogorath. Sheogorath is an unhinged king.

The player should first talk to the messenger to complete their objective.
The following groups are related to this quest: Order (Sheogorath's enemies who are not good at subterfuge).
The following locations are related to this quest: Brellach (Sheogorath's army's stronghold).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player is Sheogorath's newest and only noble in the realm. A messenger told Sheogorath that Order has attacked Brellach and routed his soldiers.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"There's a perfect job for you, my newest and only Noble in the realm!
A messenger told me that Order has attacked my army's stronghold at Brellach and routed my soldiers! If Order has truly entered my army's stronghold, things have taken a disturbing turn. It means Order has tried subterfuge... not its strong suit. Amazing! Perhaps things aren't going as poorly as I'd imagined.
You'll want to get all the details from the messenger. Unless you already have. You haven't, have you?"

The player should first survive the Tournament of Ten Bloods to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: one of Boethia's realms in Oblivion.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: Goldbrand (a sword).
The following items are related to this quest: Tournament of Ten Bloods (Boethia's tournament).
The following groups are related to this quest: Daedric Princes (immortal, fickle, infamous divine beings).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player has summoned Boethia: the player is not a worshiper of Boethia. Boethia shall open a portal for the player to one of his realms in Oblivion. If the player fails the Tournament of Ten Bloods, the player's soul belongs to Boethia.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Why do you summon Boethia? You are not one of my faithful.
Do you hope to be counted among my Chosen? Then prove yourself to me, mortal. I shall open a portal for you to one of my realms in Oblivion. Go, and take your place in my Tournament of Ten Bloods.
Survive, and you will be rewarded with my glorious sword Goldbrand. Fail, and your soul belongs to me."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Azura. Azura is the queen of dawn and dusk, one of the Daedric Princes.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to perform a service to Azura.
The player should first kill 5 followers of Azura to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Gutted Mine, a vampire lair.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: Azura's Star (a powerful artifact).
The following characters are related to this quest: Dratik (a dead vampire).
The following groups are related to this quest: Daedric Princes (immortal, fickle, infamous divine beings).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. 5 followers of Azura slew Dratik and its vampire kin: the 5 followers of Azura were infected with vampirism and sealed themselves in the Gutted Mine.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Greetings, traveler. I am Azura, known as the Queen of Dawn and Dusk.
I have seen your name, traveler, and heard it whispered in twilight. I ask a service, which holds promise of fame and reward.
Many years ago, five followers of mine slew the vampire Dratik and its kin, but all were infected by the foul creature. Knowing their fate, they sealed themselves up in the vampire's lair. Their suffering weighs heavily on me. Five bright candles shall burn forever in memory of their sacrifice.
Travel to the Gutted Mine. The door will open to you. Bring the peace of death to my followers, and you shall earn my gratitude. For your service, you shall have my Star, that your deeds might be entered in the Book of Fate."

"If I've told you once, I've told you a thousand times. I've NEVER been to Cheydinhal! I... oh, hang on. You're someone else. Apologies, my good friend, I mistook you for someone else. Always being asked about it, I am. 'Didn't I see you in Cheydinhal?', they say. Well I'm sick of it. Sick and tired, tired and sick. And perhaps a little drunk. But never mind. You look like the honest sort, so I've a job for you.
You're going to travel to Cheydinhal, and find out what sort of impostor is trying to besmirch my good name. And you're going to tell him... *hic*... You're going to tell him I am quite capable of besmirching my good name on my own. He should cease and desist immediately. There's fifty gold pieces in it for you, friend..."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Lucien Lachance. Lucien Lachance is the player's superior in the Dark Brotherhood, who is located at Fort Farragut.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to perform the ancient rite known as Purification by killing everyone at the Cheydinhal Sanctuary, and return to Lucien Lachance.
The player should first assassinate Ocheeva, Vicente Valtieri, Antoinetta Marie, Gogron gro-Bolmog, Telaendril, M'raaj-Dar and Teinaava to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Cheydinhal Sanctuary, a hideout belonging to the Dark Brotherhood.
The following characters are related to this quest: Ocheeva, Vicente Valtieri, Antoinetta Marie, Gogron gro-Bolmog, Telaendril, M'raaj-Dar, Teinaava (fellow members of the Dark Brotherhood, located at Cheydinhal Sanctuary), Sithis (the dark god of the Dark Brotherhood).
The following groups are related to this quest: Dark Brotherhood (a guild of assassins), Black Hand (the governing body of the Dark Brotherhood).
The following locations are related to this quest: Fort Farragut (a ruined fort).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player is an assassin of the Dark Brotherhood: Lucien Lachance has not spoken to the player in a while. The Black Hand has learned that the Dark Brotherhood has been infiltrated: the player is not suspected, because they joined the Dark Brotherhood after the traitor became active. From this point forward, the player is no longer bound by the Five Tenets: Sithis will forgive any murder, any theft, so long as the player serves the Black Hand. Lucien Lachance gives the player a poisoned apple and a unique scroll of summoning.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I have been waiting for you, assassin. We have not spoken in some time, but I am well aware of your accomplishments within the Dark Brotherhood. That is why I have sent for you. I'm afraid there is a... situation.
The time has come to test both your skill and your loyalty to Sithis. The Black Hand has learned that the Dark Brotherhood has been infiltrated. By whom, and for what purpose, we do not yet know. What we do know is that there is some link between the traitor and the Cheydinhal Sanctuary. The traitor has tainted that place beyond repair. It was learned that the traitor has been active for quite some time, since before you joined the Brotherhood. That absolves you of any suspicion.
The Black Hand has chosen you to perform the ancient rite known as Purification. Everyone inside the Sanctuary must die! You must break one of the Tenets you have sworn to uphold. I know this is an unexpected turn of events, but drastic measures must be taken. Ocheeva, Vicente Valtieri, Antoinetta Marie, Gogron gro-Bolmog, Telaendril, M'raaj-Dar and Teinaava. All of these family members must die! From this point forward, you are no longer bound by the Five Tenets! Sithis will forgive any murder, any theft, so long as you serve the Black Hand!
When the rite of Purification has been completed, return to me here at Fort Farragut, and we will discuss your future. Now, take these special gifts. They will help you greatly. One is a poisoned apple. The other, a unique scroll of summoning. Good luck... assassin."
<|endoftext|>
