This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Lucien Lachance. Lucien Lachance is the player's superior in the Dark Brotherhood, giving quest via "Dead Drop Orders #7".
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to assassinate Ungolim.
The player should first eliminate Ungolim when he visits the Lucky Old Lady at night between 6:00 PM and 1:00 AM to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Bravil, a city.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: the player's dead drop is in a barrel located behind the statue in the pond in Anvil: the player's reward and next contract will be waiting.
The following characters are related to this quest: Ungolim (a male Wood Elf Archer, loves a married woman, located at Bravil), Havilstein Hoar-Blood (a horrible man).
The following items are related to this quest: "Dead Drop Orders #7" (a note), Lucky Old Lady (an ancient statue in Bravil, a symbol of good luck and prosperity).
The following groups are related to this quest: Dark Brotherhood (a guild of assassins).
The following locations are related to this quest: Anvil (a city).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player killed Havilstein Hoar-Blood for Lucien Lachance. Ungolim spends his days securely locked inside his house.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Dead Drop Orders #7
by Lucien Lachance

My compliments on another job well done! Havilstein Hoar-Blood was more swine than man, and deserved to die quivering like an animal! You must not stop! You must kill again!
Your next target is a Wood Elf named Ungolim, who resides in the city of Bravil. Bravil is also home to an ancient statue known as the Lucky Old Lady. It is seen as a symbol of good luck and prosperity, and the fools of Bravil often speak to the statue and wish for good tidings. Every night, poor lovestruck Ungolim visits the statue and pleads desperately for the heart of a young maiden. This maiden is married, and her husband has learned of Ungolim's affection for his bride. He fears the competition, it would seem, and has commissioned the Dark Brotherhood to help in the matter.
You must go to Bravil, locate Ungolim, and kill him. The Wood Elf owns a house in the city, but he spends his days securely locked inside. I recommend you lie in wait at the Lucky Old Lady statue, and then eliminate Ungolim when he arrives for his nightly visit. He's generally there between the hours of 6:00 PM and 1:00 AM.
By all accounts, Ungolim is a deadly archer and a fearless opponent. I also have reason to believe he is expecting trouble, so if Ungolim senses danger, he may attack you on sight. Be vigilant, and bring the Wood Elf down! You must not fail!
When Ungolim's body lies broken at the foot of his dear statue, you must journey to the city of Anvil. Your dead drop is in a barrel located behind the statue in the pond. As is standard, your reward and next contract will be waiting."
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Vicente Valtieri. Vicente Valtieri is the player's superior at the Dark Brotherhood.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to help Francois Motierre fake his death to escape his debts.
The player should first break into Francois Motierre's house to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Chorrol, a city.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: Cruelty's Heart (an amulet).
The following characters are related to this quest: Francois Motierre (a marked man, located at Chorrol).
The following items are related to this quest: Languorwine (a rare poison, one drop in bloodstream will mimic the effects of death immediately).
The following groups are related to this quest: Dark Brotherhood (a guild of assassins).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Francois Motierre is waiting for the player inside his house: the player should not kill him. Francois Motierre's debtors have sent an enforcer to kill him. Vicente Valtieri gives the player a knife: the blade has been coated with Languorwine, and there's only enough Languorwine for slicing Francois Motierre. Vicente Valtieri will give the player a vial of antidote, which will be used to revive Francois Motierre after the player successfully stages his death.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I, Vicente Valtieri, have a special contract that needs fulfillment. In truth. I don't wish to offer it to any other guild member. I've come to rely on your abilities.
We're usually called upon to take a life, but not this time. This contract requires us to stage the assassination of a marked man.
You must go to the city of Chorrol and break into the house of Francois Motierre. Inside you will find Motierre waiting for you. Do not kill him! You see, Francois Motierre is a marked man. He owes a considerable sum to the wrong kind of people. So, they have sent an enforcer to kill him. This is an unusual contract, Motierre had to make a special arrangement with us before it was approved. I trust in your professionalism.
Here, take this knife. The blade has been coated with a rare poison called Languorwine. One drop in a normal human bloodstream will mimic the effects of death immediately. I will provide you with a vial of antidote, which will be used to revive Francois Motierre after you successfully stage his death. You should also know that there's only enough Languorwine on the blade for this one contract. After Motierre is sliced, the knife will be useless.
As payment, I'll be pleased to award you this amulet, Cruelty's Heart."
<|endoftext|>

I will pay you 10 gold coins for each sample."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Vicente Valtieri. Vicente Valtieri is the player's superior at the guild of assassins.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to assassinate Valen Dreth in the Imperial Prison.
The player should first infiltrate the Imperial Prison via a set of secret tunnels to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Imperial City's sewers.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: a bonus if the player fulfills the contract without killing any of the prison guards.
The following characters are related to this quest: Valen Dreth (a male Dark Elf, and a frail prisoner of many years, located at Imperial Prison).
The following locations are related to this quest: Imperial Prison (a prison where the player was imprisoned in the past), Imperial City (a large city).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Just outside of the Imperial Prison is a grating that leads to the sewers: it has recently been tightly locked, but Vicente Valtieri will provide a key.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Back for more? It just so happens I have another contract available, one that requires an expert in infiltration.
Ever broken out of jail? How do you feel about breaking into one? The Imperial Prison, to be exact. We need a prisoner... silenced. Can you do it?
Your target is a Dark Elf named Valen Dreth. He thinks he's safe in prison. He is tragically mistaken. A prisoner recently escaped from the prison, using a set of secret tunnels connecting to the Imperial City's sewer system. It's a perfect way inside. Just outside of the Imperial Prison is a grating that leads to the sewers. It has recently been tightly locked, but I will provide a key. It should be easy enough to locate Dreth in his small cell. Besides, I think you know the way, hmmm. He he he he he.
Valen Dreth has been imprisoned for many years. His tongue is sharp, but his body is limp and frail. He will prove an easy, pleasurable kill. You will receive a bonus if you fulfill the contract without killing any of the prison guards. Now go, and may the Night Mother go with you."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Agronak gro-Malog, "Gray Prince". Agronak gro-Malog, "Gray Prince" is a friendly fellow arena fighter, who is located at Bloodworks in the Imperial City.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to find proof of Agronak gro-Malog's noble birthright.
The player should first travel to the place of Agronak gro-Malog's birth to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Crowhaven, a ruined fort far to the west of the Imperial City, and Agronak gro-Malog's birthplace.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: Agronak gro-Malog's finest combat techniques.
The following characters are related to this quest: Lord Lovidicus (a nobleman, and Agronak gro-Malog's father), Lady Lovidicus (a noblewoman, the wife of Lord Lovidicus), Agronak gro-Malog's mother, a former servant in the employ of Lord Lovidicus, and Lord Lovidicus' lover.
The following groups are related to this quest: Lovidicus (a noble family).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Agronak gro-Malog's mother fled with Agronak gro-Malog from the wrath of Lady Lovidicus. Agronak gro-Malog's mother gave Agronak gro-Malog a key to Crowhaven to "unlock the truth" before dying.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Hail, friend. I don't believe I've ever seen you down here in the Bloodworks before. Allow me to introduce myself. My name is Agronak gro-Malog.
I grew up here in the Imperial City, but I was born elsewhere. My mother was a servant in the employ of Lord Lovidicus, and resided at his fortress. Lady Lovidicus was a shrew of a woman. The Lord and my mother grew close, and ultimately fell in love. I was the result of their union. When the Lady learned of my birth she was furious, and threatened to kill both my mother and me. So we fled, leaving my claim to nobility behind.
My mother died recently. Before she passed, she gave me this key, and told me it would "unlock the truth," at the place of my birth, Crowhaven. Crowhaven is a ruined fort far to the west of here. I'd go myself, but my training regiment doesn't allow for the luxury of such an excursion.
My friend, you must travel to Crowhaven and use the key to unlock whatever it is that holds the proof of my birthright! Find this proof and return it to me, and I'll share with you some of my finest combat techniques. Trust me, you can't learn these moves in a book!"
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called G.S.. G.S. is a long-dead thief, giving quest via "Crumpled Note".
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to find the magical ring that G.S. hid inside some old barrels.
The player should first use a key to open a chest to find another key for an another chest until you find the ring to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Pale Pass, a valley in the Jeralls with some ruins.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: a magical ring.
The following items are related to this quest: "Crumpled Note" (a note).
The following locations are related to this quest: Jeralls (a mountain range).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. "Crumpled Note" is addressed to an old friend of G.S.. G.S. recounts how he stole a magical ring from a wizard and escaped from the owner of the ring until he ended up into Pale Pass.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Crumpled Note
by G.S.

I guess you found the message I told you about, old friend. We've traveled together for so long, and you're the only one I trust with the ring and my story.
I knew climbing into the window of that wizard's house was a mistake, but the bounty on the ring was just too enticing to pass up. They said it was worth thousands of drakes... enough to keep me comfortable for a while as I lay low. They also said the owner of the ring was out of town at some meeting of wizards or some such.
They were wrong on both counts. You'd think I'd be used to this by now, dealing with the unpredictable in our line of work. But after trying to fence the ring all over the realm, no one would touch it. Worse still, the wizard was pursuing me the entire time. I had to call in many favors to stay one step ahead of him.
I decided to strike north and make for the neighboring land. As I was crossing the Jeralls, he finally caught up to me. Two fireballs later, I found myself tumbling down a steep snowy slope into a valley. Don't know where I am, but there are ruins of some old fort here. Luckily, that fetcher didn't follow me down; I assume he gave me up for dead.
I think I'm going to stash the ring in this valley, cross the border north, and return later when I feel it's safe. I've used some old chests I found in the ruins to make sure nobody stumbles across the ring by mistake; you know, the old key to a key thing like we used to do. If I don't make it back here, and you're reading this message, then the ring is all yours, my friend. Use it well and remember me.
G.S."
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Rosentia Gallenus. Rosentia Gallenus is a collector of arcane artifacts, who carries a Daedric Staff, who is located at Rosentia Gallenus' home in Leyawiin.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to make the scamps go away from Rosentia Gallenus' home.
The player should first dispose of the Daedric Staff to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Darkfathom Cave, a cave.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: Ring of Eidolon's Edge (a ring).
The following items are related to this quest: Daedric Staff (a cursed staff).
The following groups are related to this quest: scamps (little, beastly, nasty, smelly and noisy Daedra), Daedra (unpredictable, immortal, infamous beings).
The following locations are related to this quest: Leyawiin (a city).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Rosentia Gallenus bought a cheap Daedric Staff: four scamps appeared after Rosentia Gallenus spoke the runic word carved on the Daedric Staff while holding it. The four scamps follow Rosentia Gallenus everywhere. Rosentia Gallenus can't compel herself to let go of the Daedric Staff.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"These stupid scamps are driving me crazy! I'm at my wit's end! I, Rosentia Gallenus, beg you to help me!
The beastly little creatures are nasty, smelly, noisy and wrecking my beautiful house! I must be rid of them! I can't let people know I have scamps in here, or they'll think I've taken to Daedra worship. Try explaining that to the town guard.
I had a feeling buying that Daedric Staff would be trouble. Now I'm paying for it with more than just some gold. A few weeks ago, a spellsword was passing through Leyawiin and heard that I like to buy curiosities. He wanted to sell the staff you see me carrying. I eagerly bought it, knowing the value of Daedric relics. In fact, I was a bit suspicious when he sold it so cheap. His loss, my gain I figured. After examining it for a bit I noticed a small word carved on it in runes. Using a book from my library, I translated it. The word was nonsense. However, when I spoke it and held the staff, four scamps suddenly appeared! I thought I was done for! Strangely, they all just stood there. It didn't take long before I realized they were following me! I couldn't be seen in town with scamps following, so I decided to discard the staff. I can't explain it, but somehow I can't compel myself to actually let it go. This staff is obviously cursed! Now I'm stuck with it.
Oh please, I beg you! Take this staff to Darkfathom Cave and get rid of it and the scamps forever! I can't fight, and who knows what's guarding the shrine? Plus, do you know how dirty caves are? It'll ruin anything I wear!
Do this for me, and I'll reward you with another one of my curios I picked up a few years ago... a valuable ring. Ring of Eidolon's Edge."
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion.
The quest-giver is called Falcar. Falcar is a rude mage from the mages' guild.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to retrieve the Ring of Burden for Falcar.
The player should first get the key to the locked well from Deetsan to complete their objective.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: Falcar's recommendation to the Arcane University.
The following characters are related to this quest: Deetsan (a woman).
The following items are related to this quest: Ring of Burden (a magical ring).
The following locations are related to this quest: Arcane University (an esteemed school for mages), the locked well.
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player is an Associate of the mages' guild. Another Associate tossed the Ring of Burden down the locked well behind the guild hall.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"What is it, Associate? Don't tell me you're here for a recommendation from me.
There was a particular Ring of Burden I was testing some time ago. Another stupid Associate somehow got his hands on it, and managed to misplace it. If I didn't know better, I'd say he purposely tossed it down the well behind the guild hall. Why he would do such a thing is beyond me.
You will retrieve this ring for me. Should you manage to do so, I shall consider sending a recommendation to the Arcane University.
The well is locked, so you'll need the key. Deetsan should have a copy of it. Now get moving."

The player should first find a safe place to sleep outside to complete their objective.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: a reward.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:

There're walls and statues and all sorts of things that can fall on me. Can't have that. Nope. But... if you find me a good place to sleep, a safe place -- outside -- I'll reward you!
Remember, walk lightly, and always look up."

An intelligent, beautiful woman like her wouldn't fall for that nonsense... I hope. I've been thinking... maybe Camilla needs a little help seeing Sven for what he is. Could you... could you give her this letter, and say it's from Sven? I think I've matched that Nord's lack of cleverness perfectly.
I would appreciate your help. You could take some gold I've saved up from working at the mill."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim.
The quest-giver is called Ulfric. Ulfric is the player's leader in the Stormcloaks, who is located at Solitude.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to conquer Solitude, and free Skyrim from the Empire.
The player should first fight your way to Castle Dour to cut the head off the Imperial legion itself to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Solitude, a city in Skyrim.
The following groups are related to this quest: Stormcloaks (rebel forces opposing the Empire).
The following locations are related to this quest: Castle Dour (the headquarters of the Imperial legion), Skyrim (a province of the Empire), Sovngarde (the storied afterlife of heroes).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Ulfric is addressing the player and the player's fellow Stormcloaks: the true sons and daughters of Skyrim. Sovngarde awaits those who die fighting. The gods will look down and see Skyrim as she was meant to be: full of Nords who are mighty, powerful, and free.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"This is it men! It's time to make this city ours!
We come to this moment carried by the sacrifices and the courage of our fellows. Those who have fallen. And those still bearing the shields to our right. On this day, our enemy will know the fullness of our determination, the true depth of our anger, and the exalted righteousness of our cause.
The gods are watching. The spirits of our ancestors are stirring. And the men under suns yet to dawn will be transformed by what we do here today. Fear neither pain, nor darkness. For Sovngarde awaits those who die with weapons in their hands, and courage in their hearts.
We now fight our way to Castle Dour to cut the head off the legion itself! And in that moment, the gods will look down and see Skyrim as she was meant to be. Full of Nords who are mighty, powerful, and free!
Ready now! Everyone, with me! For the sons and daughters of Skyrim!"

The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: Captain Valmir will pay the player.

This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"You there! As an officer of the Imperial Legion, I require your assistance to complete my mission.
The General has sent me to obtain a powerful weapon for the war effort. This was the last great bastion of the Dragon Cult, and their leader's mask was reported to be quite powerful.
They were among the first men to arrive from Atmora and they worshiped certain animals as avatars of the Gods; Dragons being foremost. And for their bloody sacrifices, the Dragons gifted their priests with terrible power. But their cruelty was too great for men to bear, and they rose up in what would be called the Dragon War and the Cult swept from the land.
I'll pay for the Dragon Cult leader's mask. Get in there, find the mask, return it to me, and earn your pay."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim.
The quest-giver is called Kraldar. Kraldar is a nobleman.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to gain the honorary title of thane of Winterhold.
The player should first help the people of Winterhold to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Winterhold, the hold ruled over Kraldar.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: the perks of being a thane.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"There is room in my court for a new Thane. It's an honorary title, mainly, but there are a few perks someone like you could make use of.
However, I could only grant the title to someone who is known throughout my Hold.
You help my people, and I'll make you my Thane."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim.

The player should first find the Forgemaster's Fingers to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Stony Creek Cave, a cave.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: the player will become Blood-Kin to the Orcs: the player will be allowed to enter Orc strongholds.
The following characters are related to this quest: Malacath (the god of the Orcs).
The following items are related to this quest: Forgemaster's Fingers (a pair of gauntlets).
The following groups are related to this quest: Orcs (a rough race of people).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player is not an Orc or blood-kin to the Orcs: the player is not welcome at the Orc stronghold by the code of Malacath.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Halt, outlander. By the Code of Malacath, this stronghold belongs to the Orcs. Your kind are unwelcome. You're not an Orc, or Blood-Kin, so stay out. We only help our own.
Hmm... there is a way to become Blood-Kin, if you truly insist on entering our stronghold. We've heard whispers of an enchanted pair of gauntlets, hidden and protected by dangerous men, beasts, or worse.
They are called the Forgemaster's Fingers. Find them at Stony Creek Cave. Bring them to our chief, and he will decide if you're worthy to be Blood-Kin to the Orcs."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim.
The quest-giver is called Viarmo. Viarmo is the welcoming headmaster of the Bards College, who is located at Bards College.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to become a member of the Bards College.
The player should first retrieve King Olaf's Verse to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Dead Men's Respite, a tomb.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: Bards College membership.
The following characters are related to this quest: Jarl Elisif (the local ruler, a noblewoman), King Olaf (a long-dead king).
The following items are related to this quest: King Olaf's Verse (a part of the Poetic Edda, the living history of Skyrim, a poem dealing with King Olaf).
The following locations are related to this quest: Bards College (a college for bards), Skyrim (a realm).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Jarl Elisif has forbidden the burning of King Olaf, a festival put on by the Bards College: to convince Jarl Elisif change her mind, Viarmo wants to read King Olaf's Verse.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Welcome to the Bards College. I am Viarmo, the headmaster here.
Always a pleasure to meet a prospective bard. You should be aware that many apply but we accept very few people. When possible, we ask applicants to perform tasks the college needs completed. In this case, I do have a task befitting an aspiring bard...
Jarl Elisif has forbidden the Burning of King Olaf, a Festival put on by the Bards College. We need to change her mind. To convince her I want to read King Olaf's Verse. A part of the Poetic Edda, the living history of Skyrim. Unfortunately the poem was lost long ago.
According to our histories keeper, the portion of the Edda dealing with King Olaf might still exist in Dead Men's Respite. I need you to retrieve the poem."

You are the best and the brightest warriors in Tamriel. Professional soldiers, fearless and devastating. The Emperor will be paying close attention to what happens here today. Men who distinguish themselves will be well rewarded.
Ready now! Everyone, with me! For the Empire! For the Legion!"

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim.
The quest-giver is called Silus Vesuius. Silus Vesuius is a man, who is located at Skyrim.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to retrieve the scattered pieces of Mehrunes' Razor for Silus Vesuius.
The player should first find Ghunzul, Drascua, and Jorgen, the owners of the pieces of Mehrunes' Razor to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Skyrim, a province.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: Silus Vesuius will pay the player.
The following characters are related to this quest: Ghunzul (a dangerous marauder, located at Skyrim), Drascua (a dangerous marauder, located at Skyrim), Jorgen (a man, located at Morthal), Mehrunes Dagon (the evil god of the Mythic Dawn).
The following items are related to this quest: Mehrunes' Razor (an artifact of Mehrunes Dagon).
The following groups are related to this quest: Mythic Dawn (an evil cult that wanted to destroy everything during the Oblivion crisis).
The following locations are related to this quest: Morthal (a city in Skyrim).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. After the Oblivion crisis, a number of groups cropped up dedicated to wiping out the remnants of the Mythic Dawn: one of the groups found Mehrunes' Razor and split it into three fragments almost 150 years ago. The descendants of the group still have the fragments of Mehrunes' Razor: Silus Vesuius gives the player his notes on the owners.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I have a job you look perfect for.
A little history, first. After the Oblivion Crisis, a number of groups cropped up dedicated to wiping out the remnants of the Mythic Dawn. One of these groups found Mehrunes' Razor, the artifact of Mehrunes Dagon. They split it into three fragments and pledged to keep them apart forever. That was almost 150 years ago, and the pieces are still being kept by the descendants of that group. And they're right here, in Skyrim.
At least two of the owners, Ghunzul and Drascua, are dangerous marauders. And the third owner, Jorgen, I only know he lives in Morthal.
Here are my notes about them. I'll gladly pay you for getting the pieces any way you can. No questions asked."

"I've been having difficulties with my heart stone experiments.
Have you heard of the Briarhearts? They are fierce warriors of the Forsworn tribes. They actually remove their own hearts, and replace them with large briar seeds. It puts their lifesparks in direct connection to the natural forces.
Well, I'm hoping to do something similar... if I could connect a living being to the forces of nature... well... that would be formidable. I've done some experiments in this area, but, well, my test subjects are far too fragile. I'm hoping to learn some of the Briarheart techniques, their methods.
I need you to examine one of them. Just investigate as much as you can. The Forsworn live in the hills on the western edge of Skyrim. From there, you're on your own. I'm given to understand that they are not difficult to find, if you gather my inference."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim.
The quest-giver is called Galmar Stone-Fist. Galmar Stone-Fist is the player's commanding officer in the Stormcloaks.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to deliver false orders to the Imperial Legate in Morthal.
The player should first convince an innkeeper to help you locate an Imperial runner, get the Imperial orders from the runner, and replace them with forgeries to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: an inn in Dragon Bridge or Rorikstead.
The following groups are related to this quest: Stormcloaks (rebel forces opposing the Empire).
The following locations are related to this quest: Morthal (a town), Dragon Bridge (a town), Rorikstead (a town).
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I Need you to deliver some false orders to the Imperial Legate in Morthal. But first we need to get our hands on some Imperial orders to make the forgeries.
The inns at Dragon Bridge and Rorikstead are frequent stops for Imperial runners. See if you can't "convince" one of those innkeepers to help you. One way or another, get me those documents.
Talos guide you."
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim.
The quest-giver is called Elmus. Elmus is a brewer, who is located at Thirsk Mead Hall.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to retrieve some juniper berries for Elmus.
The player should first find juniper berries to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Skyrim, a province.
The following locations are related to this quest: Thirsk Mead Hall (a mead hall on Solstheim), Solstheim (a remote island).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player helped Elmus and the others reclaim the Thirsk Mead Hall from monsters.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"We lost most of the mead batches we had brewing when... before those things were here. One is just ready to take its turn, though, and it's about time to add some of the flavorings.
You can't find them on Solstheim, but if you find yourself back in Skyrim, I wouldn't mind you bringing some juniper berries.
They add a different kind of sweetness. Tart. Makes the flavor more round."
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim.
The quest-giver is called Dinya Balu. Dinya Balu is a priestess of Mara.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to act as the hands of Mara in the world.
The player should first help Fastred with her fickle love to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Ivarstead, a village.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: the touch of Mara.
The following characters are related to this quest: Mara (the goddess of love), Fastred (a young woman, located at Ivarstead).
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I am devoted to the Goddess Mara, who gave mortals the gift of love that they might have a hint of eternity. Her blessings are many. To love is to know the true nature of the gods.
Not all can hear the broad echoes of deepest dawn. To receive the touch of Mara, you must first act as her hands in the world. Explore the facets of the infinite jewel. Are you prepared, then, to help bring the light across this land?
The dawn surely opens upon you, child. You must bear its light that all may see. Mara has reflected an image to me. A young woman... almost a girl... her fickle love must resolve itself. The village of Ivarstead. The woman, Fastred. This is the prayer heard by the goddess and relayed to her servants.
Return when Fastred has seen her path. I will entreat Mara on your behalf."
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim.
The quest-giver is called Valdr. Valdr is a hunter from Falkreath, who is located at outside Moss Mother Cavern.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to help Valdr avenge his fallen friends.
The player should first kill 3 Spriggans with Valdr to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Moss Mother Cavern, a dangerous cave.
The following characters are related to this quest: Ari (Valdr's dead hunter friend, a woman, located at Moss Mother Cavern), Niels (Valdr's dead hunter friend, a man, located at Moss Mother Cavern).
The player will encounter the following enemies during this quest: 3 Spriggans (hostile beasts).
The following locations are related to this quest: Falkreath (a town).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Valdr, Ari and Niels tracked a bear to Moss Mother Cavern: Spriggans appeared and killed Ari and Niels.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Name's Valdr. I hunt out of Falkreath.
We tracked a bear to this den, Moss Mother Cavern. Good coin for those pelts. We had the big sow cornered when they showed up. Three of them, out of nowhere. Spriggans.
Niels went down before we even knew to run. Ari died just inside. I never even thought the things were real. But now what? I can't just walk away. Not with my friends' bodies in there, being torn apart by those beasts.
You would help me clear out the Spriggans? You'd do that for a stranger? I don't know what to say. Lead on, I suppose."
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim.
The quest-giver is called Storn Crag-Strider. Storn Crag-Strider is a Skaal shaman.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to free the Skaal at the Wind Stone from control.
The player should first 1) learn the word of power that Miraak learned long ago, 2) use the word of power on the Wind Stone to complete their objective. These tasks can be completed in the following locations: 1) Saering's Watch(a dragon lair), 2) Wind Stone(a sacred stone of the Skaal).
The following characters are related to this quest: Miraak (a man).
The following groups are related to this quest: Skaal (a tribe of people).
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Our time here is running out. The few of us left free of control cannot protect ourselves for much longer.
You must go to Saering's Watch. Learn there the Word of Power that Miraak learned long ago, and use that knowledge on the Wind Stone.
You may be able to break the hold on our people there, and free them from control."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim.
The quest-giver is called J'zargo. J'zargo is a fellow mage student who is working hard on new spells.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to help J'zargo test his new spells.
The player should first use J'zargo's flame cloak scrolls against undead, and report back to J'zargo whether they work to complete their objective.
There are some important facts concerning this quest. J'zargo gives the player plenty of flame cloak scrolls.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Can you... can you possibly help J'zargo? You must be very skilled with magic, yes? J'zargo is working hard, but cannot do it alone.
J'zargo has worked hard on learning new spells, trying new things. This will make J'zargo stand out as a mage. But J'zargo works so hard, there is no time to test these new spells.
If you help with the testing, this will make learning easier. J'zargo will give you scrolls, you will use them and report the results. This is a good plan, no? Let's see... this one, I think. J'zargo has designed it to be an excellent flame cloak, with a twist. It is especially potent against the undead, and should burn them to a crisp in no time. J'zargo gives you plenty of these scrolls, so you try them and return when you can say whether they work."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim.
The quest-giver is called Sergius Turrianus. Sergius Turrianus is an enchanter at the College of Winterhold, who is located at College of Winterhold.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to bring an item from a client to Sergius Turrianus.
The player should first get the item from Sergius Turrianus' client to complete their objective.
The following locations are related to this quest: College of Winterhold (a school of mages).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player is a student at the College of Winterhold. Sergius Turrianus gives the player the name and the location of the client.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"There's more enchanting to be done. You can acquire whatever it is and bring it back here, and I'll take care of it.
Be quick about it, will you? This is a good way for the College to bring in some money.
Here's the name and location of the client."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim.
The quest-giver is called Laila Law-Giver. Laila Law-Giver is the noblewoman who rules over Riften, who is located at Riften.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to destroy the source of Skooma and report back to Laila Law-Giver.
The player should first go to the source of Skooma to complete their objective.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: the player will be on their way to a title in Riften.
The following characters are related to this quest: Sarthis (a male Skooma dealer).
The following items are related to this quest: Skooma (an illegal, dangerous drug).
The following locations are related to this quest: Riften (a city).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player raided Sarthis' warehouse and killed him for Laila Law-Giver: the player knows where the source of the Skooma is.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"It's nice to receive good news for a change. Did you recover anything else from the warehouse worth mentioning?
If you have discovered the source of Skooma, then there's no time to lose. It won't take long for Sarthis's associates to learn of his death. The source of the poison must be destroyed once and for all, otherwise another dealer will simply take his place.
Do this task for me and you'll be well on your way to a title in Riften. Report back to me when your task is complete."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim.
The quest-giver is called Gunmar. Gunmar is a fellow Dawnguard member.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to destroy a vampire.
The player should first visit the vampire's contact, and find out where the vampire is hiding to complete their objective.
The following groups are related to this quest: Dawnguard (an organization of vampire hunters).
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I've learned of a possible vampire.
And while I do not know its exact whereabouts, I do have information suggesting someone who does.
Pay a visit to the beast's last known contact. Do what you must to find where it's hiding now.
Then root out the monster, and destroy it."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim.
The quest-giver is called Falk Firebeard. Falk Firebeard is the Jarl's steward.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to investigate the reports of strange happenings near Wolfskull Cave.
The player should first clear out the Wolfskull Cave to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Wolfskull Cave, a cave that is said to be haunted because of Potema the Wolf Queen's necromantic rituals some 500 years ago.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: the player will be repaid.
The following characters are related to this quest: Potema the Wolf Queen (an infamous, feared, long-dead queen).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Falk Firebeard thinks that checking out the Wolfskull Cave is not worth his time with the war going on.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"There have been reports of weird happenings near Wolfskull Cave. Travelers disappearing, odd lights. I suspect wild animals or perhaps bandits.
The cave has a bad history. Long ago, Potema the Wolf Queen used it for necromantic rituals. That's where it got the name. That was over 500 years ago. Nothing much down there now - but everyone's always convinced the cave is haunted.
I don't think it's worth our time with the war going on, but if you want to clear out the cave, I'll make sure you're repaid for your work."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim.
The quest-giver is called Balgruuf the Greater. Balgruuf the Greater is a nobleman.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to find out why Nelkir has become brooding.
The player should first talk to Nelkir to complete their objective.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: Balgruuf the Greater would be grateful.
The following characters are related to this quest: Nelkir (Balgruuf the Greater's youngest son, a quiet boy).
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"My youngest son, Nelkir, is a dark child. I don't know what to do with him.
He was always a quiet lad, but lately... something has changed. He's become brooding. Violent. He won't say a word to me, but I don't know how I upset him.
If you could speak to him. Draw out the truth. I would be immensely grateful."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim.
The quest-giver is called Delphine. Delphine is a paranoid woman.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to locate Esbern, and ask where he was on the 30th of Frostfall.
The player should first talk to Brynjolf about finding Esbern to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Riften, a city.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: Esbern knows how to stop the dragons.
The following characters are related to this quest: Esbern (a paranoid man, located at Riften), Brynjolf (a 'well-connected' man, located at Riften).
The following groups are related to this quest: Thalmor (the player's enemies).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The Thalmor are also looking for Esbern.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"We've got to find Esbern in Riften before the Thalmor do. He'll know how to stop the dragons if anybody does. You'd better get to Riften. Talk to Brynjolf. He's... well-connected. A good starting point at least.
Oh, and when you find Esbern... if you think I'm paranoid... you may have some trouble getting him to trust you. Just ask him where he was on the 30th of Frostfall. He'll know what it means."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim.
The quest-giver is called Idgrod Ravencrone. Idgrod Ravencrone is the noblewoman who rules over Morthal, who is located at Morthal.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to investigate Hroggar's house fire.
The player should first find clues among the ashes to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Hroggar's house in Morthal.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: Idgrod Ravencrone will reward the player.
The following characters are related to this quest: Hroggar (a man who lusts after Alva, located at Morthal), Alva (a woman, located at Morthal).
The following locations are related to this quest: Morthal (a city).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Hroggar's wife and daughter died in the fire: Hroggar blames his wife for starting the fire because she spilled bear fat in the fireplace. Rumors say that Hroggar started the fire himself so that he could get together with Alva.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I want you to look into Hroggar's house fire. He lost his wife and daughter in the blaze. My people believe the house to be cursed now. Who am I to gainsay them?
How the fire started? Hroggar blames his wife for spilling bear fat in the fire. Many folk think he set the fire himself. Lust can make a man do the unthinkable. The ashes were still warm when he pledged himself to to a woman named Alva.
I can't arrest Hroggar on rumor and gossip. But you, a stranger, might find the truth for us. Sift through the ashes at Hroggar's house that others are too fearful to touch. See what they tell you.
Should you prove him guilty or innocent, I will reward you."
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim.
The quest-giver is called Gunmar. Gunmar is a fellow Dawnguard member.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to kill a vampire masquerading as a regular citizen without being accused of murder.
The player should first track down the vampire to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Solitude, a city.
The following groups are related to this quest: Dawnguard (an organization of vampire hunters).
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I've located the whereabouts of a vampire masquerading as a common citizen in Solitude. Track him down and dispose of him.
Vampires enjoy stalking their prey. Passing among us undetected emboldens them. Makes them feel powerful, untouchable. But we'll put a swift end to that.
Tread lightly. The vampire can cloud the minds of those he preys upon. It won't be easy to convince anyone he's other than he appears. The law is unaware of the danger and will treat you as a criminal if you are caught. You must be clever. Find a way not to be caught or accused of murder.
We must be vigilant and self sufficient if we are to defeat these monsters."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim.
The quest-giver is called Ulfric. Ulfric is the player's leader in the Stormcloaks, a man.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to make a delivery for Ulfric.
The player should first deliver an axe to Balgruuf the Greater to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Whiterun, a city.
The following characters are related to this quest: Balgruuf the Greater (the Jarl of Whiterun, a man who has stayed neutral in the war between the Stormcloaks and the Empire, located at Whiterun).
The following groups are related to this quest: Stormcloaks (rebel forces opposing the Empire).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. If Balgruuf the Greater keeps the axe, Ulfric will bide his time. If Balgruuf the Greater returns the axe to the player, it means war.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I'm glad you're here. I have a message I need delivered to the Jarl of Whiterun. Deliver this axe to Balgruuf the Greater.
Men who understand each other often have no need for words. There are but a few simple truths behind one warrior giving another his axe. Balgruuf will know my meaning.
Give the man my axe. If he keeps it, I will bide my time. If he returns it to you, it means war."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim.
The quest-giver is called Kerah. Kerah is a jeweler native to Markarth, who is located at Markarth.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to deliver a ring to Calcelmo for Kerah.
The player should first find Calcelmo to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Understone Keep, a keep in Markarth.
The following characters are related to this quest: Calcelmo (a male historian, located at Understone Keep).
The following locations are related to this quest: Markarth (a city of stone and silver).
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"My family came here centuries ago. We've made a good living smithing the silver that flows through the city. But you probably wanted to know about the fancy carvings and stonework, didn't you? Travelers always do.
Here, I have a delivery I need to make to Calcelmo in Understone Keep. Why don't you take the ring to him? He knows the history of Markarth better than anyone. He can be a bit difficult, but I'm sure he'll appreciate your help."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim.
The quest-giver is called Calcelmo. Calcelmo is a stressful man, and the most recognized scholar on the Dwemer in all of Tamriel.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to kill Nimhe.
The player should first locate Nimhe to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Nchuand-Zel, Calcelmo's excavation site.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: access to Nchuand-Zel and Calcelmo's Dwemer museum.
The player will encounter the following enemies during this quest: Nimhe, Poisoned One (a giant, poisonous spider).
The following groups are related to this quest: Dwemer (an extinct, ancient race of people).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player asked Calcelmo to let the player inside his Dwemer museum: the Dwemer museum is a private place where Calcelmo can catalog his research.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"You idiot. Do you even know who I am? The most recognized scholar on the Dwemer in all of Tamriel, and you people keep bothering me!
I... I'm sorry I... I got too excited. I'm in the middle of some very... stressful work, and I shouldn't have yelled. How can I help you?
You want to access my Dwemer museum? It's a private place where I can catalog my research. Occasionally, the nobles will come in and have questions, but that's thankfully rare.
I'll let you in if you agree to something for me. There's a giant spider in Nchuand-Zel, my excavation site. My workers call her 'Nimhe', the Poisoned One. If you deal with Nimhe, I'll let you into both the excavation site and my Dwemer Museum. What do you say?"
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim.
The quest-giver is called Amren. Amren is Saffir's husband, who is located at Whiterun.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to retrieve Amren's father's sword for Amren.
The player should first find Amren's father's sword to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Halted Stream Camp, a bandit hideout.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: Amren would be grateful.
The following characters are related to this quest: Saffir (a woman, located at Whiterun).
The following locations are related to this quest: Whiterun (a city).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Saffir doesn't like that Amren has been spending so much time looking for his father's old sword.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I'm Amren, the husband of Saffir.
My Saffir doesn't like that I've been spending so much time looking for my father's old sword. He fed his entire family with the gold he made using that weapon. I'm not about to let it gather dust in some thief's trophy room.
I tracked it to a group of bandits nearby. The place is called Halted Stream Camp. But I'm no fool. I'd need the Whiterun guards or maybe hire some mercenaries to get it. I don't know why I'm saying this, but if you find it out in your travels, I'd be grateful to you."
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim.
The quest-giver is called Modyn Veleth. Modyn Veleth is captain of the Redoran guard, who is located at Raven Rock.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to tell Modyn Veleth the location of a hidden stash of Emberbrand Wine.
The player should first locate the hidden stash of Emberbrand Wine to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: not in the Bulwark, one of the abandoned houses on the outskirts of Raven Rock.
The following items are related to this quest: Emberbrand Wine (a powerful and addicting alcohol drink).
The following groups are related to this quest: Redoran (a noble house that rules over Raven Rock).
The following locations are related to this quest: Raven Rock (a frontier town).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Modyn Veleth's men have been stashing bottles of Emberbrand Wine: it distracts them from their tasks.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Modyn Veleth, Captain of the Redoran Guard at your service. Looking for something to lend a hand with? We have problems aplenty in Raven Rock.
Commanding the Redoran Guard can be a difficult task. Even the most experienced warriors can fall prey to petty distractions. They usually didn't amount to much, but they make my job that much harder. Some of my own men have become quite accustomed to a spirit they called 'Emberbrand Wine.' Despise the stuff myself. It's powerful and tremendously addicting... I've seen men fail to finish even a single flask.
If I knew where they were stashing the bottles, I'd put an end to it myself. Could you track down the stash? That would be helpful. I just don't have time to do it myself right now.
They're too smart to have left it in the Bulwark. I'd search one of the abandoned houses on the outskirts of town."
<|endoftext|>

The quest-giver is the flesh sculptor.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to change your appearance.
The player should first give 1,000 gold to the flesh sculptor for her services to complete their objective.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: a new appearance.
The following items are related to this quest: 1,000 gold.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Are you interested in my services? I warn you, my skills do not come cheaply.
Hmm, I suppose I can work with your face. After all, the sculptor cannot always choose the finest clay.
Shall I remake your face?  It is no small thing to submit yourself to the flesh sculptor's knife. Just give me 1,000 gold and tell me what you desire - beauty or hideous deformity, nothing is beyond my skill."

I personally trained a whole litter for the Jarl. That reminds me, I was going to deliver some dog food to the Keep. Spiced beef. Their favorite.
You volunteer to make trip and deliver the food? Well, look at you, thanks. Take it to Voada, she handles all the dogs for the Jarl."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim.
The quest-giver is called Dengeir of Stuhn. Dengeir of Stuhn is a descendant of Vighar, who is located at Falkreath.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to destroy Vighar.
The player should first find Vighar to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Bloodlet Throne, a nest of vampires.
The following characters are related to this quest: Vighar (a male vampire, located at Bloodlet Throne).
The following locations are related to this quest: Falkreath (a town).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. There is an open grave in Falkreath graveyard: Vighar broke free from the grave. Dengeir of Stuhn's family is entrusted with keeping Vighar buried: somebody stole the wardstone that kept Vighar in the grave.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"You may have seen the open grave in our graveyard. Most of the townsfolk think it's the work of a corpse thief. The truth is less pleasant. It is...was, the grave of Vighar, my own ancestor, dead for centuries now.
Vighar is a vampire. My family is entrusted with keeping him buried, but recently someone stole the wardstone that sealed him in the grave, and Vighar escaped. It's too late for the wardstone. Vighar must be destroyed. If this gets out, my family will suffer great shame.
See that Vighar is destroyed. He will have fled to gather others of his kind at Bloodlet Throne."
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim.
The quest-giver is called Neloth. Neloth is a wizard, who is located at Solstheim.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to bring a Heart Stone to Neloth.
The player should first find a Heart Stone to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Solstheim, an island.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: Neloth pays the player.
The following items are related to this quest: Heart Stones (magical stones).
The following locations are related to this quest: Red Mountain (an active volcano).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Every time the Red Mountain belches, more of Heart Stones land on Solstheim: the player may need to pick away at stone to pry the Heart Stone.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I'm running low on Heart Stones. If you have any with you, I'll buy one. Otherwise, I can tell you where you might find one.
Every time the Red Mountain belches, more of them land here on Solstheim. Look around for impact craters, exposed rock, that sort of thing. You may need to pick away at it to pry the heart stone itself loose, but you look... strong.
Good luck."

The following characters are related to this quest: Torygg (Elisif the Fair's dead husband), Talos (the hero-god of humans).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Talos worship is outlawed in the Empire: when they buried Torygg, Elisif the Fair made offerings to all the gods except Talos.

"There's something... personal... I was hoping you would do for me.

I would like you to take an item of his, a war horn handed down from his father, and place it at a Shrine of Talos.

"The Key! You have the Skeleton Key! I never thought I'd see it again.
You've done the Guild a great deed. And although they may not show it, I'm certain they appreciate your sacrifices. My only regret is that you had to undertake this task alone.
Nothing would bring me more pride than to return the Key, but I'm afraid it's impossible. From the moment I arrived here, I've felt myself... well... dying.
I'm afraid you have return the Key alone. I'm weakening, and I can feel myself slipping away. The years without restoration of my power have taken their toll. Whatever damage has been caused can only be corrected by following the Pilgrim's Path to the Ebonmere and replacing the Key.
The only possible help I've come across are the remains of some poor fellow who was trying to follow in your footsteps. Perhaps his journal can help?"

"I am Jiub. Some call me Saint Jiub. Others call me Jiub the Eradicator. Perhaps you've heard of me?
If you haven't, I can't say that I am surprised. Until I get my second volume published, no one will ever know of my achievements. In order to write the second volume of my opus, I need the notes from my first volume. Otherwise I need to do all of this from memory.
When I was tossed in here I felt myself falling… and I dropped the pages I had been holding. There were ten of them in all.
Find them for me, please, I beg you!"

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim.
The quest-giver is called Heddic Volunnar. Heddic Volunnar is a scholar, giving quest via "Heddic's Volunruud Notes", who is located at Volunruud.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to unlock the burial chamber of Tongue Chieftain Kvenel.
The player should first find the two hidden keys to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Volunruud, an ancient tomb.
The following characters are related to this quest: Tongue Chieftain Kvenel (an ancient warrior, and a forefather of Heddic Volunnar).
The following items are related to this quest: "Heddic's Volunruud Notes" (notes on Heddic Volunnar's research on Volunruud), Okin and Eduj (favored weapons when Tongue Chieftain Kvenel went into battle).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Heddic Volunnar is scouting out Volunruud: the relief not far from the entrance hides Tongue Chieftain Kvenel's tomb. The two hidden keys to Tongue Chieftain Kvenel's tomb are ceremonial replicas of Okin and Eduj.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Heddic's Volunruud Notes
by Heddic Volunnar

I was skeptical, but it's obvious now. The old hymns had truth to them! The relief wasn't far from the entrance, just as they said. I've no doubt now that it hides the entrance to Kvenel's tomb.
The two keys must be hidden somewhere nearby - ceremonial replicas of Okin and Eduj, favored weapons when Kvenel went into battle. I don't dare explore further without hiring bodyguards to accompany me, however. To think - The Tongue Chieftain Kvenel could be entombed behind just a few feet of stone! The ancestor we scarcely believed was real.
Twice damned for planning this foolish scouting trip. I should have hired those sellswords in the first place. Perhaps there's no need. This place is just a tomb, after all, and there are no obvious signs of habitation. It isn't as though the thousand-year dead will mind if I have a look around."
<|endoftext|>

There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player looks at the Dwemer lockbox with Septimus Signus. Dwemer blood can unlock the Dwemer lockbox: the blood of Altmer, Bosmer, Dunmer, Falmer, and Orsimer, can be used instead.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"You see this masterwork of the Dwemer. Deep inside their greatest knowings. Septimus is clever among men, but he is but an idiot child compared to the dullest of the Dwemer.
To harness it is to know. The fundaments. The Dwemer lockbox hides it from me. I see it now. The sealing structure interlocks in the tiniest fractals. Dwemer blood can loose the hooks, but none alive remain to bear it. A panoply of their brethren could gather to form a facsimile. A trick. Something they didn't anticipate, no, not even them.
The blood of Altmer, Bosmer, Dunmer, Falmer, and Orsimer. The elves still living provide the key. Bear you hence this extractor. It will drink the fresh blood of elves. Come when its set is complete."

You could get Horgeir's stash for me, but I'll keep my dagger sharpened just in case. You can help yourself to any drink you find, but bring me the bottle of Dragon's Breath Mead. It's his favorite, so I know he has one there."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim.
The quest-giver is called Tsun. Tsun is Shor's shield-thane, and the guardian of the Whalebone Bridge, who is located at Sovngarde.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to go over the Whalebone Bridge to the Hall of Valor.
The player should first complete Tsun's warrior's test to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Sovngarde, the storied underworld of heroic souls.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: the player will be allowed to pass the Whalebone Bridge.
The following characters are related to this quest: Alduin, World Eater (a dragon who is eating the souls of Sovngarde, located at Sovngarde), Shor (the chief of the gods, located at Sovngarde).
The following locations are related to this quest: Whalebone Bridge (a perilous bridge), Hall of Valor (Shor's lofty hall).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Tsun judges which heroic souls are allowed to go to the Hall of Valor. The player pursues Alduin: Shor did not let the heroic, angry souls of Sovngarde to attack Alduin.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I am Tsun, shield-thane to Shor. The Whalebone Bridge he bade me guard and winnow all those souls whose heroic end sent them here, to Shor's lofty hall where welcome, well earned, awaits those I judge fit to join that fellowship of honor.
You pursue Alduin, the World Eater. A fateful errand. No few have chafed to face the Worm since first he set his soul-snare here at Sovngarde's threshold. But Shor restrained our wrathful onslaught - perhaps, deep counseled, your doom he foresaw.
Living or dead, by decree of Shor, none may pass this perilous bridge 'till I judge them worthy by the warrior's test."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim.
The quest-giver is called Gabriella. Gabriella is a fellow member of the Dark Brotherhood.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to assassinate Gaius Maro, and implicate him in a plot to kill the Emperor.
The player should first go to Dragon Bridge, observe Gaius Maro's departure, follow him, waylay him in one of the major cities, kill him, and plant the false evidence on his body to complete their objective.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: Olava's token as a bonus, if the player does not kill Gaius Maro in Dragon Bridge, or on the road.
The following characters are related to this quest: Astrid (the player's female guildleader in the Dark Brotherhood), Gaius Maro (the son of Commander Maro, a member of the Penitus Oculatus), Olava the Feeble (Gabriella's old female friend, and a powerful seer, located at Whiterun), Commander Maro (the man who leads the Penitus Oculatus, and handles the Emperor's security).
The following groups are related to this quest: Penitus Oculatus (the Emperor's security service), Dark Brotherhood (a guild of assassins).
The following locations are related to this quest: Skyrim (a province of the Empire), Dragon Bridge (a town in Skyrim), Whiterun (a city).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Astrid sent the player to Gabriella. The Emperor will arrive in Skyrim: the Penitus Oculatus will need to begin its preparations immediately. Astrid and Gabriella have devised a plan to break Commander Maro and cripple the Emperor's protection. Gaius Maro is set to leave the Penitus Oculatus outpost at Dragon Bridge, and inspect the security of each city in Skyrim. Olava's token is to be given to Olava the Feeble for a reading of the player's future.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Dear sibling. I've been waiting for you. Your next contract awaits, as I'm sure Astrid indicated.
With the Emperor's arrival in Skyrim now a certainty, his security service, the Penitus Oculatus, will need to begin its preparations immediately. Security is being handled by a Commander Maro. Astrid and I have devised a plan to break the man, and in doing so, cripple the Emperor's protection.
You are to slay the commander's son, Gaius Maro, and once he is dead, plant false evidence on his body implicating him in a plot to kill the Emperor. He is set to leave the Penitus Oculatus outpost at Dragon Bridge, and inspect the security of each city in Skyrim. Go there now. Observe Gaius Maro's departure, and follow him. Waylay him in one of the cities, and send his soul to Sithis. Once he's dead, plant the incriminating letter on his body, and let fate take care of the rest. Oh, and one final thing...
To earn your bonus, do not kill Gaius Maro in Dragon Bridge, or on the road. Kill him in one of the other major cities he'll be visiting. There, the body will be discovered quickly, as will the letter implicating Gaius Maro in the plot to assassinate the Emperor. Do that, and Astrid has authorized me to grant you a rather unique bonus. It is a special token, to be given to Olava the Feeble, in Whiterun. Olava is an old and dear friend, and a powerful seer. The token entitles you to a reading of your future. It's an opportunity one should not pass up."
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim.
The quest-giver is called Wilhelm. Wilhelm is an innkeeper, who is located at Ivarstead.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to investigate Shroud Hearth Barrow.
The player should first go to the barrow to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Shroud Hearth Barrow, a haunted barrow on the east side of Ivarstead.
The following characters are related to this quest: Wyndelius (a male treasure hunter).
The following locations are related to this quest: Ivarstead (a town).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Wyndelius went into Shroud Hearth Barrow two years ago: Wilhelm warned him not to go in there. Wyndelius was never seen again.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"If I were you, I'd keep away from the barrow on the east side of town...
There ain't much more to tell... it's haunted and you should stay away. Look, I've seen one of the spirits with my very own eyes. When it glared at me, I swear it burned right through my soul.
Fortunately, the spirits seem to be sticking to the barrow. I think they're guarding it. Certainly isn't helping my business any; who'd want to rent a room anywhere near a haunted barrow?
If you think there's anything you can do, be my guest. About a year or two ago, some fella named Wyndelius came through; said he was some kind of a treasure hunter. I warned him not to go in there, just like I warned you. The very next night we heard screams from the barrow, and that was it. We never saw him again."

The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: Inge Six Fingers will teach the player a few tricks.
The following characters are related to this quest: Finn (a famous male bard).

The following locations are related to this quest: Bards College (a college for bards).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Thieves broke into the Bards College and made off with a lot of valuable things: Finn's Lute included. Finn invented the eight course lute that is commonplace today.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Hmm? Oh, sorry. My mind wanders sometimes. I was just thinking about Finn's Lute.
Over a year ago, thieves broke into the College and made off with a lot of valuable things. Mostly gold and silver. But they also stole Finn's Lute. We just learned where the bandits fled to, and I very much want that lute back. They are at Stony Creek Cave.
Finn was the bard who invented the eight course lute that is commonplace today. Until he found a way to string the extra courses, bards only had six course lutes. The lute they stole is Finn's original eight course lute. I doubt they even realize its true value.
There is no way I can pay you what this Lute is worth. But I can teach you a few tricks I've learned over the years."

Sadly, this forge is dying and I've used the last of my fire salts. If I can't feed it soon, it may grow cold. Ten pinches of fire salts should give me all I need to bring this forge back to life.
Could you get the fire salts for me? I know that they are hard to come by, but they would save my business and warm an old smith's heart."

This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:

The Companions have been asked for assistance, and we shall answer. Particularly when the pay is as good as this.
Get moving. Find the kidnapped citizen at Faldar's Tooth and save them. I shudder to think what might happen if you're too late.
Bring honor to the Companions and yourself."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim.
The quest-giver is called Erikur. Erikur is an angry merchant.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to frame Captain Volf by planting some contraband.
The player should first 1) get some Balmora Blue from Sabine Nyette, 2) plant the Balmora Blue in Captain Volf's footlocker to complete their objective. These tasks can be completed in the following locations: 1) down by the docks, 2) Dainty Sload(Captain Volf's ship).
The following characters are related to this quest: Delvin (the player's male superior in the Thieves Guild), Captain Volf (a male sea captain, located at ashore), Sabine Nyette (the female first mate of the Red Wave, located at down by the docks).
The following items are related to this quest: Balmora Blue (an illegal drug).
The following groups are related to this quest: Thieves Guild (a guild of thieves).
The following locations are related to this quest: Red Wave (a ship).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Delvin sent the player to Erikur. Captain Volf neglected to honor a trade agreement between him and Erikur.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"It's about time you got here. I'm not accustomed to dealing with people who are unreliable. That's why I asked Delvin to send me his best.
Nothing raises my ire more than having an agreement broken. It's bad for business and it wastes time. Captain Volf of the Dainty Sload has decided to test my patience on this matter by neglecting to honor a trade agreement we had established.
I need you to help me show him the error of his ways by sneaking on board the Sload and planting some contraband. You'll need to get your hands on some Balmora Blue from Sabine Nyette down by the docks. She's the first mate on another ship, the Red Wave.
Once you get your hands on it, I want you to plant it in Captain Volf's footlocker. I'll take care of the rest. Captain Volf is ashore right now and I want the authorities waiting for him when he gets back.
Now get going... I don't want to see your face until the job's done."

The player should first ask the Greybeards hold a peace council to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: High Hrothgar, the secluded home of the Greybeards, and neutral territory to both sides of the war.

The following groups are related to this quest: Greybeards (an order of respected, wise old men).
The following locations are related to this quest: Whiterun (a city).

This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I want to help you, Dragonborn. And I will. But I need your help first.
Ulfric and General Tullius are both just waiting for me to make a wrong move. Do you think they will sit idle while a dragon is slaughtering my men and burning my city? No. I can't risk weakening the city while we are under the threat of enemy attack. I'm sorry.
If only you could negotiate a truce between Ulfric and General Tullius. Then I would be glad to help you with your mad dragon-trapping scheme. But getting both sides to agree to a truce will be difficult at this point. The bitterness has gone too deep. Maybe... hmm... what of the Greybeards? They are respected by everyone. High Hrothgar is neutral territory. If the Greybeards were willing to host a peace council... then maybe Ulfric and Tullius would have to listen."
