This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim.
The quest-giver is called Astrid. Astrid is the leader of the Dark Brotherhood.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to assassinate Titus Mede II while disguised as the Gourmet.
The player should first present the Gourmet's writ of passage to Commander Maro to gain unrestricted access to the kitchens, and poison Titus Mede II's meal with Jarrin Root to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Castle Dour, a castle in Solitude.
The following characters are related to this quest: Gourmet (a famous male chef), Commander Maro (the male officer in charge of Titus Mede II's security, located at Castle Dour), Titus Mede II (the Emperor, located at Castle Dour).
The following items are related to this quest: Jarrin Root (a powerful poison that kills immediately after one bite).
The following groups are related to this quest: Dark Brotherhood (a guild of assassins).
The following locations are related to this quest: Solitude (a large city).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player killed the Gourmet for Astrid: the player is the Listener of the Dark Brotherhood. Astrid gives the player Jarrin Root. After assassination, escape through the upper door, and across the bridge: Astrid has "arranged" for it to be unguarded.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"So it's done. You've killed the Gourmet. And now Titus Mede II is as good as dead.
I've decided you will have the honor of killing the Emperor. Go now to Castle Dour in Solitude. Present the Gourmet's Writ of Passage to the officer in charge, Commander Maro.
You'll gain unrestricted access to the kitchens, and then the Emperor. You're posing as a chef, so you'll be able to poison his meal rather easily. Here, take this - it's called jarrin root. All it takes is one taste, and the effects are quite immediate. The Emperor will be serving Sithis before he even knows he's dead. Once Mede has been killed, escape through the upper door, and across the bridge. I've "arranged" for it to be unguarded once the alarm is sounded.
Now go, my friend. Go, and fulfill your destiny as Listener."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim.
The quest-giver is called Habd. Habd is a retired sailor, giving quest via "Habd's Journal".
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to uncover the tragic events inside Frostflow Lighthouse.
The player should first investigate the cellar to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Frostflow Lighthouse, an old lighthouse on an icy coast.
The following characters are related to this quest: Ramati (Habd's wife, a former sailor), Sudi (a woman, Ramati and Habd's daughter), Mani (a man, Ramati and Habd's son).
The following items are related to this quest: "Habd's Journal" (Habd's journal).
The following locations are related to this quest: Hammerfell (a realm), Solstheim (an island).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Habd and Ramati sailed for years from Hammerfell to Solstheim and back: Habd and Ramati bought Frostflow Lighthouse to settle down with Mani and Sudi. Things went missing from the cellar and strange noises came from there as well. Habd went away from Frostflow Lighthouse to buy some traps: after returning home, he found out that Ramati was killed by a bug-like creature; Habd killed the creature and went into the cellar to save his family, locking the door behind him.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Habd's Journal
by Habd

After years of sailing from Hammerfell to Solstheim and back, Ramati and I have finally saved enough money to buy that old light house we spotted on the coast and we are moving in next month.
These northerners really know how to live. It may be cold, but you can't beat the tranquility of the watching icebergs to live out your silver years. Ramati loves the place too, despite the occasional leaky ceiling. Mani and Sudi, unfortunately, seem miserable here; I know the kids are old enough to strike out on their own, but I hope they'll grow to love the peace and quiet here as I have.
Mani and Sudi continue to bicker and harass each other and they seem to have started in on their mother as well. Ramati keeps finding things missing from the cellar. Sudi said she heard a noise down there but Mani just thinks their mother is going mad from isolation. The very thought of it is ridiculous, she's always wanted to retire here!
Sudi keeps saying that she hears scratching coming from the cellar at night. I think she's just trying to get her mother's goat, but I'd better head into town to get a few traps just in case it's rats. Should only take a couple days. I just hope those two go easy on Ramati while I'm gone.
Oh gods. Oh gods why? I returned home to find my beautiful Ramati killed and this thing, this horrible bug-like creature ransacking our home. I managed to kill the damned thing, I think it might be a demon! I've never seen anything like it! Oh gods poor Ramati. It must have come out of the cellar. I'm going down there and locking the door behind me to make sure they don't escape. I don't know if I'll make it out, but I have to save my family!"
<|endoftext|>

We were supposed to find a sacrifice. Human sacrifice. I told her I couldn't do it and she attacked me. I've done horrible things living here, but never taken an innocent life. The following characters are related to this quest: Gratian Caerellius (the great-grandfather of Crescius Caerellius, who worked for the East Empire Company).
The following groups are related to this quest: East Empire Company (a merchant house).
The following locations are related to this quest: Raven Rock (a struggling town).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The East Empire Company swept something big under the rug two centuries ago: it killed Gratian Caerellius and ruined the Raven Rock Mine. Crescius Caerellius and his wife found Gratian Caerellius' things in their home: an unsent letter to the East Empire Company, and a key to the locked off section of the Raven Rock Mine.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Who in the blazes are you?! Can't you see I'm busy? Or, perhaps you could help me. Hmph, maybe. Been difficult trusting people lately, they think I'm crazy.
Mark my words, these mines hold a secret that could put Raven Rock back on the map. A secret the East Empire Company swept under the rug two centuries ago. It killed my great-grandfather, Gratian Caerellius, and left Raven Rock with a worthless and tainted mine.
East Empire Company called it "a terrible accident", claiming that he was lost in a rockfall, but I know better. My wife and I were cleaning out our home, and we came across some of my great-grandfather's things locked in an old chest. I found an unsent letter he'd written to the East Empire Company, and a key.
The letter describes a discovery that was made in the mine by some of the diggers. They wanted Gratian to take a closer look. The East Empire Company must have felt it was of great value, as they locked that section of the mine off from everyone else. I assume the key unlocks that section of the mine. I haven't been able to find the entrance.
I'm telling you... there's something big down there, something that the East Empire Company wanted to hide from everyone."
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim.
The quest-giver is called Ebony Warrior. Ebony Warrior is a man who has done all that can be done, who is located at the Ebony Warrior's last vigil.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to fight the Ebony Warrior.
The player should first locate the Ebony Warrior to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: the Ebony Warrior's last vigil.
The following locations are related to this quest: Sovngarde (the afterlife of heroes).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Only the player can send the Ebony Warrior to Sovngarde.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I am the Ebony Warrior. I have come to challenge you to a fight.
I have done all that can be done. There is nothing left. No quests to be undertaken. No villains to be slain. No challenges to face.
Except for you. You are my last challenge. Only you can send me to Sovngarde with honor.
Make your preparations. When you are ready, come find me at my last vigil."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim.
The quest-giver is called Deor Woodcutter. Deor Woodcutter is a Skaal man in a bad mood.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to find Baldor Iron-Shaper.
The player should first search for any sign of Baldor to complete their objective.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: the Skaal would be grateful.
The following characters are related to this quest: Baldor Iron-Shaper (a Skaal man, the only blacksmith in the Skaal village).
The following items are related to this quest: Stalhrim (a strange metal).
The following groups are related to this quest: Skaal (a secluded tribe of hospitable people).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Baldor Iron-Shaper is the keeper of an ancient tradition, the forging of Stalhrim. Deor Woodcutter saw two elves in the far distance, dragging something behind them in the woods on the day Baldor Iron-Shaper disappeared: the elves went south and west.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I am in no mood to talk, outsider. One of the Skaal has gone missing. It is Baldor Iron-Shaper. As our only smith, Baldor is very important to the village.
Baldor is the keeper of an ancient tradition, the forging of Stalhrim. It is an art we Skaal hold sacred. If someone wanted to make such weapons, they would have to get that knowledge from Baldor.
I did see something in the woods on the day he disappeared. I saw two elves in the far distance, dragging something behind them. Hunters often visit our lands, so I thought little of it.
The elves went south and west. If your road takes you that way, perhaps you could search for any sign of Baldor. The Skaal would be grateful."

You would fight longer, feel stronger, that sort of thing. At least I think it will. Probably. Almost certainly. Of course, you never can tell.
Now stand still... it's my first time casting this spell, and I don't need any additional distractions."

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim.
The quest-giver is called Anonymous. Anonymous is an investigator from the College of Winterhold, giving quest via "Midden Incident Report".
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to complete a summoning ritual in the Midden.
The player should first find the 4 rings needed in the ritual to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Arcanaeum, the library in the College of Winterhold.
The following items are related to this quest: "Midden Incident Report" (a report), Deadric Relic (a large, segmented sculpture of a gauntlet, with the Daedric sigil 'O' emblazoned upon the palm), 4 rings.
The following locations are related to this quest: Midden (a sewer system underneath the College of Winterhold), College of Winterhold (a college for mages).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Anonymous found the missing students of the College of Winterhold dead in the Midden: they were attempting a summoning ritual well beyond their capabilities. The Deadric Relic in the Midden is related to the students' death: Anonymous pried 4 rings from the Deadric Relic.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Midden Incident Report
by Anonymous

The missing students were found in the Midden this morning. Dead, as expected. None of us bothered keeping a detect life charm for the search at this point.
The bodies were found together, each suffering the same deformities; peeled and bubbling skin on the arms and face. Conjurer's burn, as it's commonly referred to around the College. There's little doubt they were attempting a summoning ritual well beyond their capabilities.
The relic nearby put any doubt in this theory to rest. I admit that I've never seen one like it - a large, segmented sculpture of a gauntlet, the Daedric sigil 'O' emblazoned upon the palm. Attempts to move it were in vain. I must show it to the Archmage during his upcoming visit. Perhaps he will know more.
While we couldn't move the relic, I was able to pry four "rings" from it. I'm sure there's a connection between them and the ritual the students were attempting.
I'll store these in the Arcanaeum until we can consult with a conjuration master to learn more."
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim.
The quest-giver is called Brynjolf. Brynjolf is a fellow member of the Thieves Guild.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to search for clues about Mercer Frey's whereabouts.
The player should first break into Mercer Frey's house to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Riftweald Manor, Mercer Frey's home in Riften, a gift from the Black-Briars after they kicked the previous family out.
The following characters are related to this quest: Mercer Frey (a male guildmaster of the Thieves Guild who betrayed the Thieves Guild), Vald (a male lowlife, located at Riftweald Manor).
The following groups are related to this quest: Thieves Guild (a guild of thieves), Black-Briars (a powerful crime family).
The following locations are related to this quest: Riften (a city in Skyrim), Skyrim (a province).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Mercer Frey never stays at Riftweald Manor: he hired Vald to guard Riftweald Manor. The player has the permission to kill anyone who stands in their way.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I have an important task for you. I need you to break into Mercer Frey's home and search for anything that could tell us where he's gone.
Mercer's house is in Riften. A gift from the Black-Briars after they kicked the previous family out... a place called Riftweald Manor. He never stays there, just pays for the upkeep on it. Hired some lout by the name of Vald to guard the place.
Be careful, kid. This is the last place in Skyrim I'd ever want to send you. Just find a way in, get the information and leave. And you have permission to kill anyone that stands in your way."

The player should first find a copy of 'The Last Scabbard of Akrash' to complete their objective.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: Ghorza gra-Bagol teaches the player smithing.
The following characters are related to this quest: Tacitus (a young Imperial man, and Ghorza gra-Bagol's apprentice).
The following items are related to this quest: 'The Last Scabbard of Akrash' (a book on smithing).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Tacitus is not learning smithing by example: Ghorza gra-Bagol thinks that 'The Last Scabbard of Akrash' could help him learn.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"You'd think an apprentice could forge a few hinges. Not Tacitus. I keep showing him how to treat the iron, but he never gets it.
In the Legion, the Imperial smiths used to read books when they couldn't set their hammers straight. Wisdom of the old, I guess. If you find a book called 'The Last Scabbard of Akrash', could you bring it to me? Tacitus sure isn't learning by example.
Books. Don't know why the Imperials like them so much. It should help the boy, though, Malacath willing. Bring the book, and I'll show you how an Orc learns to smith."

My spirit has haunted this place ever since, bound here by the weight of my sins, hoping for vengeance. But they perished elsewhere, beyond my reach, even though they are now spirits as well. ""Blair's Notes"
by Blair

It was in the ice. Who knows how long? But it wasn't dead. And now it's hiding, here somewhere... in one of us. We found it in Bennings, but then Fuchs disappeared. It's still here, and it's looking for a way out. If it gets out into the world, it can infect everyone, everywhere. Three years, at most. Gods forgive us for what we've set loose upon the world."

The quest-giver is called Guardian of Mana. Guardian of Mana is a powerful spirit, who is located at Riftkeep.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to leave Riftkeep with the Guardian of Mana.
The player should first enter the portal to Zeryphesh that the Guardian of Mana opens for you to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Riftkeep, a fortress.
The following locations are related to this quest: Zeryphesh (a city).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player freed Guardian of Mana from her enslavement by beating some sense into her.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Stop. Enough. You have freed me from my enslavement and I am myself once more!
We must leave this place. I will open a portal for you, to Zeryphesh."

The player should first return the Glyph of Balthazar to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Wellspring Basin, a temple.
The following items are related to this quest: Glyph of Balthazar (an artifact that has power over water).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Edovar stole the Glyph of Balthazar from the Wellspring Basin: he died while trying to use the Glyph of Balthazar and was trapped drowning forever.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I am merely spirit, but I mean you no harm. In life, I was an ambitious thief, and I thought I was invincible. My greatest achievement was when I stole the Glyph of Balthazar from the Wellspring Basin. I thought I could master its power over water, but I was very, very wrong.
Now I am trapped here in eternal torment, drowning forever, unable to rectify my mistake. Will you return the Glyph of Balthazar to the Wellspring Basin, and set my spirit free at last?"

The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to see whether the Rift is closed; if not, close it.
The player should first find the Rift to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Gravedeep, a pit mine in the Sundered Battlefield.
The following items are related to this quest: Rift (a hole between this world and the world of evil, powerful demons).
The following locations are related to this quest: Sundered Battlefield (an ancient battlefield).
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Listen: If you're headed out to the Sundered Battlefield, there's something you should know. We were surveying out there, and discovered some kind of... hole, in thin air, in the pit mine we've been calling Gravedeep. The hole is very small, right now, but we could see things inside... powerful things, but horrible. Malign.
If you're going out there, see if you can find the hole. If we're lucky, it disappeared. But, if not, you should do your best to find a way to close it, before the things we saw get through!"

The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to bring 12 Ember Truffles to Clive.
The player should first gather 12 Ember Truffles to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Muckery, a fungal cave.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: Super Mana Potion (a potion).
The following items are related to this quest: Ember Truffles (Ember-infused mushrooms).
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I'm a botanist, serving the Empire by gathering various Ember-infused plants.  And I've found a virtual treasure trove of Ember Truffles, down in the Muckery... but some of them have already attained sentience, and that's making it difficult for me to gather them.
If you can bring me, say, a dozen Ember Truffles, I'll keep ten for the Empire, and I'll use the other two to make a Super Mana Potion for you.
Do we have a deal?"

This is an RPG quest from Torchlight II.
The quest-giver is called Malik Vosh. Malik Vosh is a friendly Zeraphi nobleman, who is located at Zeryphesh.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to prevent the Ezrohir from interrogating Commander Muzaffar.
The player should first rescue Commander Muzaffar from the Ezrohir, before they take him to Riftkeep to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Ossean Wastes, a large desert.
The following characters are related to this quest: Commander Muzaffar (the military leader of the Zeraphi, captured by the Ezrohir, located at Ossean Wastes).
The following groups are related to this quest: Ezrohir (a hostile race of people who are at war with Zeraphi), Zeraphi (a race of people).
The following locations are related to this quest: Zeryphesh (a large city inhabited by the Zeraphi), Riftkeep (the stronghold of the Ezrohir).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The Ezrohir are preparing to assault Zeryphesh.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Greetings, my friend! Welcome to Zeryphesh! I am Malik Vosh. I speak for the Zeraphi.
As you know, the Ezrohir are preparing to assault our city. Our military leader, Commander Muzaffar, has apparently been captured by the Ezrohir, out in the Ossean Wastes. They'll have sent for soldiers to take their prisoners back to their stronghold. Once they get him to Riftkeep, they'll identify him quickly enough, and then they'll interrogate him until they know everything about our defenses.
I believe you're going out to the Ossean Wastes, the vast desert. Please, rescue Muzaffar. We need him."

The following groups are related to this quest: Guardians (powerful spirits).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The Clockwork Core can be restored with Ordrak's Heart.

"You must overtake the Alchemist before he reaches the Clockwork Core. With the power of Ordrak's Heart, he could destroy the barrier between the worlds, which would mean the end of everything.
You must defeat the Alchemist and seize the Heart. He intends to use it for destruction, but, infused with the energy stolen from the Guardians, it now has the power to restore the Clockwork Core, and repair the damage to the barrier."

"Please, help me! Our dear little ones wandered into that cave! My husband Finnas ventured after them, but it is crawling with nasty creatures, and he hasn't returned!

The weather is getting harsh, so we were making one last run for supplies before winter. Oh, I'm beside myself with worry! Please, find Finnas and our precious babies! You have to help us! This is an RPG quest from Torchlight II.
The quest-giver is called Fazeer Shah. Fazeer Shah is a djinni.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to perform three tasks for Fazeer Shah's amusement.
The player should first recover Fazeer Shah's Lamp of Wonders from the Tu'tara to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Sadwa Mesa, a mesa.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: Fazeer Shah will undo whatever the Artificer and the Alchemist have done to the Guardian.
The following characters are related to this quest: Guardian (the player's ally who was enchanted by the Artificer and the Alchemist), Artificer (a powerful man, and the player's enemy), Alchemist (an evil, powerful man allied with the Artificer).
The following items are related to this quest: Lamp of Wonders (a djinni lamp).
The following groups are related to this quest: Tu'tara (monstrous reptiles).
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"The Artificer and the Alchemist might be formidable, but even their combined powers are nothing more than parlor tricks to one such as me. I can easily undo anything that they have done to your "Guardian." I will of course require something in return.
My only real enemy in this desert is boredom. I will make you a bargain: Perform three tasks for my amusement. If your struggles provide suitable entertainment, then, and only then, will I free your Guardian.
Your first task: Journey to the Sadwa Mesa, and recover my Lamp of Wonders from the Tu'tara!"

The player should first get Mask of a Murderer, Thorns as Hard as Iron, and Black Heart of a Coward to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Blightbogs, a bog.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: a special concoction that will make the player famous for generations to come.

"Another customer for one of old Cacklespit's brews, eh? I can provide a special concoction, free of charge...if you aren't afraid to get your hands a little dirty.
As any true cook will tell you, the finest ingredients are of the utmost importance if you want to create something truly special. I will require three items to brew the special mixture I have in mind...
The Mask of a Murderer, Thorns as Hard as Iron, and the Black Heart of a Coward.
All three are to be found here in the bogs - you only have to find them!
Once I brew the ingredients properly, your name will be known for generations to come!"

The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: Clockwork Core (a device that upholds the barriers between different worlds).
The following characters are related to this quest: Dark Alchemist (an evil man who has stolen the energy of three Guardians), Railmaster (a male transport expert).
The following items are related to this quest: .
The following groups are related to this quest: Guardians (powerful spirits who uphold the balance between the elements), Netherim (numerous demons residing in another world).
The following locations are related to this quest: Grunnheim (a haunted forest).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player thought that the Dark Alchemist is after the Guardian Of Air's power: he left the desert for Grunnheim. The Dark Alchemist is powerful enough to destroy the barrier between the player's world and the realm of the Netherim.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Let us return to the matter of the Dark Alchemist. He has now stolen the energy of three Guardians, and we thought he desired my power as well. But, for some reason, he has left the desert, and is now en route to Grunnheim.
That can only mean that he is bound for the Clockwork Core. With the power he has amassed, he could destroy the barrier between our world and the realm of the Netherim. They would pour through by the millions.
Seek the Railmaster, and depart for Grunnheim as soon as you are able."

If you can reach the Emberworks, it should be child's play to recharge it.

The following characters are related to this quest: Hareph (a male demolition master).

There are some important facts concerning this quest. Hareph sent the player to find his demolition crew: he gave the player explosives. Some Skara hives seem to be infected with something.

"Ah, Hareph sent you with some explosives. Finally some good news!
Don't bother looking for the rest of the crew - I'm the only one that survived. 
There's something wrong with some of the Skara hives - they seem to be infected. You'll need to locate the rigged hives and detonate them, then descend into the Brood Hive itself and destroy any infected eggs you find. Perhaps you will discover what has been blighting the eggs!
This is a great task, but it must be done. We will all be in your debt."

This is an RPG quest from Torchlight II.
The quest-giver is called Felicia. Felicia is a woman.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to restart your adventure.
The player should first ask Felicia to show you the way to complete their objective.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"You seem weary - perhaps you are in need of a fresh perspective. If you so desire, I can allow you to retrace your steps with all of the knowledge you currently possess. Simply ask, and I can show you the way!"
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from Torchlight II.
The quest-giver is called Cam. Cam is a researcher the player has helped before.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to recover the Heartfire Stone for yourself.
The player should first claim the key to Vyrax's Tower to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Forgotten Halls, an ancient dungeon.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: Heartfire Stone (a rare and powerful artifact the confers to its wielder the power of dragonfire).
The following characters are related to this quest: Vyrax (an ancient dragon who has hoarded treasure, located at Vyrax's Tower).
The following locations are related to this quest: Vyrax's Tower, a tower in Rivenskull Gorge, Rivenskull Gorge (a region).
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Hello again! I think I may be able to repay the favor you've done for us.
I've been doing some research, and have uncovered some interesting information about Vyrax, the ancient dragon who still dwells in the tower in Rivenskull Gorge.
The interesting bit is this - Vyrax has amidst his hoard a Heartfire Stone, which confers to its wielder the power of dragonfire. It is a rare and powerful artifact that would surely aid you.
If you wish to find the Heartfire Stone, you will need to first claim the key to Vyrax's Tower, in the depths of the Forgotten Halls.
Good luck!"
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from Torchlight II.
The quest-giver is called Fade. Fade is an immortal spirit who covets the remains of the living, who is located at Sundered Battlefield.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to bring 4 skulls of famous warriors to Fade.
The player should first find 4 skulls of famous warriors to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Sundered Battlefield, an ancient battleground.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: Fade shows the player the way to Cacklespit's Realm.
The following items are related to this quest: 4 skulls of famous warriors.
The following locations are related to this quest: Cacklespit's Realm (a hidden realm).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player has summoned Fade: the player wants to enter Cacklespit's Realm.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I am Fade - why have you summoned me?
Ah, you want to enter Cacklespit's hidden realm. Yes, I know the way - but I do not provide service without compensation.
I have very particular... appetites. The remains of the living are infused with a lingering residue of deeds past, which sustains me. Bring me the skulls of four warriors of renown, and I will take you where you wish to go. This battlefield is littered with the bones of great heroes. Your search should not be difficult."
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from Torchlight II.
The quest-giver is called Forgotten Hero. Forgotten Hero is a ghost of a long-dead hero.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to master all challenges.
The player should first defeat the 5 Spectral Champions to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Crows' Pass, a pass.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: the Forgotten Hero's most prized possession.
The player will encounter the following enemies during this quest: 5 Spectral Champions (ghosts of champions).
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I have been dead a very long time, and in all those centuries, I have not found one soul worthy of taking up the mantle of hero, as I once did, and seeking adventure.
Will you be that hero? I offer you five challenges. Defeat each of the five Spectral Champions in Crows' Pass: these ghostly champions will be your challenges. Should you master them all, my most prized possession is yours..."

The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to meet Duros the Blade in Zeryphesh.
The player should first see if your luck holds out to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Zeryphesh, a town.
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player saved Duros the Blade from imprisonment.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Finally saved! Thank you! You look like a person who likes risk! I'm heading back to town now. Meet me there and see if your luck holds out!"

This is an RPG quest from Torchlight II.
The quest-giver is called Fazeer Shah. Fazeer Shah is a djinni.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to complete Fazeer Shah's second task.
The player should first survive to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Portal, a portal to another place.
The following groups are related to this quest: Tu'tara (monstrous reptiles).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player survived Fazeer Shah's first task with the Tu'tara.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"You survived the Tu'tara more or less in one piece. Congratulations. But it occurs to me that you didn't do anything that you wouldn't ordinarily have done. This second task should prove much more amusing.
Step through the Portal. Your second task... is to survive!"

This is an RPG quest from Torchlight II.
The quest-giver is called Jessa. Jessa is an anxious woman from Estheria, who is located at Jessa and her father's camp.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to discover Jessa's father's fate.
The player should first find Jessa's father to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: the catacombs, where dark things live.
The following items are related to this quest: Wraithring (an ancient artifact which is said to have power over death).
The following locations are related to this quest: Estheria (a country), Temple (a temple in Estheria).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Jessa and her father came here to recover the Wraithring: they wanted to bring it to the Temple for study. Jessa's father wears a locket around his neck.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Please, traveler! Wait a moment! I am Jessa - a traveler from Estheria. My father and I came to this place to recover an ancient artifact - the Wraithring - which is said to have power over death itself. We sought to bring it to the Temple for study.
My father entered the catacombs while I tended our camp - but he has not returned, and there are dark things stirring below.
Please - I only ask that you discover his fate - perhaps he is wounded and only needs aid to escape!
If the worst comes to pass... he wears a locket around his neck, and you will know him by it."
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from Torchlight II.
The quest-giver is called Professor Stoker. Professor Stoker is the player's ally, who is located at Imperial Camp.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to open the Great Door.
The player should first find a power source for the dwarven automaton to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Scrapworks, a dangerous junkyard.
The following characters are related to this quest: Alchemist (the player's male enemy).
The following items are related to this quest: Clockwork Core (a terrible machine).
The following locations are related to this quest: Great Door (a door that leads to the Clockwork Core).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The Alchemist came through the Imperial Camp an hour ago: he went through the Great Door and sealed it behind him. The Great Door leads to the Clockwork Core.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I wish you had gotten here sooner! The Alchemist came through here about an hour ago. He laid waste to the camp and then went through the Great Door, there - sealed it shut behind him.
We believe that door leads to the Clockwork Core. We've been unable to open it ourselves, but we know how in theory. See that dwarven automaton? It's designed to open the door, but it's missing its Power Source. There should be one in the Scrapworks, but it was too dangerous for us to enter. Perhaps you will have more luck."
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from Torchlight II.
The quest-giver is called Fazeer Shah. Fazeer Shah is a djinni.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to free the Guardian by humiliating Ezrek Khan.
The player should first steal Ezrek Khan's Lamp of Marvels to complete their objective.
The following characters are related to this quest: Guardian (the player's ally who was enchanted by Ezrek Khan), Ezrek Khan (a male djinni, and Fazeer Shah's old rival).
The following items are related to this quest: Lamp of Marvels (a djinni lamp).
The following groups are related to this quest: Netherim (demonic creatures).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player successfully completed their previous tasks to Fazeer Shah: this is the player's final task. Ezrek Khan draws his power from the same source as the Netherim: the Netherim will oppose the player should they challenge Ezrek Khan.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Well, well. You are much more determined... and capable... than I had suspected! Excellent...
Now, to your final task. If you truly wish to free the Guardian, you must humiliate my old rival, Ezrek Khan, by stealing his precious Lamp of Marvels.
Be warned: Ezrek Khan draws his power from the same source as the Netherim. His realm borders closely on theirs; they will almost certainly stand against you, should you challenge the djinni."

This is an RPG quest from Torchlight II.
The quest-giver is called Medrus. Medrus is a badly injured man.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to help Medrus treat himself.
The player should first bring some Merryweather Leaves to Medrus to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: around here.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: Medrus will reward the player.
The following items are related to this quest: Merryweather Leaves (a healing herb).
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Hello! I thought I heard someone moving around out there.
Listen, my name's Medrus. I got ambushed by some raiders, and managed to get clear... but I got pretty badly injured in the process. I can treat it, but I need some Merryweather Leaves. They grow around here, but I'm too weak to look for them.
Think you can find some for me, bring 'em back here? You'll be rewarded, I promise."

This is an RPG quest from Torchlight II.
The quest-giver is called Trill. Trill is a great bard who received a blow to the head in Torchlight.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to find the 3 sisters.
The player should first investigate a tree trunk in an area full of spiders to complete their objective.
The following locations are related to this quest: Veras (a land), Torchlight (a city in Veras that was destroyed), Redhaven (a city in Veras).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Trill is known throughout Veras: from Torchlight to Redhaven.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Greetings! I am the great bard Trill. You've heard of me of course, my talent is known throughout all of Veras. From Torchlight to Redhaven they sing of my.. songs.
Torchlight... did something happen there? I feel a bit... Ah, nevermind. I recognize this place!
The spiders called, the Sisters three, the old trunk yawning wide,
Through ancient halls, dark ancestry, they met their fates inside.
An apt verse, you'll agree. I wrote it myself of course.
The rest of the song eludes me... Leniency please! Of course such a lapse is unforgivable in a great bard such as myself, but I feel a bit.. off.
Still, even that bare fragment of verse can lead you to glory. Go forth, brave warrior, and slay the mighty beasts! Whatever they may be..."
<|endoftext|>

The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to stop the Alchemist before it's too late.
The player should first go to the Ossean Wastes with the help of Commander Vale to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Ossean Wastes, a large desert.
The following characters are related to this quest: Guardian (a powerful spirit), Alchemist (a man who has Ordrak's Heart).
The following items are related to this quest: Ordrak's Heart (a destructive artifact).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Ordrak's Heart wreaking havoc. The Guardian wants the player to go to the Ossean Wastes.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I don't know if the Alchemist understands that Ordrak's Heart is wreaking such havoc... or if he just doesn't care! I hope there's still a chance to stop him, one way or another, before it's too late.
So the Guardian wants you to head to the Ossean Wastes? You know what? I think I can help you with that..."

This is an RPG quest from Torchlight II.
The quest-giver is called Commander Vale. Commander Vale is the leader of the Vanquisher Corps, giving quest via "Bounty Board".
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to alleviate the threat of the Sturmbeorn.
The player should first kill 10 Sturmbeorn to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Temple Steppes, a grassland plain.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: bounty.
The player will encounter the following enemies during this quest: 10 Sturmbeorn (savage raiders attacking the Estherians and the settlers of the Empire).
The following items are related to this quest: "Bounty Board" (a bounty board).
The following groups are related to this quest: Vanquisher Corps (a military outfit), Estherians (a race of people).
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"BOUNTY!
The Sturmbeorn raiders are a threat to the Estherians and to the brave settlers of the Empire. Commander Vale is authorized to pay a reward to anyone who assists the Vanquisher Corps in ridding the Temple Steppes of these savage brutes.
This bounty shall be paid to anyone who slays 10 or more Sturmbeorn in the Temple Steppes."

The player should first go after the Alchemist to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Broken Mines, mines.
The following characters are related to this quest: Alchemist (the player's desperate male enemy, located at Broken Mines).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The Alchemist went into the Broken Mines: he is nearing his goal.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"This is the only entrance to the Broken Mines that we've found, so the Alchemist is almost certainly in there. That probably means he's near his goal, whatever that is... and that means he'll do everything he can to keep you from stopping him. He'll be even more desperate, more dangerous.
I don't know what we'll encounter in there."

This is an RPG quest from Torchlight II.
The quest-giver is called Jadok. Jadok is a man who knows the player, who is located at Icedeep Caverns.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to figure out how to stop the Alchemist.
The player should first find the 3 Alchemist's Journals that remain to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Icedeep Caverns, icy caverns where dangerous creatures dwell.
The following characters are related to this quest: Alchemist (a villainous man).
The following items are related to this quest: 3 Alchemist's Journals (a series of journals written by the Alchemist), Ordrak's Heart (a dangerous artifact).
The following locations are related to this quest: Torchlight (a town).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Jadok found volume 4 of Alchemist's Journals: it describes entering the mine at Torchlight and retrieving Ordrak's Heart.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Your arrival is well-timed. I believe I have located the Alchemist's lair, here in the Icedeep Caverns. I found a Journal just inside the entrance; it speaks of entering the mine at Torchlight and retrieving Ordrak's Heart. I intended to look for more, further inside the icy caverns, but the creatures dwelling there now are too much for me.
Finding the rest of the Alchemist's Journals would probably be very helpful in ascertaining how to stop him. The one I saw was volume four, so there are probably three more in the Icedeep Caverns."

This is an RPG quest from Torchlight II.
The quest-giver is called Robot Eye. Robot Eye is an arrogant person guarding the door.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to recover the Crown from Thiss, and bring it to Robot Eye.
The player should first find Thiss to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Forgotten Halls, a dungeon.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: the player will be allowed through the door.
The following characters are related to this quest: Thiss (a great spectral dragon who stole the Crown from Robot Eye, located at Forgotten Halls).
The following items are related to this quest: Crown (Robot Eye's family heirloom).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player told Robot Eye that the player wants to go through the door.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"You want through THIS door? Ha! Well, it's not as simple as that. Everything has a price - you must know that by now.
If you can solve a problem for us, we will solve a problem for you by letting you through the door. Thiss, the great Spectral Dragon, has kept something of ours for many long years. We would like it back - and you will get it for us, oh yes.
There is a Crown, a... family heirloom that he stole from us. He will not give it up easily, of course. But this door is im-PENETRABLE - so you've got a much better chance with Thiss than you do waiting around here.
You can find Thiss in the Forgotten Halls... good luck! You're going to need it."

This is an RPG quest from Torchlight II.
The quest-giver is called Officer. Officer is a military officer working for the Professor.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to clear the way to the Scrapworks.
The player should first find dynamite to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Abandoned Sawmill, a dysfunct sawmill.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: you'll be able to pass though to the Scrapworks.
The following characters are related to this quest: Professor (a man).
The following locations are related to this quest: Scrapworks (a junkyard).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The Professor sent the player after the power source in the Scrapworks: the Officer and his troop are on the same mission. The Officer sent his troop to the Abandoned Sawmill: he has not heard from them.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"So, the Professor sent you after the Power Source? We were on the same mission, but the only way to the Scrapworks is through that pile of rock.
I know the Abandoned Sawmill used to have plenty of explosives from when the place was still in operation - a little bit of dynamite would probably get the job done here.
I sent my troop after it, but haven't heard a thing. If you can head up there and get that dynamite, we could all pass through and get the Professor what he needs."

This is an RPG quest from Torchlight II.
The quest-giver is called Hareph. Hareph is a relieved Zeraphi master of explosives, who is located at an outpost.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to help the Zeraphi any way you can.
The player should first search for surviving Zeraphi to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Swarm Point, a Skara nest.
The following groups are related to this quest: Skara (aggressive, dangerous, flying insects), Zeraphi (a race of people).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Hareph and his Zeraphi crew came to the outpost to deal with the Skara: the crew went to investigate the stacks and never came back. Hareph gives the player explosives.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I'm so relieved you have arrived! My crew and I journeyed to this outpost to deal with the increasingly aggressive Skara.
I remained here to fashion additional explosives while my crew investigated the stacks, but they never returned. I have been unable to leave here because of the swarming Skara.
Please take these explosives with you and journey to Swarm Point, and search for any surviving Zeraphi and help them in any way you can!"

This is an RPG quest from Torchlight II.
The quest-giver is called Elder Valin. Elder Valin is a man who was planning to enter the Watchweald Portal.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to use the Ember Keys to open the Watchweald Portal.
The player should first get the Passkey Ember from the slavers, and Latchkey Ember from the goblins to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Old Estherian Refuge, an area.
The following items are related to this quest: Ember Keys (the keys that are used to open the Watchweald Portal), Passkey Ember (one of the Ember Keys), Latchkey Ember (one of the Ember Keys).
The following locations are related to this quest: Watchweald Portal (a portal in the Old Estherian Refuge).
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I was planning to enter the Watchweald Portal in the Old Estherian Refuge. Unfortunately the keys have been stolen. Goblin miners took one, and we believe that some slavers who recently moved into the area have the other. It takes both keys to activate the Watchweald Portal... and it is beyond my abilities to retrieve them.
Recover the Passkey Ember from the slavers, and the Latchkey Ember from the goblins. You can use them to open the Portal in the Refuge."

This is an RPG quest from Torchlight II.
The quest-giver is called Lord Taldimut. Lord Taldimut is the player's old friend, who promised the player a a greater reward if the player came to visit him in Ossean Wastes, who is located at Ossean Wastes.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to help Lord Taldimut gather up weapons and armor from the Celestial Armory without Ezrohir noticing.
The player should first use the Golden Gear to get inside the Celestial Armory, and activate the Armory Portal to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Celestial Armory, Lord Taldimut's armory that houses some of the finest weapons.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: the player's choice of artifacts from the Celestial Armory.
The following items are related to this quest: Armory Portal (a hidden portal to the Celestial Armory).
The following groups are related to this quest: Ezrohir (Lord Taldimut's enemies).
The following locations are related to this quest: Ossean Wastes (a desert).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Ezrohir have the Celestial Armory under siege.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"It's good to see you again, my friend! I know that I promised you a greater reward, should you come to visit... but that was before I returned to the Ossean Wastes and found the Celestial Armory under siege by Ezrohir.
What if I give you your choice of artifacts from the Armory? The Celestial Armory houses some of the finest weapons in the world! You have but to use the Golden Gear to get inside, then activate the Armory Portal, which will allow us to gather up the weapons and armor safely... with the Ezrohir none the wiser!"

Can you get into the Warbeast den, in the Bone Defile, and get rid of whatever's making them so vicious?"

This is an RPG quest from Torchlight II.
The quest-giver is called Lord Taldimut. Lord Taldimut is a Zeraphi ambassador, the leader of the Zeraphi envoy, who is located at Frosted Hills.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to help Lord Taldimut narrow down the location of the Golden Gear.
The player should first find the 3 crests for Lord Taldimut to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Frosted Hills, frozen hills.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: Lord Taldimut will reward the player.
The following characters are related to this quest: Grand Regent Eldrayn (the leader of the Estherians).
The following items are related to this quest: Golden Gear (important object related to defense of Zeraphi), 3 crests, created by the Estherians, together form a map that shows the exact location of the Golden Gear.
The following groups are related to this quest: Ezrohir (a hostile race of people who will start a war with Zeraphi), Zeraphi (a race of people), Estherians (a race of people, friendly towards the Zeraphi).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The player saved Lord Taldimut and his Zeraphi envoy from goblins. Grand Regent Eldrayn allowed Lord Taldimut and his Zeraphi envoy to search for the Golden Gear.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"My friend, thank you for coming to our aid. I am Lord Taldimut, the leader of this Zeraphi envoy, sent to procure the Estherians' aid in our upcoming war with the Ezrohir. Grand Regent Eldrayn gave us leave to search the Frosted Hills for the Golden Gear, and we had narrowed our search to these chilly hills before we were assaulted by these goblins.
Now we are too injured to continue our search. Can you aid us? The exact location of the Golden Gear is long forgotten, but the Estherians created a map from three crests. If you can find those, I can interpret the map and find the Gear! Search the Frosted Hills for the crests. Bring them to me, and I will reward you, on behalf of the Zeraphi people."
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from Torchlight II.
The quest-giver is called Destroyer. Destroyer is a male hero.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to head up the pass to the Enclave, and warn the Estherians that the Alchemist is coming to them.
The player should first find Commander Vale and let her know what happened to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Enclave, the home of the Estherians.
The following characters are related to this quest: Alchemist (an evil man), Commander Vale (a woman, an old friend to the Destroyer, located at Enclave).
The following groups are related to this quest: Estherians (a race of people).
The following locations are related to this quest: Torchlight (a town).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. The Alchemist destroyed Torchlight.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"Someone needs to warn the Estherians. Head up the pass to their Enclave. Find my old friend, Commander Vale, and let her know what happened.
Tell them that the Alchemist destroyed Torchlight, and is headed their way. He may be there already..."
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from Torchlight II.
The quest-giver is called Commander Vale. Commander Vale is a human military leader.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to go to the Watchweald Temple.
The player should first take Crows' Pass to the Frosted Hills to catch up to the Grand Regent before he enters the Watchweald Temple to complete their objective.
The following characters are related to this quest: Grand Regent (a male Estherian infected with the plague).
The following groups are related to this quest: Estherians (human-like creatures of magical nature).
The following locations are related to this quest: Watchweald Temple (a temple), Crows' Pass (a pass), Frosted Hills (hills).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. This plague targets beings of an inherently magical nature, not humans.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"This plague seems to specifically target beings of an inherently magical nature, such as the Estherians. So far it's not affecting humans, so I've sent for a transport to bring us some medical supplies, and I'll be coordinating the medical relief here.
Meanwhile, you need to get out to the Watchweald Temple. Take Crows' Pass to the Frosted Hills. Try to catch up to the Grand Regent before he enters the temple."
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from Torchlight II.
The quest-giver is called Lord Taldimut. Lord Taldimut is a man from Zeryphesh.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to help Lord Taldimut bring the Golden Gear to Zeryphesh.
The player should first recover the Golden Gear to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Whispering Cave, a deep cave.
The following items are related to this quest: Golden Gear (important object related to defense of Zeryphesh).
The following groups are related to this quest: Ezrohir (a hostile race of people).
The following locations are related to this quest: Zeryphesh (a city sieged by Ezrohir).
There are some important facts concerning this quest. Lord Taldimut has been studying the crests.
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"I have continued studying the crests, and I am more convinced than ever that the Golden Gear is hidden in the the Whispering Cave. If you can retrieve it, I can bring it back to Zeryphesh, to aid in the city's defense against the Ezrohir siege."
<|endoftext|>

This is an RPG quest from Torchlight II.
The quest-giver is called Sphinx. Sphinx is the riddle-speaking guardian of the gate, who is located at the entrance to the Forsaken Vaults, at a desert.
The quest-giver gives a quest to the player. The player's objective is to bring the skin of the Manticore to the Sphinx.
The player should first kill the Manticore to complete their objective. This task can be completed in the following location: Stygian Aerie, a Manticore nest.
The player will receive the following rewards for completing the quest objective: the Sphinx allows the player passage through the gate.
The player will encounter the following enemies during this quest: Manticore (a half drake, a half lion beast).
This is the quest description, the quest-giver explaining the quest to the player:
"My ancient charge, to guard the gate
The desert sands to contemplate.
In Stygian realm lurks beast of yore
Part drake, part lion: Manticore.
Lay its skin before my eyes
And passage through shall be your prize."
<|endoftext|>
